campaign.story:
History has rarely been told from a woman’s point of view. Good Girls Don’t Make History is a graphic novel that amplifies the voices of female legends from 1840 to the present day. Reliving moments from the lives of Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Alice Paul, Ida B. Wells, and Susan B. Anthony, we boldly tell the inspiring stories from one of the most formative eras in women’s history—the fight for the vote in the United States. Our tale begins at a modern-day polling station in California with a mother and daughter voting together, then flashes back 180 years to the World Anti-Slavery Convention where the women's movement got its legendary start. The twists and turns take readers across the country and through time illuminating parallels between epic battles for liberty in the past and eerily similar struggles for justice today.  
Designed for a young adult audience, but meaningful for all ages and genders, Good Girls Don't Make History, is a story about strength, resilience, and persistence. Women's rights advocates, history buffs, and anyone passionate about making a difference in the future of America will love this book. Building on the achievements of the fight for women's vote can help us create a better reality for generations to come. Future books in this series will cover sagas of African American, Native American, and Asian American women fighting for their freedom. 
Our books are printed at the highest quality, with thick glossy paper and a thicker matte cover stock. It's important to us that the graphic novel feels good and will last 100 years. If we hit our stretch goal of $11,000, we will print with hardcover.
NEW STRETCH GOAL:  $12,500.  For every additional $1,500 we raise over $11,000, a double-page spread will be added to the book.  These homages will be modern-day reinterpretations of classic works from the suffrage-era.
Additional modern interpretations of historical masterpieces
Elizabeth Kiehner leads digital transformation at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. Elizabeth is a popular thought leader on the topics of artificial intelligence and creativity and she is a TED speaker. As a former business owner and executive at IBM, Kiehner is taking a stand to promote and advocate for gender equity. Her 10-year-old daughter Agnes is growing up with a confidence and fearlessness mother did not have. Elizabeth is writing this book to harness some critical lessons  from the past and embolden women’s action, engagement, and involvement across the public and private sectors. Her mission is to inspire others to set audacious personal goals, and continue the fight for gender parity in all spheres of life. Elizabeth is a former columnist for Inc. magazine and serves on the board of directors for several women’s organizations including Upward, SheSays, Women in Innovation, and Women in Tech.
Keith Olwell is a film and video director and editor living in New York. His passion for making things has led him to work on everything from music videos to StarTalk with Neil deGrasse Tyson as well as national advertising campaigns for major brands. With his creative partner Elizabeth Kiehner, Keith produced "The Legends of Science" cards, highlighting the people and achievements of many of the world's greatest scientists. Moved by both the hundred-year anniversary of women’s right to vote and the disturbing events following the 2016 election, Keith has focused his energy on researching and producing a graphic novel celebrating the exciting story of women’s fight for the vote in America. “We just thought it could be told in a dynamic way because it’s a riveting story, not an austere one,” Keith says.
Kara Coyle is Creative Director at advertising agency Mekanism. Working in an industry where only 11% of Creative Directors are women, Coyle has become a voice for gender equality and representation in advertising and beyond. In 2017, Coyle was selected by Cannes Lions as one of the top 15 rising female creative leaders worldwide. Her participation in this global network has led her to speak at events from New York to Bulgaria, championing greater female representation in the creative industry worldwide. Her work has been featured in notable outlets from Time to Mashable, as well as recognized with numerous national and international awards, including Cannes Lions, The One Show, and D&AD.
Micaela Dawn is an illustrator who works across a variety of genres and mediums. Her main focus is creating bold, colorful works of art that have roots in fantasy and mythology. She also has a passion for developing art that comments on the continued need for diversity while helping empower women and minorities. She is most enthusiastic about cover art for comics and novels, concept art for video games, and illustrations for board games, where she utilizes her distinctive style to tell stories. Her art has been recognized by Spectrum Fantastic Art, Infected by Art, and the AUArts Alumni Horizon Award. 
August 26, 2020 is the 100th anniversary of women's right to vote in the United States. Many public-school educations include Susan B. Anthony and Elizabeth Cady Stanton as part of the curriculum but neglect to mention the hundreds of women who risked their lives to fight for women's equal representation. We stand together at a moment in history when hard-fought civil rights are in danger of backsliding as injustice and imbalance continue to shroud the lives of many. Good Girls Don't Make History is designed to inspire action and rouse the next generation of women to continue the fight for simple equality. Nothing more, nothing less. 
Timeline
Receive Kickstarter Funds: August 31st
Finishing art production: August–October
Deliver ebook: November
Book manufacturing and freight: December
Expected delivery to U.S. Backers: January
Expected delivery to International Backers: mid-January
**A VERY IMPORTANT NOTE ON SHIPPING**
Shipping fees are not included in your pledge. Rather, all shipping will be charged after the campaign ends, just before the book ships.
This allows us to make sure you are paying the lowest possible shipping fees. Backerkit will send surveys to each backer requesting their address and calculating shipping fees—which we will do all we can to minimize! 
We are a group of independent creators and using Kickstarter provides a chance for us to self-publish and produce this comic during a pandemic. Sure, we'd love to have a publisher one day, but we wanted to get the book out in 2020 for the centennial of ratification of the 19th amendment. This is a group of creators motivated by our love and passion for equality and the sharing of history in an accessible way and from a woman’s perspective.
We've already put hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars into this project. We're creating this to inspire the next generation of leaders. A successful Kickstarter campaign will allow us to cover costs to complete art, print the book, distribute the book, take it to conventions and hopefully continue the series to share the specific sagas of African American, Native American and Asian American women fighting for their rights. 
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We hope you can join this campaign and help to celebrate women that history forgot.

campaign.story:
Want to read the first EIGHT pages of CODE 45? Click here!
CODE 45 is 100 percent funded - thank you! 
Check out our amazing stretch goals! 
Code 45 is a 5-issue graphic novel about Vanessa, a subway driver in Montreal who hears rumors that there are 'dragons' in the tunnels, monstrous apparitions that seemingly defy any explanation.
Her co-workers are terrified of working nights because of what they've seen, and so a large number of them self-medicate to get through their shifts without giving in to fear and anxiety. Gradually, it's become impossible for them to tell what's real, and what's a hallucination brought on by their drug use.
Vanessa is transferred to the night shift and falls slowly into both this world and, thanks to her DJ roommate, the underground rave scene (a source of drugs and mayhem). She starts to witness things she can't explain, and is forced to confront a shocking secret from her past that will make her question everything she though she knew about her family, her job, and the nature of reality.
Issue #1 was funded in just 16 hours in March of 2020. Issue #2 and Issue #3 pick up the story with a 52 page mega-issue that takes us deeper into the darkness that Vanessa has discovered lurking inside Montreal's metro tunnels.  
In Issues #2-3, Vanessa starts her night shift duties and encounters a world quickly spinning out of her comprehension, forcing her to turn to a long-distant source of support as she begins to unravel the threads of the mystery confronting her. How much longer can she deny what's right before her eyes? - especially as the disappearances begin to multiply and even her own friends aren't safe from the forces stalking the tunnels.
 Both Issue #1 and the 52-page #2-#3 mega-issue are available via this campaign. 
Of course you will! But more specifically, if any of these things float your boat, you're going to love it:
 Stories that feature strong female protagonists, dragons, the subjectivity of reality, the underground rave scene, the paranormal, trance, the thin border that separates our world from fantasy, hardcore, a frank discussion of mental health, electronic dance music, and hallucinatory drugs.
 Movies and TV like A Scanner Darkly, Pan's Labyrinth, Jacob's Ladder, The X-Files, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Last Year at Marienbad.
 Writers including Terry Moore, Philip K. Dick, Dan Simmons, Richard K. Morgan, Douglas Coupland.
 Comics like Motor Girl, Wayward, Saucer Country.
"As soon as I read “There are dragons in the tunnels,” and saw the art that accompanied those words I was all in on CODE 45. The story and art kept getting better and better as I read through the amazing first issue. I highly recommend this comic and I personally can’t wait to see what happens next!"
- James Haick, President, Scout Comics & Entertainment, Inc.
"The art is really fantastic -- it has great layouts and flow, the characters are appealingly rendered, the backgrounds are wonderfully detailed, and it's all gorgeously coloured, with a powerful use of lighting. You really get a sense of space and presence, feeling like you're right there, in the scenes!"
- Wolfen Moondaughter, Sequential Tart.
 "Joe Ng's artwork is well complimented by colorist, Josh Perez's, vibrant palette, especially in the second half of the issue...If you like to have a dose of reality to go with your fantasy, this a book to pick up and read."
 - Sequential Magazine
Creatively, there were many things we wanted to explore in the Code 45 universe. Writer Benjamin Hunting spent a lot of time in the underground Montreal rave scene in the early 2000s, and he had never seen it depicted before in a graphic novel - or, well, anywhere.
"Montreal is perhaps North America’s most ignored metropolis when it comes to media representation. I wanted to showcase the city that I love from the perspective I had when I first moved here in the late 1990s. I spent a lot of my early years here exploring the city from within the metro tunnels," says Benjamin.
"Montreal’s metro is unique in that each station was individually designed by a Canadian architect at the end of the 1960s, which means no two are alike.  The metro is also notable for having a number of stations that were dug out and never put into service, which made them the perfect setting for a number of the subterranean activities that take place in Code 45 – including the underground music scene, which figures prominently in both the book and my own life."
He combined that with the desire to talk about very real mental health issues facing people living not just in Montreal but around the globe.
"Using fantasy as a bridge to being able to discuss not just the questions of subjective reality and how we perceive the world around us, but also to broach the topics of depression and mental illness, and how that impacts both individuals and society, is something very personal to me," continues Benjamin.
The ability to link these concepts together within the framework of a shared hallucinatory world where the perception of reality is not necessarily universal was something that drew in artist Joe Ng. Sinking that deep below Montreal's streets and exploring the city's subterranean metro tunnels  provided a seldom-seen perspective from which to explore Code 45's characters and concepts. Together with Angela Hodge (designer) and Josh Perez (colorist), the team was able to weave a story that peels back the silence and cranks up the bass to the point where the narrative is shaking the ground like an out-of-control train. 
Code 45 Issue #1 has already been printed and shipped to our first round of Kickstarter supporters from our initial campaign. We have additional copies ready to go as part of our current set of rewards for anyone joining us for the first time.
The funding from this campaign will be used to pay for the art, coloring, and lettering as we continue the series. It will also cover the printing and shipping costs of the 52-page Code 45 #2-3 mega-issue. Overall, we intend to continue using Kickstarter to fund the art costs for the remaining  issues of Code 45 prior to its retail release by Scout Comics in 2021. 
Artist - Joe Ng. His first comics job was drawing Transformers for the Toronto-based company Dreamwave Productions. After that he was picked up by Udon Entertainment to work on a Transformers / G.I. Joe crossover book published by Devil's Due Publishing. He is best known for his work on the Udon Street Fighter comics but has also worked on many other video game properties such as Soul Caliber, Dark Stalkers, Nintendo's ARMS, and Overwatch.
Writer - Benjamin Hunting. A full-time freelancer who over the last decade has been published in the New York Daily News, Motor Trend, Super Street, Toronto Star, and National Post, as well as numerous other magazines and online publications. He has also self-published a literary novel. This is his first graphic novel.
Graphic Design / Lettering - Angela Hodge. Started her career as a children’s book illustrator for Cornucopia Books before her foray into graphic design. After a period of paying her dues as a lowly layout artist, she stumbled into 3D modeling and now enjoys a challenging career as a physical product designer.
Colorist - Josh Perez. Born in Germany, raised in Texas, and  resides in the incredibly humid world(it's its own world, promise) of  Florida. As an artist and colorist he's been with  the comic industry since 2003 and has worked with a lot of the  franchises he's grown up with as a kid. Not only done work for  comics (IDW, Dreamwave, Fun Publications), but cartoons, toys, and the odd video game or two, as well. He is mostly known for his work on with the Transformers, Street Fighter, and Mega Man licenses.
Our team has worked with a wide range of publishers
 The Comics
Issue 1 is a 28-page, full-color gateway to the world of Code 45, complete with concept art and a page listing the names of each of our supporters who chose a tier that included 'Thanks' inside the book itself.
The #2-3 mega-issue is a 52-page, full-color Kickstarter-exclusive edition that will never be offered at retail or by any other publisher.
The B+W Edition
Code 45's original black and white edition was so beautifully inked by artist Joe Ng that we decided to make it available as a limited-edition digital copy for fans of highly atmospheric line-work.
 The Enamel Pin 
Not guaranteed to protect you against dragons, but definitely works to identify you as a lover of the underground. We have a limited number of these still available on certain rewards tiers.
The Stickers
For those who love to stickerbomb, these fantastic Joe Ng dragon heads make the perfect hand-grenade for laptops, public transit stops, or DJ decks.
The Postcard Set
Available in our catch-up rewards tiers that collect Issues #1-3 together is the set of four exclusive postcard-sized prints selected from the pages, panels, and concept art of Code 45 that were sent out with each copy of Issue 1 in our original Kickstarter campaign.
A Trio Of 8.5"x11" Prints
Get a larger look at the visual world of Code 45 with a color print from artist Joe Ng. We're offering a choice of either the cover of Issue 1, the cover of Issue 2, or the original promo print. We will contact you to verify which one you want after the campaign has ended.
Become A Character
Have you ever wanted to see your face in a comic book? If that's the case, then we've added a reward that's perfect for you! Artist Joe Ng will add you as a background character in an upcoming issue of Code 45. This is your chance to view yourself in your finest early-2000s finery, or discover what you looked like as a raver, or maybe put on a virtual - and vintage - STCUM uniform.
The Dragon Head Sketch 
Get closer to the dragons of Code 45 than you would ever be able to in the metro tunnels with a gorgeous 6"x8" sketch from Joe Ng.
Issue 2 has already been completed, with the art for Issue 3 currently in progress. We plan on transmitting the completed mega-issue to the printer by mid-September at the latest, at the same time as we send out the digital versions of the book.  Artist Joe Ng will also finish the dragon heads from the reward tiers at this time. 
We expect a 2-week turnaround at the printer which is located in Canada. Since we can pick up locally, we won't have any shipping delays to deal with. We're giving ourselves two weeks from picking up each book to sign and ship out each of the rewards, which translates into a mid-October delivery. We most likely will need only half that time, but we'd rather underpromise and over-deliver to make sure everyone gets their rewards on-time. 
(Wait, what are stretch goals?)
Stretch goals are our way to say 'thank you' to everyone who supported us by adding extra rewards at no extra cost. Once we've reached our initial funding goal, the more our supporters share and talk about Code 45, and the more orders we receive for the book, the more we can offer to those who have already pledged for a print version of the issue at any tier.
Stretch Goal #1 @ CA $14,000 - Page-By-Page Audio Commentary from Benjamin (writer) and Joe (artist)
As a thank you for getting us to $14,000, we are offering everyone who purchased either a print or digital copy of any issue an audio commentary track that will take you page-by-page through the book as Benjamin and Joe describe their creative choices, inspiration, and details that make up that slice of the Code 45 world. It will be available via an easy download link that will be sent to you at the conclusion of the campaign.
Stretch Goal #2 @ CA $15,000 - Exclusive Happy Hardcore DJ Mix Soundtrack from Kasper Klez + Paper Toy!  
If our overall total surpasses the $15,000 mark, everyone who purchased either a print or digital copy of any issue will receive a download link to an exclusive DJ mix from Kasper Klez, brought out of retirement from the early 2000s rave scene to bring you a dose of the happy hardcore energy from era depicted in Code 45. You also get a download link to one of designer Angela Hodge's competely-custom paper toys! 
Stretch Goal #3 @ CA $16,000 - Exclusive Dark Hardcore DJ Mix Soundtrack from Kasper Klez + 2nd Paper Toy
If our overall total surpasses the $16,000 mark, everyone who purchased either a print or digital copy of any issue will receive a download link to a SECOND exclusive DJ mix from Kasper Klez. This time it's a trip to the darker side of hardcore to serve as a soundtrack to Code 45's most dangerous moments. You also get a download link to a second competely-custom paper toy from designer Angela Hodge.
 Stretch Goal #4 @ CA $18,000 - One-Of-A-Kind STCUM Metro Map Print - Here Be Dragons! 
(Work-in-progress - we don't want to spoil the surprise!)
If our overall total surpasses the $18,000 mark, everyone who purchased a print copy of any issue will receive an 8.5x11 print of the early-2000s STCUM Metro map, complete with 'here be dragons' warnings for the unsuspecting traveling (in the form of Joe Ng's amazing dragon head sketch art).
 Stretch Goal #5 @ CA $22,000 - Limited Edition Code 45 Character Trading Cards
If our overall total surpasses the $22,000 mark, everyone who purchased a print copy of any issue will receive a set of four limited edition Code 45 character trading cards! These cards will depict four specially-chosen characters, and include stats and info on their origins not found anywhere else in the Code 45 universe.
We know it's important to you that you receive each of your rewards in the best possible condition. It's important to us too - which is why in addition to using Gemini flash mailers and ultra-stiff 9x12 reinforced mailers for our backed and bagged comic books, we're also sending a Shipping Dragon along to protect your package en route.
These Shipping Dragons are hatched from deep in Montreal's metro tunnels, and have sworn an oath to not let any harm come to your rewards while they are in transit. They are easy and fun to assemble, and they make excellent pets.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already shipped Code 45 Issue 1 on time to all of our supporters from our first campaign. This campaign is intended to fund the art costs associated with completing the 5-issue series, as well as pay for the printing and shipping costs of the Issue 2-3 mega-issue.

Members of our creative team happen to live in the vicinity of our printer, which is located in Canada, which means we can go pick up our issues immediately after they are printed - with no worries about shipping delays. All of our other printed rewards are sourced locally, and pins are already here at Code 45 HQ waiting to find a new home.

Our team has a history of delivering on-time art, writing, and design to publishers like IDW, Udon, Fun Publications, TakaraTomy, Dreamwave, Devil's Due Publishing, the New York Daily News, Motor Trend, Automobile Magazine, and Super Street. We are deadline-driven professionals who understand how important it is to meet the expectations of our audience.

We also have a publishing contract with Scout Comics to distribute a retail version of Code 45 in 2021, which further indicates the confidence that we as creators, and Scout as publishers, have in this project.

Reaching for 1 More Stretch Goal 🚀 — $3,750
Slot Machine has Landed on INK: Issue 2!!!
 We're working on a few different solo series and have been excited to get these out you all. This one will require a bit more work, but if you are all willing to go the distance, we will work on getting INK: Issue 2 released THIS YEAR!
We're looking for $750 to cover some costs for paying our amazing artists, ✍🎨💬 but if we can get this amount, we will fund the rest and get this favorite out to you and all those who've donated!
INK — A Solo Series by SeerNova Comics
This comic is a solo series within the same universe as The Seer Chronicles. This has been so well received and we have had so many readers ask "When is the next issue coming out?"  We started receiving this feedback the day we released it! 🤭
1st Stretch Goal Reached! 🥅☄
We've reached our goal!!! Stretch Goal Time!
Slot Machine Landed on SCALES!
Our next solo series: Scales Issue 1



We are back at it again! 😎 This time we dive deeper into the story of John Benson and his mysterious rebirth. 😮 We also introduce a few new characters and some new scenes to shake things up in Seer City. 😆
Two crime families 👥 an alcoholic 😵 and a monkey 🐒 walk into a bar... or restaurant? 🙊🍻
A new face is seen in Seer City! 👀 An alcoholic gambler—whose best friend runs secret experiments in his basement—learns the age-old lesson, "curiosity killed the monkey." 🤔 After a rough night, a freaky experiment, and a home invasion, this guy's day gets even better! 🤦‍♂️ Now that two major crime families of Seer City look to strike a major arms deal, he decides that now's a good time to be a "hero". 
SeerNova Comics Presents — The Seer Chronicles: Issue 2 - Family Matters
 While all this chaos is in the streets, our mysterious captor reveals his identity to the newly awakened John. 🥱 Something strange has happened to John, and we're not just talking about being abducted. 💪 As he learns more about himself and the accident, across the city, another man somehow evades death. 💀 And he's a little less grateful. 👿
The Seer Chronicles — Issue 2 📖
The Seer Chronicles: Family Matters is issue 2 of our graphic novel, The Seer Chronicles. Action, adventure, mysteries, and discoveries can be found in this issue. However, we aren't just giving you issue 2 of this! 🤨 We also have decided to remaster Issue 1 which has added details and a better flow than before. That means MORE PAGES TO READ! 🤯
The Seer Chronicles Issue 2
Rewards 🎁
We've got some cleverly named rewards to play off one of our new favorite characters and to keep you playing your hand.

I'm the Chief Tech Officer, Editor in Chief, and Co-Creator of  The SeerNova Comics Universe. When I’m not working on our website and squashing bugs I’m reading books, practicing martial arts, traveling, or networking.

 Dan Gorman, Artist

Dan Gorman is a trained Medical Illustrator with his BFA in Medical Illustration from the Cleveland Institute of Art (1999).  Dan began working as a Sketch Card Artist in 2010 and has since worked on over 150 Licensed Trading Card sets featuring properties that include but are not limited to Marvel, DC, Star Wars, Star Trek, Game of Thrones, Alien, The Lord of the Rings, Vampirella, Bettie Page, KISS, Rick & Morty, Steven Universe and AMC's The Walking Dead. 
In 2012, Dan began his career as a Comic Book penciler and has been published by Dark Horse (Grindhouse), AC Comics (FemForce), Empire Comics Lab (Cemetery Plots) and Source Point Press. (The Rejected, Kringle)  In 2015 Dan launched a weekly Internet Radio show about Comics and Pop Culture called "The Altered Realm" which he co-hosts on krmaradio.com every other Saturday Night from 8 pm-11 pm.  Dan is also a recurring Cover Artist for Psycho Drive-In's line of Horror/Sci-Fi Books available on Amazon.com.
Dan is a member in good standing of the National Cartoonists Society and creates a weekly webcomic for The Akron RubberDucks (Cleveland Indians Affiliate) Baseball team called RubberDucks Tales which posts weekly to their Instagram Stories. Dan recently signed on to pencil stories for a bi-monthly Comics Anthology called Mississippi Zombie for Caliber Comics and is also doing full artwork on a limited series for Source Point Press due out sometime in 2021.
Dan also helps run and promote several local Comicons and Pop Culture Cons, most notably The Akron Comicon, as well as helping manage Rubber City Comics in downtown Akron.  You can see more of Dan's work at dangormanart.com and be sure to follow him @GDanArtist on Twitter and Instagram!
Shaun Barbour, Inker
Shaun Barbour, SeerNova Comics Inker
Shaun Barbour resides in the northernmost part of California where he has done work as a Freelance Inker for Caliber Comics on the Mississippi Zombie anthology alongside Daniel Gorman. He has also managed to put out a comic of his own called Belial as both the Creator and the Inker with Chuck Pineau. When he isn’t working hard to support others on his journey in comics he manages to raise 4 children as a single father as well (which may account for his bald head). Always pushing honor and integrity in his pursuits, he is living proof of the passion that it takes to follow one's dreams while standing tall in the face of whatever life decides to dish out.
Febri Ferdian, Colorist
Febri Ferdian is a freelance illustrator from Indonesia. Have been working for several indie comic books since 2018 and focus as a colorist for comic books.
Febri Ferdian graduated from Padang State of University with Fine Art Education program study in 2016.
Febri has worked as a graphic designer, 2D traditional animator, webtoon artist, and storyboard artist for local 3D animation movies.
When he is not working as a colorist, he playing games, watching some movies, and drawing some doodle. Febri was an action figures enthusiastic too.
 Jérôme Gagnon, Letterer
Jérôme Gagnon, SeerNova Comics Letterer
A graphic designer by day and comic book letterer by night. I have been lettering comics actively for the past 3 years and working as a graphic designer in the print industry for over 20 years now. My previous lettering jobs vary from kids' books to horror. I lettered superhero books for Advent Comics, being part of The Mike Wieringo's Tellos Tribute as well as the Puerto Rico Strong fundraising anthology. I also took part in the first Blood, Skulls & Bones' Kickstarter Campaign and others such as Broke Down and 4 Dead Bodies (#1-3). You can find me on Instagram: @jeromecolorsandletters

The Summer of Progress
It has been a bit since our last update. Since the last update, we have a few new things to show off. By the way, backer names will be shouted out on our podcast tomorrow we are recording for Breakfast Talk/The Brunch Bulletin!

Digital Wallpapers
Yes, not only are you getting 1 wallpaper that can be for your desktop or phone, but up to 10 desktop wallpapers to choose from and up to 5 different wallpapers for your mobile device! 

Click here to get your wallpapers!

The Big Update
I apologize I didn't get to this yesterday. I got preoccupied with other tasks such as finishing up editing INK 2 with Dillon. Now onto this big update!

This update's purpose

I was going to do a big update because a fellow creator friend and backer did ask about the progress of this campaign and I will have access to my actual computer tomorrow due to me being at work right now. Anyways, here is a short version until tomorrow's update.

The Seer Chronicles Issue 2 is in the process of finishing the art for the last 10 pages! I will be sharing tomorrow in the big update new art from that comic.

updates.update_userinfo: The one where SeerNova cross promotes
updates.update_content:
First off...
Thank you all for the continuing support! You all are awesome! We are getting into the last round of roughs for Issue 2 and Issue 1 is starting in a week or 2 with Adam Fields! If you didn't know Adam will be taking over as our artist for all of our superhero comics for the foreseeable future. He already did an amazing job on INK and Scales. By the way INK 2 is wrapping up with editing next week! 

Cross-Promote Time!

It is almost time!
No, not The Seer Chronicles. Those are still being worked on. Though we hit a nice stride with that. We are getting closer to finishing issue 2 which is exciting!
Last weekend we finished creating the cover for Scales which is our new solo series. Since yesterday the lettering was sent back with the final edits and oh it looks so awesome! We just have last-minute touches and then we can send Scales out to you all digitally! The physical version won't be sent until we have both The Seer Chronicles 1&2 done because shipping is just so much fun.
Hello fellow backers! Okay, so The Seer Chronicles got a few new inked pages, as well as penciled pages, done! Here is one NEW penciled and inked page :D

First off...
Thank you all for your patience I know you are probably as eager as we are to get our comics out into your hands or your email depending on your backing method. Something awesome that happened the last week of January is I finished paying my car payment off so I can have much more money to play around with in terms of paying to speed this process up a bit.

For the last 10 days, we have a very cool exclusive cover! This is a connected cover with MOJO RISING!! Another cool voodoo project that is launched on KICKSTARTER TODAY!! Here is the image and our cover.
Not final version

How can you get the connected cover?
OPTION 1: add 10 dollars to a campaign
OPTION 2: Pledge on this cover exclusive cover for $20.00
OPTION 3: Upgrade to a COLLECTORS KIT!! We will be adding this for FREE!!!
So, don't miss out on this WE ONLY HAVE A FEW DAYS LEFT!! 
What is the cost of a soul?
This KICKSTARTER is for the 1ST ISSUE of a BRAND NEW 4-issue limited series created by Travis Gibb (Broke Down and Four Dead Bodies) and Luke Stone (Hybrids). Rounding out the team is Alan Emmanual (Red Talon) on colors and Jerome Gagnon (Action Labs) on letters.
OUR STORY: RJ and her husband Brent travel deep into Voodoo strongholds around the world, trying to restore Brent's humanity. This dark and haunting journey will challenge their faith, marriage, and worldview.
Life, death, and the supernatural await them in the dark and sinister world of VOODOO NATIONS.
OUR WHY: Travis Gibb and Luke Stone are both Christians who wanted to tackle the culture clash of various religions from the viewpoint of modern-day missionaries. We want to show both the positives and negatives of these various religious groups and explore their long storied conflict.
EARLY BIRD SPECIAL - FIRST 30 PHYSICAL BACKERS WILL GET A FREE VOODOO NATIONS HOLO-STICKER
 ***FREE SHIPPING - US ONLY***
COVER A
What do you get with VOODOO NATIONS #1?
VOODOO NATIONS #1 is a 32-page comic in standard American comic size, on high-quality gloss paper.
 FREE SHIPPING (FOR USA BACKERS)
Backers get various cover options from Luke Stone and Stan Yak.
This Extra Sized first issue Includes 29 sequential pages of action, horror, and suspense. 
Plus loads of additional bonus content in the Deluxe Digital-PDF!
At higher pledge levels, backers will access campaign exclusive limited-edition items. 
At highest pledge levels, receive limited opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed materials, and the chance to be drawn into the world of the series as someone taking part in a very important scene in the book!
*INTERNATIONAL BACKER SUPPORT PROGRAM*
If you are an international physical backer!! We want to show our support to you and understanding that international shipping is just super expensive! So, if you are an international backer we will send you not only the tier you pick but anything that you are missing from the pledge tier 1 level above.
(EXAMPLE: If you got a 12 dollar physical tier. We will give you the 12 dollar cover and the 15 dollar cover FOR FREE)
Who Will Love VOODOO NATIONS?
Fans of Insidious,  Locke & Key, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Underworld, and other supernatural horror stories.
Fans of World Trekking Adventure! We will travel to Brazil, New Orleans, and Mexico.
People who like stories that encompass elements of horror, magic, and faith in a modern setting.
People who enjoy unique perspectives on horror, supernatural, theology, and mythologies. 
PREVIEW
COVER C
 Plus a BACKUP TALE by Sebastian F Piccione (writer), Elias 'Gambit' Melendez (artist), Karl Moline (Colors) and  Ryan Shimek (Flats).

COMPLETED PAGES
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We're coming to you to raise funds to print Voodoo Nations Issue 1.  We have already invested our own time and money to ensure that the book's art is 100% completed and the Colors will be finished before the end of the Kickstarter. This will make it so we are ready to go to print. We have come to Kickstarter to help get the book into as many hands as possible in order to publish this incredible series.
By joining Orange Cone and backing this project, you will not only be helping to make sure that this book is printed. You will also receive the Kickstarter exclusive rewards and bonuses.
PRODUCTION PLAN
The Kickstarter Campaign: July 16- August 14, 2020
Kickstarter Funds Received: August 28, 2020
Voodoo Nation off to Print: August 31, 2020
Voodoo Nations Digital Packages Sent Out: August 31, 2020
Merchandise in Production: Early September 2020
Expected Delivery to US Backers: Mid September 2020
Expected Delivery for INT Backers: End September 2020
As a Kickstarter Superbacker and lifetime comic book collectors, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. Therefore, all comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provide impact-resistant protection.

campaign.story:
Want to make a living doing the creative, DIY projects you love, but worried about the business, organizational, and money side of things?
Eleanor Whitney knows the ins and outs of creative business, and her pair of books—Quit Your Day Job and Quit Your Day Job Workbook—have the kind, friendly, accessible, incredibly practical information you need if you're thinking of starting a business, nonprofit, group, association, or any other sort of organized creative endeavor.
Business skills can be learned, and you can run a sustainable operation while still living your values. The books cover topics like:
Evaluating your ideas and choosing one
Crafting a mission and vision that are true to your values
Making a budget even if that word terrifies you
Getting the word out about your project
Deciding how much to charge for your time or products
Navigating bureaucracy and contracts
Maintaining healthy work habits and work/life balance
Taking the leap to doing your project full-time
Knowing when to sell, close, or transform your project
Daunting? Maybe. But with help and support, you can achieve all of this and so much more. And that's what these books are here for. 
Ready to get going?
About the books
This project brings into the world two books to help you birth your creative business! You can use them together or each on their own, depending on your style and preference: 
Quit Your Day Job
Quit Your Day Job delivers clear practical tools, interviews with successful entrepreneurs, and just the right amount of real talk for anyone who has a creative passion and is thinking about trying to turn it into their full-time work and draws on years of professional experience helping artists and makers launch and grow their values-driven businesses. 
QYDJ is the second edition of author Eleanor Whitney's first book with the somewhat vague title of Grow. We're stoked to have the opportunity to give her work a title and cover which can help its evergreen contents reach even more creative folks who want to make their mark. (Stay tuned for a backers-only update about this process.)
What you'll find inside Quit Your Day Job

Quit Your Day Job Workbook
The Quit Your Day Job Workbook is packed with interactive exercises, worksheets, and templates developed by Eleanor to give you all the tools you need to develop your business idea, figure out the nuts and bolts, and handle all the planning, pricing, marketing, publicity, financial, paperwork, collaboration, fundraising, and whatever else you need to make your creative business dream a reality. 
The workbook is even longer than the original book and contains 100% new material, published for the first time this fall.
An exercise from Chapter One of the workbook
About the rewards
The paperbacks: Both Quit Your Day Job and Quit Your Day Job Workbook are paperback books. You can back this project for either one of them, or for both of them, and we'll mail them to you as soon as we get them back from the printer. 
If you want to add extra books or workbooks to your reward, and you live in the US, add the cover price for each additional one you want and drop us a line letting us know. If you're outside the US, please ask us for a shipping quote before you increase your pledge.
The ebooks: Want an ebook? We've got ya. You can get either the book or workbook on their own for just $10. Want more copies, both of them, or want to add an eBook to a different pledge? Try the brand-new add-ons feature on your web browser to add whichever book you'd like.  If backing from an iOS or Android Kickstarter app, just add $5 per ebook to any reward level and drop us a message letting us know which one you want.
Entrepreneur Starter Pack
Quit Your Day Job
 Punk Rock Entrepreneur - Caroline Moore's brilliant guide to starting a business when you don't have money to invest in it (and why that's better)
 From Chaos to Creativity - Jessie L. Kwak shows you how to manage your time and energy to get the work itself done on your creative project, and still have a life
 Unf*ck Your Worth - Dr. Faith Harper helps you work through your emotional hangups around money, work, getting paid, and self-worth

Literary Business person
Quit Your Day Job
 A People’s Guide to Publishing - Microcosm founder Joe Biel's comprehensive, readable guide to starting a publishing business
 Make a Zine - Joe walks you through the history and how-tos of the original self-publishing revolution
 Honing Your Craft - Develop your writing skills on a budget, no matter how broke you are, with the help of Lydia Rogue
 Unf*ck Your Writing - Dr. Faith and Joe team up to offer lessons from two commercially successful authors who don't have fancy MFAs

Entrepreneur with the Workbooks
Quit Your Day Job
Quit Your Day Job Workbook
Punk Rock Entrepreneur
From Chaos to Creativity
 From Chaos to Creativity Workbook - An interactive zine to get your productivity on track
Unf*ck Your Worth
 Unf*ck Your Worth Workbook - A comprehensive kick in the pants for those who need to start budgeting, saving, get out of debt, and boost our self-worth
All the books: Want a copy each of every book and zine in the other reward levels? This is the place for you.
Custom consultation levels: Want a personal, friendly conversation and perhaps a bit of help to get you focused and ready to roll? We have a limited number of higher level rewards for folks who want to share their plan and get anything from a gentle push in the right direction to a powerful marketing plan and assets.
About the author 
Eleanor C. Whitney is a feminist writer, musician, and editor living in Brooklyn. She has built community and content strategy for startups and arts organizations including Axiom, Managed by Q, Dev Bootcamp, Shapeways, the New York Foundation for the Arts, and the Brooklyn Museum. Her first book, Grow (Quit Your Day Job is the second edition) is a practical field guide for managing a creative business. She's currently working on her next book, Riot Woman, a collection of feminist essays, and is the host of a podcast of the same name. She loves to punch out her writer's block at her local boxing gym.
About the publisher
We are Microcosm Publishing & Distribution, a scrappy mid-list publisher and purveyor of empowering, brightly colored books and zines. Based in Portland, Oregon, we have a team of 13 workers, 500 titles, and more than 2 million books in print. Our goal is to connect you with books that put your power in your hands.
As a creative business that's weathered the ups and downs of the last 24 years, we deeply appreciate the value of combining sound math with good design, smart numbers with shining inspiration, and strong contracts with strong relationships. That's what these books are all about!
Why Kickstarter?
A successful Kickstarter project helps us connect directly with readers, and also means we can sell enough books in advance to reduce the  financial risk of publishing a book. 
Kickstarter funding is all-or-nothing: That means that if we don't make our goal by the end of the project, we get nothing and you pay nothing. Your card will only be charged for your pledge on the day the project ends, if it meets its goal. 
Thank you for supporting our vision, Eleanor's books, and the tiny but lively ecosystem of independent publishing! With your help, we can change the world. 
P.S. Stay in touch and let us know how your business goes!

updates.update_content:
Last time we updated you, it was a moment of excitement, a not-particularly-calm lull the day before eleven pallets of new books—including the Quit Your Day Job Workbook—arrived on our curb.
The books look amazing! Here are the four new ones that all came in at once:

The bindery across town called, and Quit Your Day Job finished getting its new covers over the weekend! Tomy took his truck over to pick them up—three pallets = three loads—and he, Joe, Elly, Sarah, and Dylan brought them in and put them on the warehouse shelves.

While the workbooks have gotten to Eleanor, a box or two ships much faster than a pallet and so we are still waiting on the workbooks out here in Portland. Further, the book itself is still at the bindery. We'll keep you updated on when things arrive and we start shipping them out the door. 
In the meantime, we've got a new Kickstarter with the latest from Dr. Faith Harper and Joe Biel - How to Be Accountable. While it won't help you stay on task and accountable for your passion projects, it will help you take responsibility for past behavior and figure out how to change.
The books have arrived!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it, and beat our stretch goal, thanks to you!
Announcing our stretch goal (and some postal system love)!
updates.update_content:
This new workbook is all about harnessing the power of creative community and I'm so thrilled and grateful that because of you, your generous support, and enthusiasm for this project we hit our goal in less than 48 hours after our launch and have continued to gain momentum since then. Thank you! 
While I always say (thanks to my friend Amy Schroeder) that "DIY doesn't mean do it alone," before you release a project into the world there's always that nagging question — will this resonate? Will the audience I hope for it feel the same way I do? You all have answered with a resounding "Yes!" with your support and I am so grateful.

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks to you, we've exceeded our goal!
updates.update_content:
Hi, Friends, Supporters, Community!
It's an understatement to say that I am absolutely blown away and completely humbled by your support for the Quit Your Day Job Workbook. Thanks to you we're about 91% funded in about 24 hours! 
I'm so excited that this book resonates with you and can't wait for it to be in your hands. Launching this project, and feeling your energy for it, is giving me more motivation for the other projects I have in the works too, so thank you for that!

campaign.story:
Roadkill Rampage is a mature, Horror story following the journey of Ace and Tess, a young couple taking a drive out to the country. Ace being the quintessential bad boy likes fast cars and hot chicks. His classic car and Tess meet both those qualifications. Unfortunately for Tess, Ace has a dark side that she is unaware of. 
Will they make it out alive? 
This is the first issue of a four-issue mini-series. Rodney originally wrote this as a one-shot and had discussed the project with another artist before meeting Eamon Hill at a local creator meet-up. As they got to know each other better, Rodney discovered that Eamon had the same love of old Grindhouse and Horror movies as he did. Especially, the greats like Hitchcock, Carpenter, and Romero and their use of suspense in storytelling.
It was also during this time that Rodney was introduced to Eamon’s artistic style and realized he was perfect for Roadkill Rampage. As the two began working together, it was obvious how well Rodney’s writing style meshed with Eamon’s art to create what is before you now and why we have decided to continue the story with additional issues.
As of the launch of the Kickstarter, Rodney has issue #2 completely written, and Eamon is ready to get started drawing. It is our hope to release Issue #2 in 2021. 
 Our Artist, Eamon Hill, brings our story to life creating digital pencils and then printing the art to finish it traditionally with ink washes to give the art that unique gritty look that you will find throughout the book. 
PLAY

Page from Roadkill Rampage
Page from Roadkill Rampage
Writer - Rodney Fyke is a writer and artist from Cincinnati, Ohio. He's been working on and off in Independent comics since the early 90s. His art style varies from high detailed illustrations to cartoony drawings. His published projects include Superior Seven, Peanut, Puddin’ n’ Jelly, Pitter Patter, and Unchained. Roadkill Rampage is his first venture into the Horror genre. He has over twelve comics that have been published in which he's either written, illustrated, or both. 
Artist - Eamon Hill is a tattoo artist and cartoonist based in Cincinnati. He and his wife, Lish Crossland-Hill, comprise Pigbone Comics; the studio responsible for the Gothic Horror-Western, Arcana Vaquero. Eamon is a bit of a traditionalist when it comes to art; preferring brush, ink washes, and watercolor. Roadkill Rampage is Eamon's first project with Hazzum, but he is the artist on his self-published comic Arcana Varquero also available through Hazzum.  Chapter #2 f Arcana Varquero is currently in production with Pigbone Comics. 
Letterer - Dave Lentz is a letterer, designer, and sometimes artist and writer. When he's not reading comics, he does his best to create them by any means necessary. he’s pretty keen on his wife and son, Batman, Star Wars, TMNT, and comics in general and has done work for Source Point Press, Last Wolf Legion, Action Lab, and more. You can find some of his work at www.davelentz.com
Editor - Kasey Pierce is CEO of Red Pen Media offering editing, copywriting, and creative advising. She’s also a creator and brand ambassador for Source Point Press (since 2014). In 2015, she created movie-optioned Sci-Fi comic series, “Norah”. To find out more, visit Facebook.com/redpenmedia1 or Facebook.com/kosmickasey.
Hazzum Productions - Hazzum was started in 2009 by Tina McElhinney and Rodney Fyke. We've been publishing comics since 2010. That first year, we debuted our all-ages comic, Peanut, Puddin' n' Jelly - a 6-issue series. We also published Pitter Patter and Unchained. We recently teamed up with Pigbone Comics to distribute their Western-Horror, Arcana Vaquero.  While this is our first venture into Horror, making comics is nothing new for us.  
Available as 6" x 9" Mini-Print or as a 24" x 36" Standard Print in the Reward Levels

 This campaign is to cover printing costs, backer rewards, and distribution. The comic is a 24-page comic with art rendered in black and white ink washes and will be published digitally and in print. The book will be printed standard American comic book size (6.63"x10.24"). We are going to use stretch goals to raise money to pay our artist, Eamon Hill, to complete the next issue of Roadkill Rampage.
This is the first chapter of a four-part story to be published by Hazzum.  For additional information please visit our website and be sure to subscribe to our newsletter. 
 A note on shipping: shipping is one of the most difficult to price and predict. We are truly committed to bringing you a quality package that is shipped securely. We will be using rigid cardboard comic shippers built for comic books to withstand rough shipping. We have tried to keep costs low but international shipping and domestic shipping rates continue to rise. if you have any questions about specific shipping arrangements or would like to pick up your products in person locally just let us know. If you pick-up we'll throw something extra special into your package! 
Please visit our website for all things HAZZUM and to sign up for our newsletter for updates on Roadkill Rampage and all our other titles.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All crowdfunding comes with inherent risks and challenges. The good news is, we have greatly minimized the risks by waiting to launch this campaign until we had the book 100% complete and ready to be sent to the printer. We are working with a couple of artists for the stretch goals, but they are professional artists, so we don’t expect any delays in the production of their pinups if we reach the stretch goals. The main issue will be any shipping or production delays due to COVID-19 if any. We are committed to getting this project to you as soon as possible!

Dear Backers and Supporters,
We hope you are enjoying Roadkill Rampage #1! Hazzum is looking forward to bringing new books to you, our fabulous readers in 2021. The new year has brought some changes to the RR team as our artist from Issue #1 has decided to step away from the project for personal reasons. While we are disappointed in his decision, we understand and wish him nothing but the best for the future. As such, our next issue will feature a new artist, but rest assured it will have the same great storytelling and quality you have grown to expect. We look forward to sharing more info every soon about our upcoming projects.

Sex is great. 
Upwards of hundreds of people agree with me on this. Sex: awesome. I want to be clear from the get-go here. This book is full of filth and by filth I mean sex. This book is only intended for people aged 18+. Not for kids. 1000% not for kids. I know there are bright rainbow colors and this has lead several inattentive parents to buy it for their offspring thinking it's going to be about the magic of friendship. I mean, it is about friendship. Some very close friendships that involve being naked together. Things get juicy.
 But this book is inspired by the activity magazines I used to get as a kid, full of comics and puzzles and games. So when I was putting together a collection of my sex comics, I thought, "Why don't I go full Highlights with this?" So I started fleshing this out with some hilarious bonus content. We'll get into that in a minute.
I'm Megan Rose Gedris, aka Rosalarian. I've been making comics and webcomics for 20 years. I'm Eisner nominated, a recipient of the Queer Press Grant from Prism Comics, and I've been published in over a dozen publications. I've been making erotic comics for over a decade, including series like Darlin' It's Betta Down Where It's Wetta, Eat Me, and The Lady Eudora Henley. In this time, I've also drawn a lot of short stories for various publications. It's time to collect them into a printed book.  
Page from "Change of Plans"
Stories include:
 Change of Plans: A woman's bad tinder date gets better when she meets her date's hot roommate. (F/F)
 Dirty Deeds: A thief breaks into a house and gets a sexy punishment. (F/F)
 You Do Something To Me: A witch uses magic to connect with her fairy girlfriend while away on a trip. (F/F)
 Moral Dilemma: An angel and a demon make a sexy bet for the fate of a man's soul. (F/F)
 The Witch: The only virgin in town dreads the arrival of a witch who is said to eat virgins. (F/F)
There is also a trio of Greek mythology adaptations.
 Heaven on Earth: The (pro)creation of the world. (F/M)
 Object of Affection: Pygmalion makes the perfect woman out of stone, but she has her own desires. (F/F/M/M/F/M)
 Six: Persephone and Hades' whirlwind romance is interrupted, but they keep the fire burning until she can rejoin him. (F/M)
A page from "Six"
Bonus content includes written erotica, mad libs, satirical "articles", pinups, coloring book pages, puzzles, quizzes, and more!
 Content include a range of body types, BDSM, queer people, and lots of humor while still being sexy. (Good sex should include laughter!) As far as trans representation goes, I admit there is no overt depictions in the comics because this is a lot of earlier stuff and I wasn't there yet with my own mind and understanding, but the bonus content is newer and has trans content. I will say there is nothing in the book that equates vagina = woman/ penis = man. I want everyone to have fun here!
 The book will be approximately 180 pages, mostly in full color but some of the bonus content in black and white. It's a paperback book and it'll be printed in The United States.
In addition to the book itself, you can also get some cool other swag to go with it. First up, this big sticker sheet in which I channel my inner Lisa Frank:
Obviously this is heavily censored and you gotta trust me that the genitals behind those hearts are brilliant.
If enough people order these, I want to upgrade it to holographic foil! So tell all your friends about this so we can get the ~~M A X I M U M * S P A R K L E~~!
I'm also making these embroidered patches. Well, I'm not stitching them myself. That would take me 500 years. Anyways, they're cool:
Art subject to change.
I can't wait to sew this onto a really cute sweater so the world can finally truly know what I'm about.
You can also get original sexy watercolor paintings. These will be up to my discretion for what to paint, but you can advise on whether you want it PG-13 or XXX, and if you have any hard limits on what you'd like to see. But y'all, I got some extremely nice Japanese watercolors and a lot of metallic gold paint.
Hopefully I don't need to censor this. For some reason, a lot of sites have the rule that digital art must be censored but "traditional" art doesn't need to be. So, to whoever at Kickstarter is looking at this, these are important Art nipples made of real paint on real paper.
They're about 5x7" so you can put them in a frame and then hide them when your parents come over or just leave them up and let your parents deal with the fact that you are an adult with your own sexuality!
You can also get some of my other work in various bundles. All of these are paperback graphic novels:
 Darlin It's Betta Down Where It's Wetta: Pearl the mermaid has only heard about vaginae through legend, and she goes on a quest to get some. (F/F)
 Eat Me: Literal food porn, in which shy factory worker Rhonda is magically transported to a surreal technicolor world of food people and monsters. (F/F)
 The Lady Eudora Henley: A newlywed woman, already dissatisfied with her sex life, is drawn to The Lady Eudora Henley, a noblewoman with a reputation for filth and depravity. (F/F also includes explicit trans representation)
You can also get copies of Filthy Figments' anthologies Food Porn and Score, in which I have a story in each of them. In Food Porn, my story The Munchies features a couple of hungry stoner girls. In Score, my story Tag Team is about two pro wrestling dudes who take things a little further during practice.
It's collectively nearly 1,000 pages of smut if you snag everything. Wow! That'll pass a lot of time while staying indoors.
This project could definitely be filthier. Let's get it there. The goal is $12,000. But we can go higher.
$15,000: Physical books will include a full color "centerfold!" Mad Magazine style ;)
$20,000: Sticker sheets will be larger, with more stickers, and **sparkles**!
$25,000: Sexy bookmarks to slide between the sheets... of paper.
$30,000: Let's make this book bigger with a brand new comic!
After that, who knows? Drop your suggestions in the comments. What would YOU like to see?
Surpassing the initial goals won't just make this project better, it'll make it easier for me to make better content in the future for other projects.

updates.update_content:
The books are all nestled up snug in their packages, postage lovingly affixed to their fronts beside your addresses, giddy about the thought of being opened by you...
...Unfortunately, the post office doesn't give a shit.
So, I've had these orders packed up for about six weeks. I've been living among towering stacks of boxes stacked near to the ceiling. I want them out of my house, but the Chicago post office, already pretty difficult to work with when it's not a pandemic, has managed to find new ways to cause me to pull out my hair. I have scheduled multiple pickup requests with them, and since it's a pandemic I'm home all day, waiting by the door, getting no work done, only to have them not show up (but send me an email telling me my order was picked up.)

Hi everyone! Popping in with an update to the project. The books are at the printers right now and it shouldn't be too long before they're done. The stickers are printed and look beautiful, and the patches are en route to me right now. I made both the colorful patches as well as a black and white version for any goths out there. So far, the USPS still exists so that's good and should bode well for shipping once those books arrive. Everything is going smoothly! It won't be too much longer.

campaign.story:
What Is It? 
Hitting the streets of Manchester and bashing back against the haters
 Glitter Vipers is the 60 page story of Manchester drag queen Bi Phallicia and her friends who find themselves victims of an awful hate crime and decide that they are going to fight back. So they strap up, hit the streets and are ready to fight back against bigotry with a sequin baseball bat and some bad ass righteous fury! 
The fabulous Bi Phallicia
Follow the most fabulous street gang in the world as they patrol the Gay Village, step up to bigoted politicians and bash down the bashers. And in the midst of it all, they discover there's a conspiracy behind it all!
They're sick of being seen as victims! Sick of having crimes against them ignored! The Glitter Vipers are here to fight back!
The story is a brisk 60 pages, with a few behind the scenes extras thrown in too to give you a great little package in a glitter grindhouse revenge fantasy!
The gang's all here! Art by Katie Fleming
Who Are the Glitter Vipers?
 Bi Phallicia  - Bi Phallicia, real name Jason Filson, is a Manchester drag queen of some repute, who as well as her weekly shows runs a support group for those that have been victims of abuse, bigotry or hate crimes. Unfortunately, she finds herself becoming not just the organiser but also one of the members. She takes on the lead in the Glitter Vipers gang when they decide to fight back. 
Jesus Moretti - Jesus is a Colombian immigrant living in Manchester, UK and close friends with Bi and her group. He's dating Anton Bakunin. He's a broader, tougher looking man who came to the UK to live a more open and free life as a gay man. 
Anton Bakunin - Anton had a rough upbringing, finding it a lot harder to hide who he is as a gay man. An Eastern European immigrant who fled his home where being gay can result in being 'vanished', Anton came to the UK to try and find peace. Unfortunately, homophobia isn't just something that happens 'somewhere else'. 
Melissa 'Mel' Carter - Mel is a garage worker in Manchester, and is dating Bri. They are attendees of the support group after the pair were attacked by homophobes on a tram.  Mel is very tough, and has been harbouring a lot of anger over the surprise attack they suffered, and is eager to make sure nothing like it ever happens again.
 Bryony 'Bri' Stonehouse - Manchester born and bred, Bri has been dating Mel for nearly two years now. She also felt more anger than anything else after they were attacked, but she abhors violence entirely. Instead, Bri uses her smarts and community spirit to build the community support group stronger than ever before. 
Callum 'Cal' Wilkes - Cal came out much later in life, as his life in a biker gang didn't feel like the safest place to be openly gay. In fact, it turned out he was right when he did get outed to his gang and he wound up kicked out and alone. Struggling at first to find his tribe after this rejection, Cal is now a regular of Manchester's leather scene and brings his gruff, take-no-guff attitude to the local queer community. 
Queenie Iwobi - Queenie is a trans woman from a Nigerian family, she moved from her home in London to Manchester for council work years ago. Now, she takes part in the support group as a way of managing the daily micro-aggressions she faces as a proud trans WOC in this world, and to help support others like her. Also not a fan of violence, she joins Bri at the homebase, creating a helpful, safe space for the community and using her skills as a community support worker. 
Albert 'Alby' Prince - a 16 year old trans masc kid, Alby has been sneaking out to the gay scene for a while to find a safe space to be their authentic self, away from their home where they are not out. Alby became a big fan of Bi's shows, and Bi took them under her wing so she could make sure Alby was having a safe experience. Alby prefers he/him or they/them pronouns, but is not yet out to their family.
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Content Warning
We are aware that the topic of hate crimes, bigotry and assault are sensitive topics, that we as a queer community often face far too often. Sensitive to this, the book will contain content warnings so that readers can be aware going in what to expect. 
We are also aware that it can be annoying to be seen as just the victims all the time. And while there can be a lot of emotions that are discussed after these kind of things, one emotion is often overlooked or swept-under-the-rug: anger. 
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Sometimes when we see these things happen, or when they happen to us, there can be a strong sense of justified anger, and we look at that through the medium of revenge fantasy grindhouse action and explore what sense of resolution or satisfaction can be found there. 
All the while telling an entertaining, thoughtful action story in a very modern world. We'll have fun, but won't be making fun. 
Who's It For?
Have you ever seen the news and just felt so angry? Then you, for sure. 
But seriously, I think anyone who has felt that kind of strong reaction to things that happen in the world, whether it be a story of injustice they've seen in the news, or an article of a hate-fuelled attack, or worse, have had personal experience with that; I think anyone who relates to that will find something to relate to in Glitter Vipers. 
Queenie Iwobi by Katie Fleming
Anyone who has stood up to or is aware of organised hate, systemic violence and bigotry in this world can maybe find something in Glitter Vipers that speaks to them. We've all felt angry: this is about our right to that rage, and finding an outlet for it.
We all get told that we should not let that anger rise, that we don't have the right to our anger or how lashing out is wrong, but see the same things happen again and again. Glitter Vipers will explore that anger, it's justification and how it too can have a role in recovery, for good or ill.
Generally suitable for teens aged 16 years of age or older, the book has some light use of course language, violence, and as mentioned, sensitive topics around bigotry, hate crimes and assault. If you are buying for someone else, please do bare that in mind. 
Cover by James Gifford
Who's Making It?
One thing that we wanted to achieve with this book was the keep the whole creative team as queer identifying people. It's an LGBTQIA+ focused story, so it only felt right to have it be made by LGBTQIA+ people. 
The team is as follows:-
Joe Glass - Writer
 Joe Glass - Joe is the writer and co-creator of popular LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series, The Pride, now a successful ComiXology Originals series. He's also the writer of Acceptable Losses, a mature, political thriller with a dark edge. Most recently, he's worked with RuPaul's Drag Race star Manila Luzon on a countdown Instagram comic for her single, Robbed! Joe lives in South Wales with his family, and a petulant cat named Oliver. You can find his website here. 
Katie Fleming - Art
 Katie Fleming - Katie Fleming is a queer artist from Dublin, Ireland.  She began creating comics with her Partner with their LGBTQ+ comic '100 Times' and '100 More Times'.  since then she's worked on numerous anthologies and comics, such as 'Heart of Steal', 'The Black Rubric' and the webcomic, 'Ship Wrecked'. Glitter Vipers is her first graphic novel and she's super excited. When she's not making comics she's spending her time as a Werewolf. Her work can be found here. 
 Kelly Fitzpatrick - Kelly Fitzpatrick is known for her work on books such as: Bitch Planet, Supergirl: Being Super, Wonder Woman: Tempest Tossed, Shade the Changing Girl, DC: Bombshells, Archie, and Josie and the Pussycats. Nominated for the esteemed Hugo awards, she is also a past nominee for Autostraddle, Ghastly & Prism awards and has worked on titles nominated for the GLAAD and the Harvey awards. Her client list is available on her website and includes such prestigious publishers as DC Comics, Archie Comics & Dark Horse Comics. 
Lucas Gattoni - Letters
 Lucas Gattoni - Lucas Gattoni is a seasoned graphic designer and typesetter now pursuing his dream job of comic book lettering. He has lettered GLAAD nominated Liebestrasse for ComiXology Originals, Twin Worlds for Action Lab, Eskimo Kisses for Scout Comics and is currently lettering the Spanish version of Sonic The Hedgehog for IDW. He lives in his home country of Argentina with his husband and their three unnamed goldfish (oops, make that two now). His website is here.
Ted Brandt - Editor
 Ted Brandt - Ted Brandt is best known as an inker, working with his partner Ro on the Eisner- and GLAAD-nominated CROWDED from Image Comics. He likes long walks on the beach, and eating too much pizza. Ted is using his editorial hat on Glitter Vipers to help make the book the best it can be. 
James Gifford - Cover Artist
 James Gifford - James Gifford is a cis gay illustrator and storyboard artist who lives in London. He's a wayward pirate, plundering whatever illustration jobs he runs ashore on, never resting in one spot for long. A lone creative, a side-spitting gunslinger. The moment you think you have him pinned, he slips through your fingers like smoke. He's earned coin from Cartoon Network and Marvel comics and is currently creating content for Dungeons and Dragons in his spare time. You'll chip your teeth on his tough exterior, but deep down his heart is gold. His website is here. 
Spire Eaton - Spire is a graphic designer, artist, animator and comic creator based in Florida. He designed the Glitter Vipers logo for the book. That fabulousness is all down to him! You can check out his work here.
How Far Along Is It?
At time of launching the campaign, the book is entirely written, final inks are done for about roughly 20% of the book, with a further dozen pages ahead prepped too, and colours and cover work is starting in conjunction as the rest of the pages are drawn.
Alby Prince by Katie Fleming
We estimate that by the end of the campaign the book will be half way or more complete, and have allowed a roomy space of months between campaign end and delivery in an effort to ensure prompt delivery of the finished product. 
By following and/or backing the campaign, we will keep you updated with new pages and art as they happen, so you'll be the first to see more as it comes!
 How is the Money Spent?
A Breakdown of How the Goal Amount is Split
The majority of the goal amount is to pay for the art production of Glitter Vipers: this includes the drawing/inking, the colours and the design elements of putting the book together. 
The next biggest elements are the printing costs (currently based on a modest-to-large print run) and the shipping costs of sending copies out to those who back for physical reward tiers. Costs of shipping have been worked out based on impending Royal Mail price changes taking effect on July 1st 2020. Due to COVID-19 and changes in legislation for USPS in America, international shipping will be rising significantly, but we are baring this in mind in the planned goal amount and postage prices. 
The smallest element is to go on extra rewards elements, like the stickers. 
As such, the greatest overall chunk of the the goal amount we are asking for is to cover the production cost and to make sure our art team get a good, speedy payment for their hard work. 
Sample colours by Kelly Fitzpatrick
What Can I Get?
Well, naturally we are looking to provide both digital and print options of the book as reward tiers. In this day and age, there's no excuse to not offer both options to backers, so both will be readily available. 
There is also a tier to get multiple copies of the book, at a discounted price! This is primarily for comic stores that would like to support and stock the book, but also libraries and heck, if a group of friends all want to support but are on a budget, or you think you know a group of friends or family who'd all be interested in a copy, you can back at that level to get multiple copies at discount. This level is limited.  
There are options to get signed copies of the book, signed by writer Joe Glass, but again these are limited due to the time and energy taken in signing a lot of books can take.
We also have Glitter Vipers stickers available, so you can grab reward tiers with those included. 
Sample of the Embroidered Patch
Or, why not grab an embroidered Glitter Vipers patch! This is a very limited reward tier, so once it's gone, it's gone. Get it while you can! 
Plus, there's just the positive energy of knowing you've supported a great, queer focused comic project by queer creators, and that's worth everything, right! 
Finally, we have been sure to include the price of postage so when you back, you'll know exactly how much it will be in total. We've based the postage prices on the updated Royal Mail pricing coming into effect on July 1st, 2020, based on the planned sizing of the book and estimated weight.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sometimes life gets in the way, and unforeseen obstacles pop up causing a delay in getting the products shipped in time. In this campaign, we have estimated a lot of time for completion and printing, so all things being equal there shouldn't be a delay to the books going out, but as ever, it is an estimate. 

Likewise, as far as postage goes, we have sourced good, strong, tough packaging that should withstand any handling from delivery services. Similarly, we have taken into account the new postal rates for sending to the United States from the UK, and have priced accordingly. This does mean International postage costs are higher, but with the changes in USPS and increases in general post costs due to COVID-19, it is worked out to be as fair and cheap as possible, while still maintaining a relatively speedy and well-handled delivery. 

The biggest challenge is the goal amount: while it can seem large, the goal is what it is to allow for making sure the team are all paid fairly for the books production, the printing of a good sized print run and shipping. The biggest help to overcome this challenge is to share and spread the word of the campaign, so for all of you deciding to support, we hope you can help us in spreading the word too.

CYST The Skin Grafter
An ancient, hungry creature from the deep has risen to the surface to wreak havoc on a violent world.  
Cyst The Skin Grafter is about a powerful skin eating monster cast out and imprisoned in an ocean grave long ago. He has been magically conjured up from the depths by a mysterious overlord. He is thrown into a violent world filled with monsters, and warriors that he must fight to fulfill his destiny. 
This comic is a brand new Batlantic Studios series by Dylan Andrews! The story takes place in the expanding ARCHIVE universe and connects with my other comics The Oppressors and WARHOOD. Cyst The Skin Grafter is an exciting, action filled 22 page black and white comic written, drawn and created by me!
I need your help to bring this project to life. There are a bunch of awesome reward levels, please support and share this project!
You can add additional books or multiple copies to your reward. Just choose a reward level, add money to increase your pledge amount, and message me about the additional items you want! Free shipping in the USA. You won't be charged until the campaign ends.  
ADD $20 TO ANY PHYSICAL REWARD LEVEL TO GET THE VARIANT COVERS!
ADD $10 TO ANY PHYSICAL REWARD LEVEL TO GET A PHYSICAL COPY OF VERSUS ZERO!
INCREASE ANY PHYSICAL REWAD LEVEL AT LEAST $50 AND GET A PENCIL DRAWING!
PLAY

VERSUS ZERO DIGITAL COMIC FOR EVERY BACKER IF WE HIT GOAL IN 48 HOURS!
My name is Dylan Andrews, I am a designer, artist and comic book creator. I have been working professionally for almost 20 years in the field of publishing. I have done eight successfully funded and fulfilled kickstarter campaigns for my comic book ARCHIVE The WarHood odyssey and The Oppressors. I started reading comics when I was 5 years old, and I’ve always wanted to use my knowledge of art, design and publishing to create my own comic books. I am so happy to be part of the vibrant comic book creating community in Portland Maine. I love the over the top chromium age 90s comics from my youth and I want to bring back the excitement and energy that those comics had for me to a modern audience.
Dylan Andrews
