LATEST UPDATE:
Add-ons: what'll be available and how it's gonna work
So to summarize, here's what everyone will get for FREE on top of your regular pledge rewards:
Upgraded paper stock to 140gsm 
embossed, foil-stamped logo
6x9" ashcan sketchbook (with Peach Momoko's art on the cover)
2" metal collectible coin featuring Peach's art
Original BGM Soundtrack
Perfect-bound 9x6" landscape artbook with awesome guest artists
That's, like, $50 worth of extra bonus collectible stuff for FREE! (And considering all of those extras are limited to just this campaign, that should make 'em even more valuable!)
PREVIOUS UPDATES:
The perfect-bound landscape Art Book stretch goal has been UNLOCKED! 
Art book will feature Bengal, Nathan Fox, Oliver Vatine, Fane, Miki Montllo, Ashley A. Woods, Tony Sandoval, and Ben Caldwell! 
New interview video with Zep added to our Youtube channel!
International orders will be fulfilled with a shipping partner in the UK for significant savings.
 BGM OST UNLOCKED! 
  Collectible Coin UNLOCKED! 
 10 more sketches added to the Original Drawing Tier level! (Thanks, Dominique!) 
Here's a short video from Magnetic Press publisher Mike Kennedy talking about the project, Magnetic Press, and why we appreciate your support here on Kickstarter:
 Debossed foil logo UNLOCKED! 
 Production sketchbook UNLOCKED! 
Check out this new video of Zep and Dom talking about the project!
 THE PROJECT:
In the year 2119, instantaneous transportation technology has altered almost every facet of human civilization, improving countless industries and practices while also leaving behind a growing population who can’t afford to keep up. But some people still prefer the traditional ways of getting from point A to point B, including Tristan Keys, a writer who refuses to embrace the technological advances everyone finds so mandatory. When tiny cracks start to appear in the world around him, he has to wonder if he hasn't been a pawn of technology all along… 
This gorgeously illustrated sci-fi tale by acclaimed writer ZEP (A Story of Men, A Strange and Beautiful Sound, Titeuf) and artist DOMINIQUE BERTAIL (Ghost Money, Omaha Beach, Mondo Reverso) aims a spotlight on current social trends such as over consumption, climate change, social media, identity theft, and transhumanism.
Following a proud tradition of classic science fiction authors such as Philip K Dick, Isaac Asimov,and Arthur C Clark, this visually stunning work pays tribute to the great sci-fi comic artists of the past, including Wally Wood, Jean “Moebius” Giraud, Enki Bilal, François Schuiten, and Jean-Claude Mézières.
We’re excited to present a gallery-quality 9"x12” hardcover edition of this stunning 88-page work of art, with an exclusive, limited edition variant cover by celebrated illustrator PEACH MOMOKO (@peachmomoko60) and a variety of other rewards available exclusively to backers through this campaign. 
cover mockup with final artwork by Peach Momoko.
A mock-up of the ghosted spotUV element that will be hidden on the cover.
PARIS 2119 is a taught, high-concept sci-fi thriller in the vein of BLACK MIRROR, BLADE RUNNER, and WESTWORLD, exploring the consequences of mankind's addiction to technological progress and how that could lead to our very extinction. Cinematic and immersive, with subtle atmospheric moments exploding into tense action when least expected. Make no mistake: this is a mature tale (for nudity, adult language, and violence). 
ZEP
ZEP (born Philippe Chappuis) is a comics creator from Geneva, Switzerland best known for his immensely popular cartoon series Titeuf and its associated comics magazine Tchô! which have sold over 23 Million copies in the French market alone and been translated into 20 languages. In addition to his socially-relevant comedic cartoon work, he has been recognized for several of his more intimate, thought-provoking stories, including A Strange and Beautiful Noise and A History of Men, all after winning a Lifetime Achievement Grand Prix d’Angouleme award in 2004, the most prestigious prize in the European comic industry. Zep and Dominique teamed up on volume 1 of the pulpy sci-fi series INFINITY 8 before starting PARIS 2119.
Panel from INFINITY 8 by Zep and Bertail
Panel from INFINITY 8 by Zep and Bertail
DOMINIQUE BERTAIL
DOMINIQUE BERTAIL grew up reading comics, learning to speak and draw from Lucky Luke, Tintin, and Blueberry before discovering new influences such as Otomo, Sienkiewicz, and Baudoin. He attended the school of the Beaux-Arts in Angoulême where he met noted comics writer and scholar Thierry Smolderen, with whom he began a long list of collaborations, most notably with The Pelgram Hell and Ghost Money. 
panel from GHOST MONEY
panel from GHOST MONEY
PEACH MOMOKO
PEACH MOMOKO is a Japanese artist whose paintings have been showcased in annual gallery shows in Japan and abroad, including the US and Europe. Her body of work combines classical Japanese elements with iconic elements of modern pop culture and propaganda. Her ability to combine beauty and nostalgia with darkness and danger have made her one of the most sought-after cover artists currently in demand. She has to date created numerous in-demand variant covers for Marvel, DC, IDW, Image, Dark Horse, Valiant, Titan, and Heavy Metal. You can follow her work on Instagram @peachmomoko60.
The good stuff 
Our funding goal is set where it’s at to cover a bare minimum print run of the campaign exclusive offerings: variant cover, signature plates, stretch goal add-ons, etc. We have some exciting plans, but we need your help to achieve them.
The digital tier will include not only the complete graphic novel with both covers, but any additional content that is unlocked through stretch goals. These rewards will be provided as DRM-free PDFs through Gumroad.
The core product of the campaign -- you will receive a copy of the hardcover with the limited, exclusive variant cover by Peach Momoko. The book will also include a 4x6"bookplate signed by Zep and Dominique Bertail.
NOTE: The first 300 copies of the book will be offered at a discounted tier for early birds, at which point the price will revert accordingly.
Get hardcover copies of Zep and Dominique's other celebrated works, GHOST MONEY and INFINITY 8 vol.1: LOVE AND MUMMIES at a specially-priced bundle tier.
Or, if you are a comic book collector, these complete single issue runs of both GHOST MONEY and INFINITY 8 vol.1: LOVE AND MUMMIES are limited to only 100 sets available. Each issue is 32 pages plus glossy cardstock cover, except for GHOST MONEY #10 which is an extended 40 pages plus cover.
Dominique has agreed to create an original ink and watercolor drawing for 10 backers at an exclusive reward tier. Subject matter of the backer's choosing, or left to Dom's spontaneous imagination.
Our top tier will offer the original cover art painting by Peach Momoko. This original ink-and-watercolor piece is 11x15" and suitable for framing.
In addition to these exclusive offerings, WE WILL DEDICATE THE BOOK TO THE BACKER WHO PLEDGES THE MOST TO THIS CAMPAIGN, printed on the inside of the book along side the author's own personal dedications.
Plus, as an added bonus, ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE AN EQUIVALENT NUMBER OF AMBASSADOR POINTS AS THEIR TOTAL PLEDGE VALUE. If you aren't familiar with our Ambassador Point program, visit our webstore for more information.
We are offering a RETAILER TIER that includes 5 copies of the Limited Peach Momoko variant at a wholesale discount. This tier will also include some point of purchase promotional items for your store, including mini-posters and/or postcards you can use as bag-stuffers. YOU MUST BE A VERIFIABLE RETAILER, WITH A BUSINESS ADDRESS/LINK AND TAX ID/EIN to qualify for this tier! If you do not qualify, do not select this tier as your rewards will be adjusted accordingly. 
 Note: your pledge does not including shipping, which will be applied by Backerkit when you fill out the final survey after the campaign is complete. This helps us ensure sufficient postage is collected without overcharging you with unspecific estimates up front. This also gives you an opportunity to determine your preference of shipping provider and delivery speed. Trust us -- this is best for everyone!
While our initial goal is set to cover the costs of the campaign specific exclusives, we have exciting plans to supplement your rewards should we exceed that goal. Design upgrades, bonus content, and additional in-world artifacts will all be added to your reward packages for FREE pending your support in helping us spread the word.
Here's what we have going on... 
And now this, just added (July 13th):
Olivier Vatine added to the lineup!

The Magnetic connection
Over the past six years, MAGNETIC PRESS has built a reputation for publishing high quality art books, graphic novels, and games showcasing some of our favorite creators from around the world: Bengal, Tony Sandoval, Fred Brremaud and Federico Bertolucci, LRNZ, Matteo de Longis, Miki Montllo, Joel Jurion, Bertrand Gatignol, Caio Oliveira, etc, etc... the list goes on and on. Mind-blowing talent that we believe you will love as much as we do. We are constantly on the lookout for dynamic new styles and stories to share. Magnetic wants to be a matchmaker between you and your new favorite discovery. A secret stash of the coolest stuff your friends don’t yet know about.
In the six years since Magnetic started, we’ve released over a hundred books and collected a handful of awards and nominations along the way, including 19 Eisner nominations. That might sound big, but we’re not. We’re still just two people with a lot of passion and tenacity, as indie as it gets. The market is going through some challenging stuff these days, and our previous ability to get books into stores has been somewhat affected by all of that. So we’re coming back to Kickstarter to directly engage you, the discerning connoisseurs of quality, and to offer access and exclusives that won’t be available through retail channels. While we do plan to make a basic, standardized edition available in stores, the Limited Edition Peach Momoko cover, signature plate, and other rewards will only be available through this campaign. 
By backing this project, you’re not only getting a special collectible edition of a gorgeous book and some other cool extras at great prices, but you’re also supporting Magnetic Press as an indie publisher weathering an evolving market place so that we can continue to bring you amazing books like this. (And there are so many amazing books on our radar...)
The translation and layout are essentially complete. Our goal is to send this book to the printer as soon as the campaign ends once we know how to set our print run of the standard and exclusive variant editions. The digital edition will be available to backers once the print files are locked, which should be in early August. We should then have the finished books in our hands to begin fulfillment by the end of October. Our goal is for you to have everything to you by Thanksgiving (to thank you for giving).
We truly appreciate your interest and consideration, and hope you find the project as exciting as we do!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are frankly very little risks with this project -- the book itself is complete and nearly print-ready. We have years of experience producing and fulfilling these sorts of products and rewards, and our pipeline has become more streamlined along the way. The only risks are of the Force Majeur type -- any unexpected act of God that might complicate our time-tested process (natural disasters, significant global or domestic shipping disruptions, etc.) The most complicated aspects will be coordinating with the authors abroad to sign and return the book plates, backer sketches, or original cover art (if it sells).

Otherwise, this is a relatively straight forward and somewhat routine process for us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
ABYSSAL ALBION An upcoming H.P. Lovecraft inspired survival horror comic series set after the rise of the GREAT OLD ONES and the fall of humanity.
Taking place in a GREAT BRITAIN where both cosmic and folk terrors are a commonplace and chilling truth. Ravaged by death and madness, the story follows the journey of two siblings, SISTER and BROTHER, as they try to survive a world teeming with savage cults and sanity shattering beasts.
If you are a fan of nightmarish post-apocalypses, doom-laden horror, and mind bending cosmic dread, this is the series for you!
As you will have seen from our introduction video, Britain is not in a good place. 
The GREAT OLD ONES have awoken, and with them death and madness has rapidly spread across the globe.  Still, there are a few that remain untouched by the grip of insanity, and it is a pair of such individuals that we now find ourselves following.
Introducing us to the survivor's guilt ridden SISTER, and the her spirited teenage BROTHER, the pair must navigate through DARK YOUNG infested woodlands and DEEP ONE inhabited coastlines as they come to grips with their new dark reality. 
 A reality populated with crazed cultists, nightmare inducing creatures, and vast eldritch horrors. 
With nothing but the clothes on their back, and no family and friends other than themselves to rely on,  they embark on a journey of survival that will not only push their sanity to its limits, but their relationship and family bond.
The first issue will dive head first straight into this frightening new universe. Dragging us deep into dark folklore infested woodlands of England, where the DARK YOUNG, followers of the great old one, SHUB-NIGGURATH, now call home.
With a story arc set to place over four 28-page issues, stunningly drawn in B&W, by backing this project you'll be supporting us to make ISSUE #1 become a reality and be an instrumental part of creating this thrilling new horror universe.
Written by cosmic horror aficionado, screenwriter, and creative producer for the DEADBOLT FIlms, THOMAS J CAMPBELL (BEYOND, AND NOTHING HURT) and with artwork by accomplished artist WAYNE LOWDEN (SHARKS OF A TRAIN, NOCTURNE), lettering by KEN REYNOLDS (COGNITION, HERE AND THERE) and cover colours by SEAN CALLAHAN (AIKO, NOCTURNE).
ABYSSAL ALBION is set out to be a chilling series filled with exciting and spine-chilling homages to the CTHULHU MYTHOS and the originators of weird fiction, H.P Lovecraft, Ambrose Bierce, Robert W. Chambers, Charlotte Gilman Perkins, Arthur Machen, amongst others.
Drawn in striking and suitably atmospheric Black and White by WAYNE LOWDEN, with art that perfectly captures the strange and chaotic world our protagonists now find themselves in.  
The book itself will be printed on 120gsm uncoated paper to give the pages a slightly rough, more visceral texture, and will feature a 200gsm full colour gloss laminate cover.
Of course you'll need supplies if you are to survive out there in the harsh world that is ABYSSAL ALBION - so by backing us here is just some of what you can get!*

Full Colour Unbranded Art Print

As our campaign progress and we unlock key milestones, we’ll start to reveal  our fantastic stretch goals, including but not limited to variant covers, sketch cards, as well as an aeons worth of other collectable goodies!
Filmed in lock-down by DEADBOLT Films  for the CHANNEL HEX 1 MINUTE HORROR FILM FESTIVAL our unique award winning campaign short ALL FALL DOWN was written to serve as a direct tie in to the world of ABYSSAL ALBION. 
Directed by Gav Chuckie Steel

campaign.story:
YOU can be part of Gore Shriek® history!!
With your support, Gore Shriek® Delectus 2020 will be an 8"x11" squarebound, 128-page* collection of brand new Gore Shriek® horror comics, printed in full color on 70# gloss paper. This volume is available in several formats, including two (2) that are exclusive to this campaign. You will also have the rare opportunity to own original art from this monstrous horror tome, or even commission brand new artwork!! Support us and we will feed your horror collection!!
(*) 160-page if we hit the $15k stretch goal!
Speaking of support, as many of you know, our lofty goals of the first campaign were not met, so we had to drop back and re-think it a bit. We've come up with a new pricing structure, added some new cover options and lowered our initial goal. We originally only had one stretch goal that was intended to boost financial support for our creative teams, but this time around, we've added some incentives for backers as well.
A Little Bit of Backstory:
Back in 1989, when Gore Shriek® was a household name – it was in my house anyway – (and if you were alive and actively collecting horror rags back then, it probably was in your house too) Tom Skulan decided to compile a “Best of…” book to bridge the gap between the recently deceased Gore Shriek® Volume 1 and the (then) forthcoming Gore Shriek® Volume 2. It also served as an annual of sorts. It was slightly oversized, had no discernible logo, and featured a stunning Rolf Stark painted cover. The ninety-six squarebound, black-and-white pages therein contained many a classic Gore Shriek® tale, as well as a new jam from Rolf himself. Tom called this compilation Gore Shriek® Delectus. 
The venerable Gore Shriek® Delectus (FantaCo, 1989) atop a pile of it's siblings...

It was limited to 3000 copies and sold out rather quickly. It was always Tom's intention to do a follow-up, but the years rushed by, other projects crept to the fore, and a second volume of Delectus was moved to the back burner (and eventually fell behind the stove LOL). 
Well, here we are thirty years later, looking at the same concept but… matured a bit. Now we’re all a little older – not necessarily wiser – but wading back into the fray. A couple of years ago, Tom licensed the black-and-white comic book, Gore Shriek® Resurrectus to Derek Rook’s Rough House Publishing (www.roughhousepublishing.com… make sure you check it out, they are killing it over there!) and as a companion piece, FantaCo has pulled together some of the best new blood we could dredge up from the abattoir floor and showcased them in this awesome, all-new 128-page graphic anthology, now titled Gore Shriek® Delectus 2020.
Some of the old gang are back: Rolf Stark has painted us some amazing covers and a fantastic story – with his daughter Rachel penning the tale! The Gurch has also graced us with a couple of new pin-ups and covers (and possibly some stories you may not have seen, depending upon how well the campaign goes). Everyone else is new blood. Fresh meat for the grinder, if you will. Here's a little sample of what's in store:
Writer Josh Hadley and artist Tony Fero bring us a delightful tale of dystopian apathy and literal brainwashing. Things tend to get a little sloppy in the future...
Writer/artist Anthony Richichi weaves a psychosomatic tale of living nightmares, lucid metamorphosis, morbid introspection, and teeth. Lots of teeth...
Writer Josh Hadley and artist Monstress Savage flip the script and show us the seedy underbelly of a Hollywood where all of the Classic Monsters are REAL.
Writer/artist Sara Hanley shows us an intriguing view of podcasts, neglected auto maintenance, self-restraint, fandom gone to an extreme... and the intricate art of candlemaking!
Writer Mike Howlett and artist Mark ‘Frightfeast’ Allen give us a biology lesson about amphibious life, endemic ecosystems, vernal pools, and the lengths some will go to protect their homes...
Writer Ray Ramos and artist Jason Paulos bring us a post-Capitalist era romp in the woods. The hunters become the hunted in this table-turning tale of war and WOAH!
Writer Vincent Dawn and artist Sara Hanley attempt to shed a little light on the darkness that resides in all of us. Sadly, sometimes the darkness is playing for keeps...
Writer Rachel Stark and artist Rolf Stark deliver the goods with a heartwarming tale of a girl who strives to make everyone see just how good she is... often with mixed results.
Author Michael Jernigan pens us a little prose tale about desire and the turning tides of fortune. Artist Brian LeBlanc provides an accompanying illustration.
Artists Jessie Gandarilla, Brian LeBlanc, The Gurch, and Rolf Stark supply us with a plethora of one-off masterpieces, suitable for framing!
Early Bird Reward Levels 


Reward Levels
Stretch goal #1 ($7,300): The first stretch goal is a multi-part unlock! When we reach $7,300 (funding goal), we will:
•  add an exclusive 6"x9" print of Rolf Stark's full-color "Wolfman" painting to all physical rewards.
• add a set of seven (7) 6"x9" 2-sided prints featuring NEWLY COLORED versions of the five (5) existing covers of Gore Shriek® Resurrectus and for the first time ever, the reveal of the two (2) variant covers for the forthcoming Gore Shriek® Resurrectus Volume 3!! This reward is courtesy of Derek Rook and Rough House Publishing!
Stretch goal #2 ($9,000): When we reach $9,000, we will add an exclusive 6"x9" print of Mark 'Frightfeast' Allen's full-color "Blasphemy Unbound" illustration to all physical rewards.
Stretch goal #3 ($11,000): When we reach $11,000, we will add an exclusive 6"x9" print of Jessie Gandarilla's full-color "Chupacabra Alibrije" painting to all physical rewards.
Stretch goal #4 ($13,000): This is a multi-part unlock! When we reach $13,000, we will:
• add an exclusive 6"x9" print of Brian LeBlanc's full color "The Kiss" cover art to all physical rewards.
• unlock the Original Art Tiers featuring Rolf Stark and Brian LeBlanc original art that is published in the book. This is the first time any Gore Shriek artwork has been offered up for sale!
Stretch goal #5 ($15,000): This is another multi-part unlock!  When we reach $15,000, we will:
• add an exclusive 6"x9" print of The Gurch's black & white "Guts Out for Gore Shriek®" cover art to all physical rewards.
• expand Delectus to 160 pages and reprint 1993's "Vault of Screaming Horror!" Featuring 32-pages of gore-soaked tales by The Gurch, this book is loooong out of print and commands a high price on the secondary market. 
• unlock a special metal-faced hardcover edition that will feature a tip-in plate signed by at least three (3) creators of the book. This edition will be limited to 100 copies.
Stretch goal #5 ($16,500): When we reach $16,500 (and every $3,500 past this goal) we will add a rate bump of $5 per page for all artists and $10/ per script rate for all writers!
Add-ons:
There are a few of add-ons for this campaign. You will be able to let us know which add-ons you've paid for in the survey sent after the campaign has concluded!
POSTCARDS
Set One: a set of six (6) 4"x6" postcards showcasing the six (6) issues of the original Gore Shriek® Volume One - please add $10 to your pledge

The delivery date came and went, then a couple days later came the dreaded red exclamation point and "SHIPMENT EXCEPTION" notice. This persisted for about 12 more days and then they finally showed up. No explanation, but one of the boxes looked like it had been thrown down the stairs and (despite the mega-drought here in the southwest) one of them was waterlogged. Here's a pic and some videos:

updates.update_userinfo: FLEXIBLE shipping SNAFU, RIGID shipping looming on the horizon!
updates.update_content:
Alrighty folks, before the pitchforks and torches come out, here's an update with the good news first:
THE HARDCOVERS WILL BE HERE ON TUESDAY, HOORAY!!
They look really nice, here are pics of the advance copies I received last week:

So, don’t blow my inbox up about tracking just yet, it’s going a little slower than I anticipated. I’ve got about 20 more packages to put together and then it’s label time... with the heavy lifting of packaging almost done, I anticipate having everything to the post office by Saturday. I’ll post an update once everything is out the door!
This one was just a quickie, gonna get back to it now.
I leave you with this pic sent from China, as you can see, they will be shipping the hardcovers soon!

updates.update_userinfo: SOFTCOVER FULFILLMENT BEGINS, Update on Hardcovers!
updates.update_content:
SOFTCOVER STATUS
I know it's been a long time coming, but we are finally here! I'll start sending out the early bird Softcover tiers tomorrow! 
I should have all softcover tiers mailed out by early next week. You will likely get a PayPal notification of your tracking number. If you don't have anything by next Wednesday, please message me and I'll send it to you.

The short and sweet of it is, the softcovers have landed! Sadly, shipping supplies have been delayed til Monday according to FedEx. But we’re getting there! I’ll have that promised Hardcover update tonight or tomorrow as well!
Completely unrelated, our very own Ray Ramos has another horror book he is funding over on IndieGOGO:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-cryptidnals--2#/

I received the cards on Friday and my softcover preview copies today... pics of all below!
The skid of books should be here Wednesday and the packaging supplies by the end of the week! If all goes as planned, softcover fulfillment will begin the end of this week! I will have an update tomorrow on the hardcover production as well.
Have a great Monday, y’all!
The printer was supposed to get our book shipped out early last week... but I didn't hear back from them until Thursday, when they sent me this pic:

They are unbound, just showing print quality and whatnot. They look so nice! They arrived last night after bidness hours, so I haven’t had a chance to get with the printer to approve or get print schedule details, so watch for an update on that Monday/Tuesday. Hope everyone is having a great weekend!

Well, after the last update, I ran the files past the creators and the publisher and there were a few changes. I made the changes and in the interim, did more twiggling on the design. Once those were done, I sent it back for review, there were a couple more minor changes, more twiggling on my end... and then another three weeks had gone by.
But now it’s finally done! The print files are in the hands of the printer, there don’t seem to be any pre-flighting issues, and we will be on press in the very near future! I will post another update when I get proofs in and have a confirmed schedule.

campaign.story:
My name is Rafer Roberts. You may (or may not) know me from such comics as GRUMBLE (from Albatross Funnybooks), MODERN FANTASY (from Dark Horse Comics), HARBINGER or ARCHER AND ARMSTRONG (from Valiant Entertainment), or the internet-famous THANOS AND DARKSEID: CARPOOL BUDDIES OF DOOM. But, right now, I'm here to tell you about NIGHTMARE THE RAT.
NIGHTMARE THE RAT is a mischievous little monster who preys upon the populace of Hell City by stealing their teeth. I began drawing his comics in 2010 and released a collection in 2014. Since then, I've been working diligently to complete Nightmare's tale. That day has finally arrived.
This Kickstarter is meant to raise the funds to publish the second, and final, NIGHTMARE THE RAT collection. 
NIGHTMARE THE RAT - The NEW collection!
About the collection:
NIGHTMARE THE RAT is an homage to early 1900s comics and the collected editions reflect that influence. This 32-page collection will be printed oversized (10.5"x16") on good old-fashioned newsprint with bonus comics and a sketchbook. It's the same format as the first collection, so they'll look great together! 
Put them side-by-side! They look great together!
This second collection completes Nightmare's tale, concluding with a finale that might be the most messed-up thing I've ever drawn. It is creepy and hilarious and unlike any other comic you have ever read.
Seriously. What the hell is this about?
Nightmare the Rat is a demon who steals people's teeth, forcibly sometimes.
His nemesis is a tiny owl named Morningbreath who poops in people's mouths.
The mayor and his goon squad are always trying to take Nightmare down!
Also, there's a cult and some kind of apocalyptic prophecy???
You can currently read most of Nightmare's adventures online, however, the collected editions are the intended reading experience. 
What kind of rewards are there?
Beyond the collection itself, we are also offering...
Enamel Pins! 
1" enamel pin, complete with collector card!
Mini-Prints! 
NINE postcard-sized prints! By Kelly Williams, Giles Crawford, Jason Axtell, John Shine, Matt Dembicki, Steve Becker, Brett Uren, Jacob Warrenfeltz, and Chris Maranac!
Sketch-covers! 
I have a ton of blank covers to draw on. Let me draw something for YOU!
Original art! 
Nightmare the Rat "daily" strips. 2 strips per 14x17" page!
The cover illustration!? Wow!
How far along is this project?
All  of the comics are drawn and ready to go. I still need to put together the back cover, but that'll go quick. By the time this campaign ends, all I'll have left to do is send the files to the  printer.
How will this money be used?
I'm the only creator involved with NIGHTMARE THE RAT, and I don't expect to make much off of this. All of the money raised will go towards printing the newspaper collection and shipping out your rewards. Anything extra will go into printing more copies and possible stretch rewards. (More info on stretch goals and rewards  is forthcoming.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As mentioned before, all the comics are drawn and the bonus material is almost finished. I've got local printers lined up for the collections and prints, and I've worked with both before. This will be the fourth Kickstarter project that I've run, and (knock on wood) looks like it will be the simplest.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We're back! And so excited to bring the next installment of this series, that means so much to us, to you! 
The Rose Society #2. Written by Eddie Klinker. Pencils/Inks by Daimon Hampton. Colors/Lettering by Jimmy G.
In the second installment of this action packed urban thriller, we follow Adam as he is thrusted into life altering events. The Rose Society is ready to launch their uprising. Soon his search for answers becomes a fight for his life! 
The recent economic crisis has been hard on small businesses, and no exception are local comic shops. The same comic shops that sparked the love of the medium in us. All of us on The Rose Society team want to help those shops affected by the economic downfall. We will be doing a smaller print run this time around so that we can donate a large portion of the funding to several local comic shops! Your backing will go a long way! 
"Klinker, Hampton, and Greenhalgh have produced an intriguing, emotionally resonant story with some beautiful artwork to tell it with." - Pipedream Comics
"The Rose Society has pacing down to a fine art. This comic hooks us with an immediate empathy and a dash of intrigue, and it doesn’t let up for one panel." - The Valkyries
"There are so many twists and turns in this comic and as an introduction to the rest of the story you will find yourself immediately hooked. I was shocked by the time I reached the final pages." - The Nerdy Girl Express

campaign.story:
#Growfromhome Movement is here! 
Pico will help you take your first steps into the magnificent world of growing plants. Easy and affordable, it ensures your plant journey is a success from the get-go. 

Know Your Pico  

As seen on 
Growing plants indoors around the year can be tough because they require lots of direct sunlight to thrive. Unfortunately, you can’t carry sunlight around to make sure your plants get the energy they deserve.
Thanks to Pico's multi-spectrum LED grow lights, giving your plant enough light isn’t a problem anymore; with it, you too can #GrowLikeaPro.
Powered by high-performance power-efficient LEDs from OSRAM, Pico provides all the necessary wavelengths of light to replace the sun completely, and allow you to grow plants all year round.
These powerful LEDs are chosen to support a wide range of plants and each color wavelength stimulates a specific biological function in plants.
 The LEDs are mounted on an easily-adjustable telescopic arm—because plants grow like crazy under our LEDs!      Reminiscent of a vintage radio antenna, it grows alongside your plants. As they extend upwards towards the light, extend Pico by up to a foot in height.
Power Pico through any USB Type-C cable. Included with your Pico are 2 cables to get you started, a short double-ended USB-C and a 3 meter (10’) super-long cable, along with magnetic organizer loops to help route the cable around fridges, windows or anything else magnetic. You may use any phone charger to power the Pico and the optional Pico-timer helps you automate it. 
The Aluminum heatsink makes the LED module rigid and lightweight; it also helps the LED chips last longer through its excellent heat dissipation.   
With its USB Type-C ports on both sides, you can chain up to 3 Picos together with a regular phone charger. Or build yourself an indoor jungle with 6 Picos powered through a 5V 3A charger! Just connect cables to either side, and each Pico will accept and pass-through power to the next one.

Regardless of how busy you are, Pico’s watering system makes sure your plants have as much water as they need—no more, no less—to sustain their health and beauty. All you need to do is top-up once a week. 
Watering too little can kill your plants, but so can too much. Getting it right takes time and experience. Not many of us have it. With Pico, that’s all taken care of for you!
The transparent window lets you know when it’s time to top up, typically once a week. Employing just capillary action and gravity, this design does not require any power supply or involve a motor or pumps. Your plants will also grow quicker and healthier due to root oxygenation from below, provided by the ventilation holes.
Plant pots take up space. They often can only be placed on flat surfaces by windows, which limits your options.
 With Pico, any place is a good place to grow some plants.
Work desk? Check. Fridge? Check. Wall? Check. Glass window, bathroom or even in a vehicle? Check, Check, Check. 
All 3 interchangeable mounts are included with your Pico.
Why several mounts?  Because when it comes to plants, you can't have too many and you might want them everywhere.

Anywhere is a good place to grow!
Grow anything you like 
No seed pods or subscription is involved and hence no recurring costs! Choose any seeds or growing medium of your choice.

Plants Make You Happy
Research has long suggested that indoor plants have a positive effect on the human mind and body. Studies show up to 60% reduction in depression, over 40% in anger, and just under 40% in anxiety. And at work, plants have increased the productivity of the office by up to 15%!
Plants have been proven to improve motivation and concentration, increase energy levels and decrease fatigue. And thanks to the transpiration and evaporation of water from plants, they increase the air quality and improve eye strain and skin health, and reduce the spread of airborne diseases.


Fresh Herbs Right In Your Kitchen 
Always wanted to have fresh edibles at hand? Imagine being able to throw your own homegrown, organic basil onto that bowl of pasta, or some fresh mint on your chicken. 
No more runs to the store for that missing ingredient, having to wash the pesticides and chemicals off of your leafy greens.
Growing edible plants can be a challenge. And while the end result is often worth it, it is a commitment most people find difficult to make. With Pico, we made sure to get all variables just right, so you can grow your favorite herbs at home without a hassle.

Yes, it's tough choosing a color.


 Stretch Goals unlocked!!
 Pico tool design credits to Daksh Savla

What’s Included
Pico comes assembled and ready to grow. Just take it out of the box, add some soil and water, and a few of your favorite seeds. Plug it in and watch your plants thrive!   
 What’s in the box
 1X Pico (preassembled and ready to use)
 1X Power cable (with magnetic cable organizer) (1 meter - 3' 3'')
 1X Daisy Chain Cable (3 meters - 9' 10'')
 3X Interchangeable mounts (magnetic, velcro, wall mount)

Who we are?
 We're Altifarm Enverde, a startup based across the USA and India. We strive to offer a healthier and wholesome way of life to all. We believe in Your Right to Grow, Anywhere, Anytime.
Our design team behind Pico
 Our first campaign was for Altifarm, which led us to switch from a Product Design studio into building home farming products. Altifarm is our flagship home farm with grow lights, greenhouse and mobility packs.
 Last year we launched Herbstation, a more sophisticated compact indoor farm. We've just completed fulfilment to our Kickstarter backers around the world.
Compared to the other two, Pico is a tiny—but only in size and not in ambition. Our goal with Pico is certainly big—to bring as many people as possible into the fold of Urban Farming. Now anyone can connect with nature and #GrowlikeaPro!
This year, we took Pico to CES 2020. We were excited by all the attention—no one could get enough of it!  

 Why Grow at home?  
Is it possible for a Pico to grow enough to replace grocery shopping? Certainly not! 
With our products Altifarm and Herbstation, we help people grow a substantial amount of fresh produce at home, with soil-based and soil-less methods. If anything, most items that are consumed fresh—the ingredients for salads, smoothies, soup, garnish—Altifarmers grow enough to meet a family's requirements when planned and rotated well
With Pico, our aim is to bring up the conversation around sustainable practices in food, and by participation, to have a greater appreciation for fresh produce among family members, including children. 
You don't need fertilizers or pesticides when you grow your food at home—no transportation, refrigeration, or even washing is required. And certainly, no single-use plastic packaging is involved.

 Timeline 
Product Development 
For business Inquiries: info@enverdeworld.com
Say Hi to us: hello@enverdeworld.com 
PICO is fully managed by The Crowdfunding Formula (TCF), the biggest digital marketing team responsible for the top crowdfunding campaigns. Join our campaigns in raising an average of $1.2M.
 More than $15,000,000 has been raised with Sprint's support.
Credits rolllll! a BIG thanks to:

- Our good friend, Rahul Agarwal, for his bounteous help and support in various forms, along with buddies Aatur Mehta and Jimit Kothari.
- Our mentors Jayant Murty and Kapil Kapoor, for their invaluable counsel, along with Asha Jadeja from MJF Foundation for her blessings and support.
- Prakash Bhimani, Deepak Balan, and Rajesh Ajith Sharma, for their abundant support and participation in our ventures and Vihang Dedhia for his sourcing prowess.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We just concluded fulfillment for our Herbstation preorders to over 35 countries. We had our share of delays, mixups, and drama. The journey of a product from an idea to a product is a shelf, is arduous and challenging. This being our third global product launch we are even better learned and prepared.

Although Pico is production-ready with all tooling and manufacturing processes in place, we cannot ignore the elephant in the room - the COVID-19 crisis. While we do not have any external dependency on China or other markets and the entire product is manufactured in close vicinity, we have uncertainties staring at us. Once we are out of the stay at home deadlines, we would resume first batch production and get the early birds ready for shipment.

If there are any delays or roadblocks down the road, we assure you transparent and regular updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Let's Unlock Something Special! More Pages!!
The campaign ends at midnight and we're on our way to unlocking a 4th Stretch Goal. If we can get to $4,500 before midnight, we'll be adding a crazy, cool, amazing, and wonderful 2-page spread to the end of the book. I don't want to spoil anything, but it would be extremely fun to get this unlocked, and I'm sure Angela Oddling would make this something truly amazing!!
We’ve already unlocked 3 stretch goals, so if you back for just $10, you get over 30 digital indie comics, the Supercats digital bundle, the physical edition of the new Supercats Halloween book, a vinyl sticker designed by David Jaxon, and 2 art prints designed by Angela Oddling and Corinne Roberts!!
UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS 
$4,000 - Corinne Roberts AND Angela Oddling Art Prints
We're excited to announce that when we hit $4,000, we will be unlocking special prints of these beautiful Supercats Halloween! pieces. If you want these, you have to back at the $10.00 tier or higher.
The first is by Corinne Roberts. Her style compliments the Supercats look and feel to well, I just knew I had to get her to do something for us this time around!
Art by Corinne Roberts
The second print is by Angela Oddling. She is one of the most charming and talented artists I know. Her personality and whimsy is reflected in every page of Supercats, and I absolutely love this Halloween Kitty piece she put together for backers!
Art by Angela Oddling
REMINDER: You are not charged until May 4th, and you will only be charged on May 4th, if we are funded 100% or more. So, please back now to help us build momentum and boost visibility! (You can always alter your pledge before the campaign ends.)
This Chibi Supercats Sticker comes with every physical reward!
The Story
Supercats Halloween! is a silly tale about what the Supercats do on Halloween day. Meowow is taking the day off while Ohno goes trick-or-treating, but when he finds the Bad Dogs dressed up like Supercats he springs into action to save Halloween!
Supercats books are a wonderful way to introduce kids to reading through comics. Not only are these books a blast to read out loud with your little ones. They're also a clever, cute way to introduce children to reading through comics and teach them valuable lessons of self-worth and friendship.
This is a hybrid children's comic book / comic book. It's a 20 page, full-color, 8 x 8 saddle stiched book with beautiful, whimsical art by Angela Oddling. This cross between children's picture book and comic book takes Supercats one step closer to becoming an all-ages comic book series.
Although Supercats books are meant for Pre-K to K kids, the beautiful art and whimsical tales will capture the imaginations of children of all ages. 
If you love comics, cats, superheroes, or just cute cartoony stories, you and your kids are going to love Supercats.  
 A Simple Lesson 
What good is a book without purpose? Not only is this simple story a blast to read, but it teaches the valuable lesson that friends are important and you should never be afraid to ask for help. Some things in life are too hard to do on your own. 
Children absolutely love the charming characters, and I guarantee they will want to read these books over and over again!
Something Special
I wrote this series attempting to make something different. After reading many, many kid's books over the past few years with my son, I found that there really isn't much that introduces the comic book structure or style to kids just learning to read. 
It's my hope that these books will be a bridge to get more kids interested in reading through comics and bring new readers to comics by showing them what they are and why they are so fun. 
Why Launch Now?
Fans, backers, and comic lovers,
These are crazy times. The COVID-19 pandemic has drastically changed how we all are currently living from day to day. Social distancing is difficult, but there is no reason we should stop reading and creating. 
Producing books helps put people to work and pays bills during a time of need. Money raised here will go directly to artists who need to eat, printers who need to pay their employees, delivery workers who need to keep getting that paycheck, as well as many others who cannot afford to stop working.
This story is all about relying on your friends when things get rough and never being afraid to ask for help in times of need. This is a message I feel is very timely with everything that’s happening in the world right now.
These are hard times for creators. Creative arts are extremely important during this period of social distancing. Many of us rely on them to entertain us and help us get through this difficult time. Meanwhile, conventions are being cancelled and it's making life very hard for creators like me to keep creating. So, I want to give back by sharing the work of other creators over the course of this campaign.
Every backer will be getting immediate access to a bundle of over 30 independently created and self-published comics including all of the currently published Village Comics titles: Alter-Life, Nook, Supercats and ZED.
Give what you can. I know times are hard for many, but the world keeps spinning and we will get through this together. 
As a special treat and a vote of confidence, please enjoy the digital edition of the first Supercats book for free even if you can't afford to back.
Stay healthy and safe.

The Legend of Jamie Roberts is the story of a genderqueer pirate and their two best friends treasure-hunting in a land full of dragons.
It's a webcomic that updates once a week on Wednesdays. But also...
Chapter 1 has already come to print, thanks to a previous (and successful) KickStarter campaign. And now, we're looking for funding to make Chapter 2 come to print and continue the story!
With the asking goal, I hope to cover the following expenses:
$120 for printing 20 copies of the book
$35 for the set-up fee with the printer
$150 for the ISBN and Barcode
$120 for shipping
$100 for KickStarter's fees and an emergency fund (just in case something goes wrong)
That's the bare minimum needed to make this book happen. If we reach beyond that, we'll print EVEN MORE books! It'll be like a dragon's hoard of books, yo.
And if you're a Patron on Patreon, or a Ko-Fi buddy, you'll get a Jamie Roberts sticker added to your reward package for free!
 FOR A LIMITED TIME, I have new rewards available!
If you can pledge any amount to make this project happen, that's MARVELOUS!
If you're broke, please share this campaign with your friends. Every share will help this campaign spread like dragon fire.
Thank you so much for checking out this KickStarter!
You. Are. Awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have now run 10 successful campaigns. By this point I know what risks and challenges there are - things like cancelled pledges, late shipping from the printer, misprints, packages lost in the mail, etc. That said, I know what I'm doing and how to handle these crises. And if you're not happy with it, my inbox is always open (kelcidcrawford@gmail.com).

"But why are you running a campaign on KickStarter at all if they don't let their workers unionize?"
I believe in the power of unions (speaking as the grandchild of a union worker and volunteer coordinator). And I believe in the power of KickStarter to recognize the best choice for their workers. I know KickStarter is a platform that lets creators more easily connect to their fans. And I know this platform is only possible with the hard work of the KickStarter workers who gather behind-the-scenes. They deserve to be recognized and supported. That's why I #recognizeKSRU.

campaign.story:
2020 PUBLICATIONS from BIRDCAGE BOTTOM BOOKS
With over a decade of bringing you quality comics, we're excited to introduce you to some new (to us) artists along with a few that we've worked with previously. This year we plan on publishing two "floppies" (stapled comics) and three "graphic novels" (books with spines). 
THE FLOPPIES:
"Flop Sweat #1" by Lance Ward
Last year we published Lance Ward's "Blood and Drugs", a fictional story based largely on actual events from Ward's own life. This year, we'll begin serializing his autobiographical comics under the "Flop Sweat" moniker. 
“Flop Sweat #1” by Lance Ward
“Flop Sweat” is an ongoing serialization of Lance Ward’s autobiographical comics arranged chronologically. Previous self-published collections of these comics were featured in The Best American Comics. Ward’s life has been rife with pitfalls: abandonment, addiction, mental illness, sexual assault, arrest, attempted suicide, and even a death experience (not “near-death”, he was clinically deceased!). Yet, through it all he has somehow maintained a positivity about and loyalty to his art, even after crushing his drawing hand!

   This first issue covers Ward’s preteen years including a devastating accident, his parents’ divorce and mom’s subsequent dive back into dating, bullying, shoplifting and more!
5.5” x 8.5”, 28 pages. Full-color covers and interior. $6
"Malarkey #5" by November Garcia
We've been big fans of November Garcia's hilarious autobio comics for some time, so we were thrilled when she allowed us to publish last year's "Malarkey #4". This year she's drawing a supplemental collection of diary comics to go with "Malarkey #5" just for this Kickstarter (see "Garcia diary bundle" reward tier)!
“Malarkey #5” by November Garcia
In her fifth and final issue of the ‘Malarkey’ series, November Garcia attempts to move beyond her self-destructive, debaucherous hijinks (though there’s still plenty of that) in order to address a sudden onslaught of deaths, deal with complicated familial relationships, as well as reflect on youth and mortality. Steeped in her signature self-effacing humor, this work continues to demonstrate why she is what reviewer Ryan Carey calls “the premier autobio cartoonist of our time”.
5.5” x 8.5”, 28 pages. Full-color covers and interior. $8
THE BOOKS:
"Eddie's Week" by Patrick Dean
Two different titans of the comics industry (Eleanor Davis & Danny Hellman) approached us separately encouraging us to consider publishing something by Patrick Dean, a fixture of the Georgia comics scene who is exceedingly humble about his own work while championing that of his fellow cartoonists. 
Despite a recent diagnosis of the degenerative disease ALS, Dean continues to draw prolifically (check out his Instagram!). While we don't want ALS to be the focus when discussing his talent, we do want to help in some small way. For every "Eddie's Week" sold, we'll donate $2 to ALSA, an organization that hopes to find a cure. 
“Eddie’s Week” by Patrick Dean
Eddie Lubomir is heading into a quiet week off from work, but the city of Tragoston's Stay at Home Warden Project (S.T.H.W.P.) unexpectedly places a convict in his care...in a prison cell...in his living room! Eddie and his new inmate roommate, Randall, get off to a rocky start but manage to find a way to co-exist and even enjoy each other's company. But when Randall takes advantage of a thin disguise and Eddie's date night with the unflappable Liz to escape his living room prison cell,
Eddie must create a wild web of lies that spirals out of control to protect Randall and himself in a city where no one is quite who they seem to be. The rest of Eddie's week becomes an avalanche of theft, robberies, secret organizations, and murder. Romp your way through this absurd crime comedy showcasing wacky government bureaucracy, intermittent show tunes, pissed off bees, bear costume enthusiasts and you, too, will know some of Tragoston's secrets.
6” x 8”, 196 pages. Full-color cover with b+w interior. $14
"The Burning Hotels" by Thomas Lampion
We're always on the lookout for underappreciated talent, and we hit the jackpot with Thomas Lampion. He was across the aisle at last year's CAB (Comic Arts Brooklyn), and we traded some mini-comics. As soon as we read those comics, we knew we had to convince him to let us publish something. He suggested a memoir set in the strange little town of Hot Springs in which he grew up. 
“The Burning Hotels” by Thomas Lampion
The Burning Hotels is a memoir by Thomas Lampion, centered around his eccentric North Carolina Hometown and its bizarre past while encompassing the mysteries of childhood, adulthood, American History and the importance of where we come from.
6” x 9”, 104 pages. Full-color covers and interior on natural paper. Perfect bound. $10
"WOODS" by Mike Freiheit
Mike Freiheit was one of the first people we ever met in the comics community. He had a table next to ours at SPX in 2009, and we immediately liked the cut of his jib (he was always cutting jibs back then). "Monkey Chef: A Love Story" was one of our favorite graphic novels in 2018, so we're thrilled to publish a very different book by the same talented man. 
“WOODS” by Mike Freiheit
After suffering a psychotic breakdown triggered by the election of a powerful demagogue, Beth follows her husband Jason to a remote cabin where the two try to make their own world in spite of the increasingly volatile political climate. While the couple are trying their best to overcome Beth’s break from reality, otherworldly arbiters conspire to change their lives forever. WOODS is a horror story that confronts the traumas surrounding a loved one’s battles with mental illness, questions the struggle of individual engagement in the collective, and imagines the possibilities of a world that transcends beyond earthly understanding.
7” x 10”, 144 pages. Full-color cover with b+w interior on natural paper. Perfect bound. $15

SAMPLE PAGES? SURE, WE'VE GOT SOME:
These comics are all in various states of completion, but here is at least one sample page from each:

Aren't these great comics reward enough?? No? Well, alright then. We've got some other great stuff exclusive to this campaign...
BONUS COMICS:
Backers of the "Garcia diary bundle" reward tier will receive this 12-page collection of brand new diary comics by November Garcia!
Backers can get two 32-page horror comics Mike Freiheit drew during Inktober (a page a day for every day of October!).

ORIGINAL ART:

A 45-minute Skype or FaceTime video session with Mike Freiheit drawing on his experience as a teacher to shepherd you through a comics project (whether it's your first or one of many). Or, a 45-minute Skype or FaceTime video session with BBB founder and cartoonist J.T. Yost, during which he'll provide tips and specific contacts relating to self-publishing, printing, distribution, promotion or any other questions you might have about comics. Yost will draw on his lectures at SVA, FIT and other comics classes.

Thank you for your support of our previous Kickstarter. We wanted to let you know that our 2021 campaign is now live and includes lots of incredible comics. There's a limited number of early-bird discounted specials, so don't sleep on it!

Here's the link (feel free to signal boost!): https://buff.ly/3b09VkZ

This year's publications include TOO TOUGH TO DIE: An Aging Punx Anthology, Robert H. Stevenson's COMFORT CREATURES mini, Captain Rottsteak's EVERYTHING IS SUPER graphic novel, and three new issues of Lance Ward's autobiographical FLOP SWEAT series. Check 'em out along with tons of custom art, original art, limited edition comics, and other great rewards.

Happy Thanksgiving, y'all! Hope you're all staying safe and eating well. 
I'm shipping out all rewards just as fast as I can pack all these lovely comics, so keep an eye on your mailbox. I wish I had an army of humans (or any primates with opposable thumbs) to help out, but for now it's just me. I thank you for your patience, and I know the wait will be worth it.

Hello! I think I can safely say that we're all basting in anxiety and suspense over the next few days, so I offer up some GOOD NEWS:

Thomas Lampion's "The Burning Hotels" is on its way to us from the printer! Also, we'll be having our biggest sale of the year at the end of November, so be sure you're on our mailing list. 25% off, 50% off and special sale bundles on most of our distro and BBB products!

campaign.story:
HISTORY IS HORROR!!!
This Black History Month Rosarium Publishing cordially invites you to see our history like you never have before.
From Box of Bones #2
FROM THE MINDS OF AYIZE JAMA-EVERETT 
AND JOHN JENNINGS!!!
When Black graduate student, Lyndsey, begins her dissertation work on a mysterious box that pops up during the most violent and troubled time in Africana history, she has no idea that her research will lead her on a phantasmagorical journey from West Philadelphia riots to Haitian slave uprisings. Wherever Lyndsey finds someone who has seen the Box, chaos ensues. Soon, even her own sanity falls into question. In the end, Lyndsey will have to decide if she really wants to see what’s inside the Box of Bones.
Described as “Tales from the Crypt Meets Black History,” Box of Bones is a supernatural nightmare tour through some of the most violent and horrific episodes in the African Diaspora.
Volume 1 contains art from John Jennings, Sole Rebel, Damian Duffy, Frances Olivia Liddell-Rodriguez, Tommy Nguyen, Jarmel and Jamal Williams, and Bryan Christopher Moss with covers by Stacey Robinson!!!
Help us raise $10,000 to bring this book to print.
By Anthony Moncada

THE CREATORS
Ayize Jama-Everett
Ayize Jama-Everett was born in 1974 and raised in Harlem, New York. Since then he has traveled extensively in Northern Africa, New Hampshire, and Northern California. He holds a Master’s in Clinical Psychology and a Master’s in Divinity. He is the author of three novels, The Liminal People, The Liminal War, and The Entropy of Bones.

"When John Jennings first brought the idea to me years ago, I never imagined it would involve so many other creatives that I’d admired from afar. It’s been amazing to collaborate with some of the most talented up and coming and established artists. The fact that we’re organizing around what’s basically a bad fever dream of my historically obsessed black brain is a bit humbling, but I think the narrative and our process gives everyone a chance to shine. My hope is that this work is transformative to the industry, showing creatives and publishers that narratives around black people in the US are as diverse and marketable as any other stories. I’m proud to be a part of this and excited for what happens in the future of the Box of Bones."
Box of Bones #1 -- Cover by Stacey Robinson
John Jennings
John Jennings is a Professor of Media and Cultural Studies at the University of California at Riverside. His creative and academic work centers around intersectional narratives regarding identity politics and popular media. Jennings is co-editor of the Eisner Award-winning collection The Blacker the Ink: Constructions of Black Identity in Comics and Sequential Art and co-founder/organizer of The Schomburg Center’s Black Comic Book Festival in Harlem. He is co-founder and organizer of the MLK NorCal’s Black Comix Arts Festival in San Francisco and also SOL-CON: The Brown and Black Comix Expo at the Ohio State University. Together with Damian Duffy, he worked on the New York Times Best Selling Kindred: A Graphic Novel Adaptation (for which he won his second Eisner) and Parable of the Sower: A Graphic Novel Adaptation. His debut solo effort, the hoodoo noir Blue Hand Mojo: Hard Times Road, and Pitch Black Rainbow: The Art of John Jennings are his other Rosarium projects. He was recently tagged to direct and curate a new imprint for Abrams, Megascope.

"We created Box of Bones because we wanted to figure out a creative way to talk about black history and teach people about the injustices that black folk have had to endure. We were thinking about the Movement for Black Lives and our current political climate and how violence against people of color has been both normalized and erased. Box of Bones is way to talk about that erasure and present a narrative that embraces a righteous rage about black pain but also talk about what happens when you let yourself indulge in that rage too much."
From Box of Bones #3 -- Art by Bryan Christopher Moss

I hope 2021 is treating you well and that things are finally looking up.
I'm catching up on some late fulfillments. Many of you have yet to fill out your surveys. If you haven't received your order yet, it's because you haven't done so. Please fill out your survey as soon as possible, so we can get your books to you. I really appreciate it.

updates.update_userinfo: The Day the Klan Came to Town
updates.update_content:
Hey, Everybody--
Hope all is well in your world. I just wanted to tell you about another KS campaign, THE DAY THE KLAN CAME TO TOWN. It's a graphic novel I wrote about a Klan riot that happened in my hometown (Carnegie, PA) back in 1923.
We've already hit our initial goal. We're now trying to reach $10K. We could really use your help. Please feel free to check it out:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ww3/the-day-the-klan-came-to-town?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=the%20day%20the%20klan%20came%20to%20town

RUINING CHRISTMAS
Hey, Party People---

Our good friends at Stranger Comics, known for their heroic Elven series, Niobe, have some new "heroic" Elves in comics… in a hilarious and cheeky comedy caper: RUINING CHRISTMAS. Yeah, this ain’t for kids! It’s an irreverent tale about the spirit of giving taking it… for far too long... We could all use a laugh right now! Oh yeah, and Seb says you have to read it with a British gangster accent.

Hi, Everybody--
I have GREAT news! My printer tells me that they will be shipping the books from Toronto on the 22nd. That means I'll be getting them either around Christmas Eve or Boxing Day. I'll be shipping them off as soon as I get them, so you'll be getting them around New Year's Day.
Thanks as always for your support and patience. We couldn't do any of this without you. Take care and enjoy your holiday season.

Hi, Everybody--

Sorry it's been so long. This year, as you know, has been quite the rollercoaster ride. Yes, we've had a few setbacks. However, things are back on track. We're in the final stages of the editing process and should be sending BOX OF BONES off to the printer in the next 2 or 3 weeks. There will be some other good news later as there are some pretty cool things going on with BoB in particular and Rosarium in general.

updates.update_content:
Greetings, Everyone--
I apologize for the delay. Things, as you may assume, have been fairly topsy turvy these past couple months. Chasing around a quarantined 3-year-old is a helluva lot more challenging than I would've ever expected. However, we are safe and sound and grateful that our family and friends are also the same.
I sincerely hope that you, too, are safe and have figured out a way to navigate the craziness of the outside world.

campaign.story:
STORY
  In this fast-paced 24 page one-shot psychological horror, we are thrown into the life of a depressed and suicidal man. Not knowing of his past or why he is in such a dire state of mind, we are shown a sequence of events that will have undeniable consequences on the man's life. We observe his descent into the depths of his mind where his demons reside and where every fiber of his being will be put to the test. He faces the inner turmoil between personal faith and self resentment. Although the events of his journey are tragic, the story depicts a strong and powerful message that leads the way toward enlightenment.
 ART TEAM 
 creator/ writer
  Arismendy Jimenez
I am a 24-year-old aspiring comic book writer from Paterson New Jersey that is addicted to watching cartoons, anime and reading comic books. The love and strong passion for art and storytelling lead me to pursue a career as a comic book writer. I Obtained the goal of one day making my own line of comics that will demonstrate my creativity and skill. I worked a full-time job, saved money and funded the book entirely by myself for this moment. This is the FIRST of many, and I'm very excited for you guys to be a part of my creative journey.
 Outland Entertainment
  For this project, I went out and hired Outland entertainment, a trustworthy company that works with a great selection of talented artists and letterers. Through them, I was put in contact with an accomplished artist by the name of Ger Curti and an incredible letterer by the name of Ed Dukeshire.
Instagram:outlandentertainment
 penciler/ inker - Ger Curti
  Ger Curti is a comic book artist and illustrator based in Buenos Aires, Argentina. His work has appeared in the two times nominated horror anthology Chillers published by Transfuzion and Troma Films, Ignition by 215 Ink, Bloody F##king Revenge by Challenger Comics, and the independent series Palooka by Person of Merit Comics. He also collaborated with Terminus, a comic magazine published in his country, and does illustration work for Outland Entertainment, Paizo, Goodman Games, and Gallant Knight Games. You can contact him at: gcurti@live.com.ar
Instagram: Gercurti
 letterer - Ed Dukeshire
  Ed Dukeshire is a designer and Harvey-nominated letterer working in the biz since 2001. He has lettered comics from mainstream to creator-owned favorites, including Hulk, X-Men, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, TMNT, and ShadowHawk for publishers like Marvel, Boom! Studios, Image, and DC Comics.
Instagram:edukedw
 Editor - Felix Nunez
  A freelance illustrator/ graphic designer and graduate from William Paterson University. Apart from being an editor, he's also a childhood friend. He has read my scripts and provided feedback as well as designing my logo, t-shirt, and some prints. While supporting and encouraging my vision, Felix has been a tremendous help in my creative journey as I embarked on this project. Being able to work with your childhood friend only makes this project much more special and meaningful.
Instagram:felixnunezart
WHY?
I felt compelled to talk about the wide variety of struggles that affect people with mental illness by conveying them through the unfortunate experience of one man. I was inspired by my family members and some friends whom deal with mental illnesses such as depression, schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.  Tackling the uncertainty inherent in not being able to trust your own mind is something I vividly express in this story.  Mental illness is real, and this is my interpretation of one person's struggle with his psyche.
 WHY KICKSTARTER? 
I'm coming to Kickstarter to help raise funds for a small print run of at least 200 copies of ENLIGHTENMENT. The book is 100% complete and ready to print. Through Kickstarter, it is my desire to get the book into the hands of as many people as possible and would love your support in helping accomplish this goal. 
PREVIEW OF ENLIGHTENMENT!
 4 PAGE PREVIEW LINK! 
PLAN
As mentioned previously, the book is fully penciled, inked, and lettered only requiring printing.  By pledging to this Kickstarter you can be the first to have ENLIGHTENMENT in the palm of your hands with exclusive features such as autographs, stickers, bookmarks, prints and much more. Through the aristocracy comics email list, you would be updated on the status of this project as well as be notified on future projects. Once the funding goal is reached I will be able to ship the product in a quick and satisfying manner.
 PROJECT BREAKDOWN
                     I set the goal for this project at 1000 dollars, fully aware of the fact that the total investment is beyond that. This is my first attempt at Kickstarter and I have decided to prioritize having a successful launch and getting the comic to as many people as possible even if I have to take a monetary loss. More than the money, I have invested a lot of effort and time and I'm very passionate about just being able to release it into the world. Also, I need to prove myself if I'm ever going to tackle more ambitious projects with higher funding goals in the future. I am confident that my project will stand out enough to convince you amazing people that your pledge was well invested. I have worked very hard on this project and feel as though it is a worthwhile venture. Please believe in me!

 THANK YOU! 
Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project. Please spread the word and tell everyone to be a part of the Aristocracy movement!

campaign.story:
House of Sweets is a new 36 page one-shot comic book from Cabal Comics. The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to cover printing and production costs. It is written by Fraser Campbell with art from Iain Laurie, colour art by David B. Cooper and lettering by Colin Bell. 
 The Tale...
Hans is a novelist, struggling to complete his latest work. His sister Retha is looking to reassess her life after the end of a long term relationship. Seeking space and perspective, they travel to the forest and the old cabin they used to vacation in as children. However once there, things quickly take a sinister turn. Hans finds passages in his book he has no memory of writing while Retha becomes increasingly drawn to a mysterious presence in the woods. As time passes, their behaviour becomes erratic as both siblings appear unable to escape their own stifling obsessions. What is causing these odd transformations? Is it the isolation? Or has the forest drawn them back for a reason?
 From the team that brought you The Edge Off...
House of Sweets is a pastoral psychological horror, loosely based on the fairy tales of the Brothers Grimm.
The Kickstarter has a target of £1,400 which will be used to cover printing and production costs. It features exclusively priced treats like original pages from the comic, commission slots from artist Iain Laurie and variant covers by our brilliant pals Martin Simmonds (Friendo, Punks Not Dead, Dying is Easy) and John Person (Beast Wagon, Blood Moon) plus we have some fun ideas for stretch goals if we’re lucky enough to go beyond target.
What’s the Buzz?
We’ve been lucky enough to get some amazing feedback from some industry pros and advance reviews from some brilliant comic websites. Here’s what they have to say:
“A beautiful, terrible nightmare of a book.” Dan Watters (Deep Roots, Coffin Bound, Lucifer)
“As nightmares go, this is great. It’s got guilty intrigue, menacing poetry and beautiful drawings. But it’s still a nightmare.” Frank Quitely
“A great new release from a fascinating, experimental comics team –unsettling and contemplative in its picking apart the mind of a creator.” Steve Orlando (JLA, Supergirl, Midnighter)
“A fevered glimpse into memoryscapes of trauma and the inescapable tragedy of childhood secrets - it’ll remind you what comics can be.” Ram V (These Savage Shores, Batman, Catwoman)
“A surreal and disturbing tale that really keeps you superbly off balance all the way to the end.” Big Comic Page (full review here)
“A fever dream of a comic that sends the reader spiralling down a descent into madness and terror.” Broken Frontier (full review here)
Creators
Fraser Campbell is the writer of comics Alex Automatic, Sleeping Dogs, The Edge Off and Heart of Steal. His comic Alex Automatic won best UK Single Issue at Edinburgh Comic Con in 2017.
Iain Laurie is best known as the artist behind Iain Laurie’s Horror Mountain, The Edge Off and the smash-hit indie horror And Then Emily Was Gone. He also contributed to DC’s Love is Love anthology in 2017.
David B. Cooper is a colourist and cartoonist from Glasgow, Scotland. In addition to colouring books such as Alex Automatic, Forged and Double D, he has written and self-published comics such as Face Down In The Mud and Dead Silence.
Colin Bell has lettered comics for publishers such as Image, Dark Horse and Boom! Studios. However, Colin is best known for his work as writer on the acclaimed all-ages comics Dungeon Fun and Pirate Fun.
 Did you miss out on THE EDGE OFF? 
We've added a level where you can get House of Sweets and The Edge Off together, in print or in digital form! 
Original Art Rewards, Commissions and more! 
As well as the chance to grab the comic, we're offering the chance to own some of the original art by Iain Laurie. There are some one-of-a-kind pages available currently but of course, once they're gone they're gone! As well as this, Iain is offering some strictly limited commission slots - 5x A4 slots at £35.00 - all coming with a print copy of the comic.
Original Art Reward: Page 6
Original Art Reward: Page 7
Original Art Reward: Page 8
Original Art Reward: Page 11
Original Art Reward: Page 12
Original Art Reward: Page 17
As well as that we have two amazing variant covers by the fantastic Martin Simmonds and John Pearson. Can't choose your favourite? We have a level where you can grab all three covers! 
Martin Simmonds Variant
John Pearson Variant
 We also have something a bit special this time around - a level where Iain and I will help YOU make your indie comic! Back at this level and I will edit your script and Iain will create your cover. A one-of-a-kind reward, act quickly if you fancy it! 
Note: Obviously, we take our cues from whoever nabs this reward in terms of timescales. I've marked it as to be delivered by Oct. 2020 but that's totally flexible and will be discussed with whoever chooses the reward.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The comic is complete and printed. I've used Kickstarter many times to fund comics projects and obviously anyone who has backed previous comics knows we can be trusted to deliver on campaign pledges. As always, commission delivery dates should be taken as a guide and may change slightly, but we’ll endeavour to get these out as quickly as we can. We will hopefully be ready to send out rewards in February 2020 at the latest but you'll be updated if there's any change to that.

Postage
A quick note of caution regarding postage – if you are considering an original page, postage will be expensive. Obviously you’ll see how much on the reward level but we wanted to make sure you are all fully aware before buying. Postage costs seem to be forever on the rise, especially for outsize items going abroad. Hopefully that doesn’t put you off, but please do bear it in mind.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
