updates.update_userinfo: New Kickstarter! "What I Did Over My 2020 Staycation!"
Pages are final and shipping dates are set!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
I know that I just hit your inbox with those reward surveys, and the last thing I want to do is assail your inbox with duplicate information...  But I got a few questions and figured if a couple people are asking, a  bunch more may be wondering! 
So first off, both "Kenttucky Pussy" and "Sketchbook Picture Sleeves: Volume 1" are at the printer and scheduled to be delivered to me in time to debut them at Cartoon Crossroads Columbus (CXC)  at the Saturday and Sunday expo. (September 28 and 29.)  One of your options for delivery of your reward is to come to this great Columbus show and corner me at the Nix Comics table.  Just shake your fist at me and yell "GIVE ME MY STUFF, MAAAAAAAAAN..."

Hey Everybody!  
It was a bit of a nail-biter, but early yesterday morning we hit goal and I'm happy to say that both of these books will be brought to print!  My hope is to have both ready by the Cartoon Crossroads Columbus (CXC) expo on September 28th and 29th.  Anyone who wants to pick up their rewards there and then should let me know and I'll accommodate ya.  J.T. might even make an appearance if you want to get your copy of "Kenttucky Pussy" signed!  Good lord willing and the creek don't rise, rest of the books will mail out that next Monday.

updates.update_userinfo: New Rewards: Original JT Dockery Art!
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
Got some new (and exciting!!!) rewards up and I wanted to give the folks who have already chipped in a shot at them first, before I let the broader populace know about them!  JT has uncovered some of the art for the originally intended poetry book version of "Kenttucky Pussy" and has generously offered them up as rewards.  I have set each one for $50 (free ship in the U.S.) which includes both new nix publications.  If you want to change yur pledge and grab one of these, just go to the main page for the campaign (link below) and click on the blue button that says "manage your pledge"

updates.update_userinfo: Phew! Week one in the books!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
Thanks to you all for getting me through the first week of this project!  Depending on your familiarity with crowdfunding, you probably now that the first week of a kickstarter is the most explosive in terms of drama for the creator/publisher.  After all of the hard work (and frankly more fun) part of putting a project together, suddenly there is suddenly urgency.  All of the articles I've read about running a  successful kickstarter have a sentence that basically amounts to "99.9% of campaigns that don't reach 50% funded by the end of week 1 ARE DOOMED TO FAILURE and the people running them should go buy a shack in Montana to go ruminate in."  Or something like that.  Point is there is a lot of pressure to be successful week 1.

updates.update_userinfo: 1/3 of the way home! Thanks so much!
updates.update_content: Hey everybody!  Thanks again for helping me bring these two books into being.  You should have all received a thank-you coupon code for use at my mail order site, if you haven't or can't figure out how to enter it, let me know.

updates.update_content:
Hey, just letting everyone know that the final rewards are heading out this week. We have been short a couple of set lists and drum sticks but those shall be sent out in due course. 
While we are grateful for your patience we do have to apologise for the lateness of your rewards. When we started this we had no idea that Andy would have to go for a brain operation midway through the process. This left us without the cash to get some rewards as we were relying on money from gigs to pay for certain aspects of the Kickstarter.

Hey, sorry this has taken a little longer than expected, but the T-shirts are finally here and we can start shipping out the orders. 
We should have most of them shipped out over the next couple of weeks. Everything will be with you by the end of January. Even all those of you outwith the UK. 
Due to the whole Christmas thing I won't have the signed set lists or drum sticks until the first week in January as I forgot to get them off the guys. Sorry about that, but they will be shipped out as soon as I get them.
Just to make you aware that the preorders for the EP will be going live in January. This is to cash in on some of the radio play and good reviews we've been getting. It won't be sent out, or go live on Spotify and the like, until March. We shall be launching it at Bannermans, Edinburgh on the 14th March. Which hasn't been announced yet, but you guys gave us the cash to do this thing so we're gonna tell you first.

Hey, just letting you all know that the CD's are back from the printers and are ready to go. We are just waiting for the badges, stickers and T-shirts to arrive which means we are running later than anticipated. As soon as they are here we will have them sent out to you.
Thank you for your patience
James

Hey guys, just letting you know that if you want your name to appear on the CD then you will have to fill out your survey by the 27th October.
If you haven't filled it in by then, we will have to use your Kickstarter name.
This is so we can get production started on the CD's. 
Thank you

Sorry we've been radio silent for the last few months. My computer took a hissy fit and it's practically impossible to update you from my phone. Anyway, a quick wee update to let you all know that the masters of the EP are back. You will have the digital versions sent to you in the next week or so depending on when you fill out the survey.
It's gonna take a while longer to get the CD's to you as they still need to be made. We just want to get the tracks out to you as soon as possible. The feedback so far has been incredible and we are really looking forward to letting you all hear it.

Hey, first of all, thank you to everyone for pledging to the campaign. Sorry it's taken just over a week to put up the first update but a lot of stuff has happened in that week. I'll bring you all up to date now.
Thanks to you we head into the studio next week with Toby Jepson, thank you. We are currently going through the songs with Toby and figuring out which ones we want to do for this EP and the best way to do them.

As we have rushed past our goal, we have now put up Stretch Goals.
We asked the internet and the two things they seemed to want the most are plectrums and patches.
So... at £1500 all physical backers will receive a She Burns Red plectrum. At £2000 all physical backers will receive a She Burns Red patch.

We are so excited to announce the producer of our upcoming EP is Toby Jepson!
Most people will know him as the front man of Little Angels and Wayward sons but his producer credits include Saxon, The Answer, The Virginmarys and Toseland to name but a few. We really can’t wait to get into the studio! Pre production has already started and we are hoping for it to be out mid to late October. We will also hopefully have our next single and video done by September.

Hey, just a wee word to say thank you to everyone for pledging so far. We are currently sitting with just £140 until we reach our goal. All in one week. Incredible.
We still have some way to go so tell your friends, shout from the rooftops and if you don't have any friends... stop people in the street and tell them about the power of She Burns Red. Or something, just don't get arrested cause we don't have the cash to bail you out.
We are currently working with our producer to make sure we give you the best EP possible. We will be announcing him next week, we're just waiting for the all clear. Then we will bash you in the face with it. We are very excited about working with him and we hope you will be too.

campaign.story:
Cursed to become zombies whenever they play their music, the members of the punk band Toe Tag Riot use their "zombie powers" ethically, only murderizing and eating bigots, homophobes, transphobes, sexists, and racists.  
  Toe Tag Riot formed in the 2000s, devoured and digested scores of Nazi skinheads, sexist dudebros, and even the Westboro Baptist Church (see volume 1 for that tale!), then broke up, to the dismay of their legions of fans.  But now they're back with a reunion tour sure to be even bloodier, funnier and a little more queer than ever before!
  And yes, fan-favorite guest stars Teddy Mercury, and Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy, are back!
 Return of the Toe Tag Riot is a digital-first 4-issue series, collected to physical trade paperback.
Issues 1-4 covers and the classic punk albums they're homages to. Issue 1 cover by Jonathan Brandon Sawyer and Josh Jensen, others by Sean Von Gorman, Gab Contreras, and Tim Daniel
Pinup by Bobby Timony to be included in issue 1 and the TPB
Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Lab Raider)
Sean Von Gorman (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, Love is Love)
Gab Contreras (All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World, 2000 AD)
Taylor Esposito (Red Hood and the Outlaws, Fresh Romance)

Kickstarter video features a sample of "EAT YOUR FACE," the new Toe Tag Riot* single that's been burning up the charts ever since the band reunited!

* IRL recorded by TTR's buddy Rene Rosa - full version available along with the band's previous hit "Toe Tag Riot" on the cassette single reward tier.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let's be real: Kickstarters are a beast, and there are always going to be challenges, but between Matt and Sean, we've run 6 successful Kickstarter projects in the past —so we know where the pitfalls are, we know how to hustle and how to promote, and we feel absolutely confident we can bang this out and make a very very cool book in the process.

There is a great publisher onboard to publish Return of the Toe Tag Riot, as long as we can pay the art and creative costs with the successful Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey all, I thank anyone who still reads these updates and please know that I love you.  Building a career in comics, when you're an opinionated loudmouth with something to say, is especially tough.  It means I have to reach out to you folks, and sometimes, like today, I have to reach out for maybe the third time?  I'm not sure.
What I do know is that DEATH TRAP is in the home stretch, but we only have 5 days left.  Please check it out?  Please pledge.  I swear to you, this is a beautifully illustrated book with a ton of heart, a lot of bananas fun, and just enough of my point of view that you'll be like "Ah, he snuck that in there, nice."

updates.update_userinfo: An update, a delay, an explanation and apology - TOE TAG RIOT will be back another time.
updates.update_content:
Friends, 
Matt here.  I want to thank you all for backing this project and believing in the vision - wanting TOE TAG RIOT to return in this new age of awfulness to lay waste to (and make fun of) the absolute scum of the Earth.
But, we're needing to cancel the project for now, and we'll bring it back another time.  Some of you may know, but for those who don't:  My Dad was taken to the hospital about a week and a half ago, and my head has not been in the game for promotion, press, and the like.  I've not been able to focus on much aside from immediate deadlines, my dogs and the rescue, and the overwhelming worry and stress over what's going on with my Dad.

Hello everyone!
First of all, THANK YOU! We are well past the first day of the campaign and we are THRILLED and MOVED with the response from Toe Tag Riot fans who have welcomed us back to bring you more of the same!
Matt and I would like to take a moment to thank all 69 of your reading this. That's right, 69 people have committed their hard earned cash into helping Matt and I make another comic where a Zombie Punk Rock Band eat the worst humanity has to offer. What an fitting milestone to commemorate!

Cover A and Cover B

What is Crumple
Reporter Martin Elroy is visiting the home of the reclusive scientist couple Simon and Diana Roschler. They've invented a time machine, one that projects moments in time onto the present. But when the machine malfunctions, the family home turns into a shifting death trap where the Roschlers' past regrets are put on display. Can they escape this death trap? Can they escape themselves?
Page 1
Who are we?
Kyle Lawrence -   is the script master for Crumple and has been working at the project for nearly three years. He's also the campaign manager. Kyle's comics have been featured in ComicBookHour's One Comic to Rule Them All, Back From the Depths' Hallowscream 2018 and Oneshi Press' Winter 2018 Anthology. 
 Bo Christian - the colorist and is a former US Air Force Structural journeymen, which means he enlisted to be Bob the Builder instead of GI Joe. However he wasn’t really good at that so he decided to become a comic book writer/artists (which, depending on who you ask, he’s not very good at that either). He has been part of two anthologies; Oneshi Press’s 2018 anthology and Stache Comic’s Everafterward a reddit community based anthology. 
 Mac Radwanski (Artist) is a comic book artist. As a kid, he dreamed about being Batman, or drawing comic books for a living. The latter part worked out. He published such books as "Doc Dino", "Runners", "The Face and the Hand". When not drawing, he likes to play my guitar, or relax with some video games." 
What are we making?
Your pledges go toward the creation of Crumple #1, the first in a three part comic book mini-series about a malfunctioning time machine and the poisonous power of regret. Luckily, the first 8 pages are already finished and are available to read right here!


Page 2
 The Idea
Crumple was born out of a nightmare, of a loved one becoming trapped inside a wall and suffocating. From there the idea was given form on scripted pages and tempered through writes, rewrites and critiques into its current form brought to life by artist and colorist Mac Radwanski and Bo Christian.
Page 3
 Timeline
Once the project is funded, it should take approximately two months for our artists to work their magic. Then the pages go to the printer, and then comes the work of shipping everything out. We plan to have everything arrive during October, a perfectly spooky month for a horror comic.
Page 4
 Budget
Payment for art and lettering: $1200
Printing: $1500
Shipping costs: $1.75 to ship each comic + 50 cents for each envelope) x 500 copies printed = $1,125 
Business cards: $10 for 250 
Total: $3,835
Page 5
 What this means to me 
I came up with the concept for Crumple about 3 years ago and have spent that time doing rewrites and rewrites, gathering talented people to bring the project to life. To me Crumple is a beginning. A future career in comics where I continue to connect with people through stories is possible with just this one project coming to fruition. Help me make this nightmare a reality.

**STRETCH GOALS!**
$565 - More books printed for sale at Small Press Expo PLUS a bonus page in the PDF to showcase comic scripts for chapter 2.
The Legend of Jamie Roberts is the story of...well, Jamie Roberts: a genderqueer pirate, and their two best friends, Thomas and Daniel. One day, during a pirate raid with the crew of Captain O’Malley, the trio finds an unfinished map. Jamie takes one look at this map and says...
Thus begins Chapter 1 of The Legend of Jamie Roberts. It was a webcomic that updated once a week on Wednesdays, and now Chapter 1 is going to print!
What’s in the print version that the online one won’t have? Well, there will be…
a one-page bonus comic featuring Captain O’Malley (never before published online!)
behind the scenes character sketches
and more features!
Now, The Legend is also on Patreon, and that’s how these comic pages could update online so consistently. Patrons on Patreon who also back this campaign will get an extra mini-comic in their rewards!
“Wait,” you may be saying, “if you have a Patreon, why run a KickStarter campaign?”
Because a) Patreon covers groceries and art supplies, and b) this KickStarter is to cover the stuff that Patreon can’t cover.
So what WILL the KickStarter funding cover? Here’s the breakdown:
$150 for the ISBN and Barcode
$115 for printing, set up fee, and getting the books to me
$100 for shipping to backers
$50 for printing miscellaneous backer rewards
$50 for any surprise costs (international shipping, transfer fees, and other costs would be covered by this)
What rewards are available for backing this project? Those are listed already, but they include:
physical and digital copies of the book
mini-prints
a new 11x17 inch print to hang on your wall
and other goodies!
So if anything fits your budget, I hope you can pledge!
If you’re broke, please share this campaign with your pirate-loving friends. Every share helps.
Thank you for your support!
You. Are. Awesome.

campaign.story:
Anger provides the energy needed for change. Maybe your situation, maybe yourself. But learning to respond to your anger, not react from it, is the key to healthy usage. 
Think of healthy anger as a road you are walking. On the left side of the road there is the anger that we don’t allow ourselves to feel and express (which makes us sick and ruins our relationships) and on the other side we have anger that is over-expressed (which makes us sick and ruins our relationships). If you have veered off onto one side, you want to course correct back to the middle, not overcorrect to the other side.
Aren't we all pissed off about something right now? We're not wrong to be. But how do we use that anger to change the world instead of letting it poison our own lives?
About the book
Unf*ck Your Anger: Using Science to Understand Frustration, Rage, and Forgiveness by Dr. Faith G. Harper, PhD, LPC-S, ACS, ACN is a 5x7 inch, 128-page paperback book, illustrated by Trista Vercher.
This is Dr. Faith's ninth book! In it, she uses her trademark combination of science and swearing to shine a light on this much-felt but little-discussed emotion. She tackles topics like:
Anger's evolutionary function and why we need it even though we often get carried away with it
The human brain's nine rage triggers and how to figure out your main ones
The close relationships between anger and depression, bipolar disorder, anxiety, trauma, and self-harm
Tons of tools and exercises for managing your anger in healthier ways
Steps for using your anger to create social change
A new 5-stage model for practicing forgiveness
A little about the origins of this book: It started out as a 32-page zine (if you don't know what that is, it's pronounced "zeen" and is like a stapled pamphlet but cooler) called This is Your Brain on Anger, which evolved into becoming one of the chapters in Unf*ck Your Brain. We've been steadily reworking and expanding those chapters into full-fledged books in their own right, in order of popularity—starting with anxiety and depression, and now it's anger's turn. (If that doesn't give you a snapshot of our national psyche, I don't know what does.) The book will be over 4 times as long as the zine/chapter and completely rewritten — it contains a few of the same big ideas but is it's own entirely new thing. 
A spread from the book, showing an illustration of a brain throwing unhealthy anger in the trash, with a framed "healthy anger" poster on the wall, and the text "Much better!"
A spread from the book's chapter on using your anger for social action, showing an illustration of brains participating in a march, holding a sign that says "enough is enough"
A spread from the chapter on forgiveness, showing two brains hugging it out.
About the author
The author poses with one of the classic focal points of anger discussed in her book.
Dr. Faith Harper is a trauma-informed therapist with a PhD and a growing number of other degrees and certifications. She is the author of eight books including the bestselling Unf*ck Your Brain. She lives in San Antonio, Texas where she has a private practice, trains other clinicians, and writes prolifically. She proudly identifies as a woman of color and an uppity intersectional feminist.
About the publisher
The day we got 11 pallets of books delivered to our building.
We are Microcosm! Since 1996, we've been publishing and distributing books and zines chosen to put your power in your hands. Today we are independently distributed and don't sell directly to Amazon. We have 13 workers, over 400 books in print and over 10,000 titles in our distribution, an office and storefront in Portland, Oregon, and a whole lot of ideas, energy, and heart. Every day, we take our anger at structural inequities (and the ways the publishing industry upholds them) and work to channel it into building something better. 
About the rewards
We have a lot of Dr. Faith books here, plus many great books by other authors that we have the pleasure of publishing. Enjoy!
The workbook — at only $5, this is definitely not the main event. It can stand alone... kind of. But trust us, the $10 book is where it's at. You can add extra workbooks to any reward level for $5 a pop.
Unf*ck Your Anger — This is the book itself! You're gonna love it!
The ebook — comes out a bit later, in January, 2020. Why? Piracy. Which leads us to...
Piracy Forgiveness — This reward level is a grant of general amnesty for any past piracy. You'll get a copy of the ebook, put a little money towards any Dr. Faith ebooks you've downloaded without paying for in the past, and hopefully walk away feeling a little lighter, free-er, and less likely to avail yourself of unauthorized free digital downloads in the future. 
Unf*ck Your Day-to-Day
Not sure what's up with you, but know your brain is jacked and want some basic, baseline help? Here's a good place to start. Includes:
Unf*ck Your Anger
Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook
 Unf*ck Your Brain — This is the Dr. Faith classic! Walks you through recovering from the way trauma (which might be from a big traumatic event but is just as likely to come from life's thousands of cumulative paper cuts) rewires your brain
An Unholy Quadrifecta
We've got a whole chapter coming at you about how Anger is often a manifestation of anxiety, depression, or PTSD.... with anger just being a more socially-acceptable way to express those things for some. If it's you, read all about them:
Unf*ck Your Anger
 This is Your Brain on Anxiety — A small but potently helpful Dr. Faith manual on the care and healing of an anxious brain
 This is Your Brain on Depression — Dr. Faith walks you through the science of depression and what you can do about it
 This is Your Brain on PTSD — Derived from the Unf*ck Your Brain book, this zine takes a deeper dive into the many faces of post-traumatic stress disorder
I Love Workbooks
It kinda took us by surprise, but it turns out that a lot of you really, really love workbooks. We've been making them for a bunch of different books recently, including this one. Here's a selection of all the ones we've printed so far, most of them in the form of zines:
Unf*ck Your Anger
Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook
 Unf*ck Your Brain Workbook — A whole bunch of photocopyable worksheets for coping with emotions and vanquishing your brain gremlins
 Unf*ck Your Intimacy Workbook — Alone or with a loved one, work through these questionnaires and exercises to find more fulfilling close relationships and sex
 Achieve Your Goals Workbook — Choose a goal. Workshop it in this tiny zine. Actualize. Repeat
 From Chaos to Creativity Workbook — Trying to figure out how to manage your day-to-day life so that you can find time for the work you're most passionate about? Start here
 A People's Guide to Publishing Workbook — If you've ever dreamed of starting a publishing company, this workbook is a great place to get that plan on paper. Could work for other big creative dreams, too
Unf*ck Your Relationships
Anger may or may not be the cause of our difficulties getting along with the people closest to us, but it sure isn't helping matters. Here's a set of books to start working some of that out with:
Unf*ck Your Anger
Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook
 Unf*ck Your Intimacy —Dr. Faith's deep dive into sex and relationships. She addresses various obstacles to having good sex and deep love, and shows you how to untangle it all, for your own self and in your close relationships
 Unf*ck Your Adulting — This Dr. Faith book is not so much about how to fix a flat tire, more about how not to totally freak out or lash out when you get a flat or other such life crap
Chill-Out Books
Will putting on some really relaxing music, pouring a glass of lemonade, and curling up in a hammock with these books help you manage your anger? Won't know til you've tried.
Unf*ck Your Anger
 The Beard Coloring Book — Put your thoughts on hold for a while and get lost in these swirling patterns and fascinating, fancy beards
 Pedal, Stretch, Breathe — Move your body in ways that make your whole self feel better
 Dream Whip #15 — Reading these travel stories is like being lost in thought watching the world go by through a bus window
 Amica's World — Relax and marvel at photos of this giant bird who lives in a suburban living room
 Unf*ck Your Sleep — Dr. Faith's zine about sleeping is a game-changer
Eat Well, Feel Calm
This is another one where ymmv. Preparing and eating a good meal might totally get you into a calmer zone, and if so check out this excellent bundle of cookbooks:
 Unf*ck Your Anger (not a cookbook!)
 Paleo for Unicorns — Learn basic recipes that even picky kids will eat, paired with inspiring feminist diet rants
 Mama Tried — Vegan versions of classic Italian recipes—comfort food galore!
 Chocolatology — Sweet or savory, chocolate makes pretty much everything better
 Sprouts — Want to eat more fresh veggies? Grow them in your kitchen all winter long
 The Revolution Won't Forget the Holidays — A hidden gem of a dietary-restriction-friendly cookzine by Dr. Faith (did you know that she's also a nutritionist and loves to cook?)
Harness Your Rage, Change the World
You know what? You're right to be angry. There's a piece in the Anger book about channeling your rage into social action instead of punching walls. Let these books give you fuel and tools to take that energy and create change:
Unf*ck Your Anger
 Street Journalist — A powerful toolkit of reporting skills for creating change and accountability in your community
 Bikenomics — The economic case for bicycling, and a blueprint for anyone to make the case for the issues that matter to them
 Katrina's Sandcastles — An account of teaching in a troubled school system, and a case study in the perils—and importance—of putting your caring into action
 Underground — A fun history of the DIY punk house show scene, showing how you can build a huge network and movement with talent and passion rather than money and corporate control
 Make a Zine — Publish your own revolution, you've got this
Unf*ck All the Things!
Here's the option for the serious Dr. Faith stans. This isn't everything she's written by any stretch, but it's enough to carry you for a while.
Unf*ck Your Anger
Unf*ck Your Brain
Unf*ck Your Intimacy
Unf*ck Your Adulting
This is Your Brain on Anxiety
This is Your Brain on Depression
 Coping Skills — Broken down into categories for different needs, from surviving the moment to shifting your perspective in the bigger picture
 How Not to Kill Yourself — Set Sytes (with Dr. Faith assist) humorously and earnestly lays out the nuts and bolts of this essential life skill
 Self-Compassion — Quickly becoming Dr. Faith's most popular zine, this one is all about getting ok with yourself
 Woke Parenting #1 — How do you raise a child to accept themselves and others, be safe around authorities who aren't necessarily on their side, and grow up to fight the good fight? (with Bonnie Scott)
 Detox Your Masculinity — Body image is a huge problem in our culture—and it affects masculine people as much as or even more than feminine people (with Dr. Aaron Sapp)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This book has already been developed, written, and edited and we're confident that it's a good book—maybe the best Dr. Faith book yet, but you can be the judge of that. 

As for producing the actual book, we always print in the USA (rural Illinois, to be exact). So we know that even the threat of tariffs that is causing worry and upheaval in the rest of the publishing industry won't affect our costs or timelines. And our printer does a good job making books that look and feel great.

Our 24 years of experience have taught us that unexpected pitfalls can always happen, but we're confident that we can roll with anything that goes wrong—and we'll keep in touch with you the whole time to let you know what to expect.

Thank you for joining us as we figure out how to make our brains, and the world, better.

updates.update_userinfo: A Kickstarter with 24 Hours to Go - We could use your help!
updates.update_content:
We're coming down to the wire on our latest Kickstarter, and hope you can help us out. The Gold Lyre Tarot is our first foray into tarot decks, and this divine-feminine-focused spin on the Rider-Waite-Smith deck is absolutely stunning. 
There are some amazing Kickstarter-exclusive rewards that will only happen if we get this thing funded today, so take a look and see if there's something that catches your eye! 
Thank you forever and always for your support!
-Lydia

We've all done things we aren't proud of. And some of us have really struggled to figure out how to stop doing those things, how to make amends, and how to do better in the future. 
Dr. Faith's next book, co-authored with Microcosm publisher Joe Biel, is about how to do exactly that, wielding the power of brain science to help us take back control of our lives.
It's called How to Be Accountable, and it is funding on Kickstarter right now - check it out if you're looking for answers along these lines, and consider backing it.

updates.update_userinfo: An Unf*ck Your Boundaries card game
updates.update_content:
We're dipping our toes into producing a game for the first time—the Boundaries Conversation Deck was dreamed up by Dr. Faith as a tool to spark reflection and discussion about our boundaries, needs, and consent. And we're funding it on Kickstarter for another week.
It's a beautiful deck—check it out and consider backing it, to use yourself, in pairs, in therapy, in group, whatever you've got going on.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Unf*ck this year together (yup, it's a new book by Dr. Faith!)
updates.update_content:
Hello from the home office...
We're coping this distressing new normal here at the newly-distributed Microcosm HQ by, well, continuing to work on editing, publishing, and selling books. It helps that the process is absorbing and the books are meaningful, that people tell us they save their lives, build up their relationships, give them new ways of looking at the world. They do that for us, too. So while it's not exactly easy to get up and work every day (and lets face it, some days we do play video games instead), it's good to be able to.

updates.update_userinfo: New Dr. Faith Kickstarter: Unf*ck Your Worth
updates.update_content:
Happy new decade! We're seeing it in by getting the mystery stain out of the office carpet, dusting behind the bookshelves, cleaning under the tub at home, and wiping grey layers of dust off of surfaces we don't normally glance at.
The inspiration is our next book that's currently funding on Kickstarter: Detox Your Place by Meadow Shadowhawk. It's a comprehensive, practical guide to cleaning every part of your home without making yourself sick. Good stuff, especially for the chemically-sensitive and headache-prone among us.

updates.update_userinfo: Detox Your Place is about making your surroundings healthier
updates.update_content:
"We are taught to ignore our own oppression, smile in false happiness to make our partners comfortable, our children comfortable, our parents comfortable. But oppression is trauma, and trauma can't be forever repressed. We have a right to be angry." –Ariel Gore,F*ck Happiness
F*ck Happiness—the new book we're funding on Kickstarter—is the result of Ariel Gore's fascination with the positive psychology movement, which promises—and in many ways, delivers—a scientific path to happiness. But in her reading, Gore noticed that all the big names in positive psychology were men, and that concerns that often occupy women—like parenting, caregiving, and emotional labor—were conspicuously absent from the books and studies.

updates.update_userinfo: Can you be angry and happy? A new book tackles that question...
updates.update_content:
Hi Anger backers, If you’re looking for new ways to battle (or work in harmony with) the fire-breathing monsters in your life, our next project is for you: Dragon Bike is a collection of feminist bicycle science fiction stories about dragons of course. We are funding it on Kickstarter, to help pay for printing and also to pay the contributors for their truly excellent work.
Here’s the link to check out and back the book: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ellyblue/dragon-bike-fantastical-feminist-bicycle-stories

We received the finished draft of Dr. Faith Harper's new book about BOUNDARIES and CONSENT. I believe that this is her best book yet, most timely and relevant. Dr. Faith has really knocked it out of the park to help people this time. Trista also really took the book up a notch with some of their best illustrations yet to explain these  concepts. Take a look below.
The book has one day left on Kickstarter. If we can break $16,000, we're going to add 64 pages to the book and increase the print run to 5,000. If we can break $20,000 we'll increase the print run to 7,000 copies and add illustrations. Either way, you'll get the best deal. The book will be $14.95 in stores and you'll still get it for the low, low sliding-scale price as an early backer. Is something wrong with our boundaries? Read the book and decide!

Well, a book-length antidote to unhealthy anger, anyway! We're sending out teetering towers of Kickstarter rewards every morning, hopefully soon to end up in your mailboxes.
Some of you have likely been getting your books already! If you're sharing on social media, feel free to tag Dr. Faith (@theintimacydr pretty much everywhere) or us at @microcosmmm (twitter) @microcosmpublishing (fb) or @microcosm_pub (ig). We also like the hashtags #unfuckyouranger and #microcosmpublishing . We love seeing you enjoy your new books!

[Comic panel text reads: Hardcore Anxiety is a non-fiction graphic novel about my own experiences in both punk rock and mental health. In the book we hear about bands like Black Flag, Fugazi, The Clash, Ramones, and so many more.]
Hardcore Anxiety opens with Reid about to go on stage with his band in a bar in Evansville, Indiana. Some writing on the bathroom wall sends him into a downward spiral that results, ultimately, in this thoughtful, well-researched story of the connections between punk rock and mental health, in his own life and for well known bands.
In graphic novel form, he brings to life punk's ability to express the rage, anxiety, depression, and insanity we experience is matched only by the power of music and community to make life worth living after all. 
A bunch of different bands are highlighted, especially their struggles with mental health, as well as their helpful and hopeful messages.
It would be hard to tell this story without the late, great Ramones.
Metal band Life of Agony plays a pivotal role in the narrative.
The narrative is held together by Reid's discovery of the amazing community and confidence he tapped into discovering punk
And the difficulties of trying to be part of a community that can't always provide the support he needs
About the Author
[Comic text panel reads: My Name is Reid Chancellor and I wrote and drew this book. I am an artist and musician from Indiana. This book is super personal and I am truly proud of it.
Reid Chancellor is an artist, writer, and musician from Evansville, Indiana. He draws comics and does freelance illustration for bands. You can follow his work on all social media platforms @reidchancellor. He currently lives in northwestern Kentucky with his wife Kristan and two cats Buffy and Willow.
About the Publisher
[Comic text reads: Joe Biel, CEO: "I founded Microcosm 24 years ago to publish books that would help keep people like me alive. Books that put the power in your hands to create the world that you want to see." Elly Blue, co-owner: "Now we're based in Portland, Oregon with a staff of 14, three million books in print, and a huge catalog, too. We're proudly independent!"]
About the Rewards
The book itself!
Hardcore Anxiety: A Graphic Guide to Punk Rock and Mental Health by Reid Chancellor is a 6x9 inch, 192-page paperback non-fiction graphic novel, printed in the USA.
Exclusive band posters!
We asked Reid to create color posters from the book to showcase some of the bands who are included. He's made four so far (and if these first four are popular, he'll create more!). These 12x18" posters are exclusive to this Kickstarter project, so you won't be able to get them after it ends!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once, over a decade ago, one of our graphic novels was misprinted and we lacked the experience to negotiate the situation. The result was a huge loss, both financially and artistically. That was one of the many mistakes we've learned from over 24 years of publishing books. By now, we have a very good knowledge of how to handle all the risks and challenges this work that we love throws at us every day. As in all of life, being prepared to rise to any unexpected occasion is what helps us succeed.

updates.update_userinfo: A feminist look at mental health!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
We hope you're doing well and coping ahead as we move into that always-troublesome holiday season. We have a couple of pieces of news that might cheer you, in a dark and twisty sort of way.
First, we're Kickstarting a new book about mental health! Ariel Gore's F*ck Happiness is a thoroughly-reported, lyrically-told account of gender and mental health. She asks the question, what does it mean to  be happy, when all the research about happiness skews male? The result is compellingly readable, fascinating, and has real implications in all our lives. !

updates.update_userinfo: Dragons and unions (a new book and a call to action)
updates.update_content:
Hi all, We have a new book coming out that we think you might love —something a little different this time. It’s fiction! Science fiction and fantasy to be exact! About dragons. And bicycling. And feminism.  We are Kickstarting it now, check it out and back it here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ellyblue/dragon-bike-fantastical-feminist-bicycle-stories  
Also. There is a real life story playing itself out right now. Some of Kickstarter’s workers, for whom we have huge respect and with whom we’ve worked happily for years to bring our weird and wonderful books into the world, are trying to unionize. Not for their own selfish reasons, but because they want to ensure transparency and accountability for this platform. The company’s leadership, however, is fighting this effort tooth and nail. The organizers have asked us *not* to boycott, but to demand that the higher ups voluntarily recognize the union. You can do that by emailing thoughts@kickstarter.com, reaching out to @kickstarter on social media, and/or signing this petition: https://forms.gle/1PYrM1ecUuQLKSgRA

updates.update_userinfo: it ain't over until the last roadie has their book
updates.update_content:
Wow. What a journey we've been on together. We launched. You backed. The books shipped. Fun and Hardcore Anxiety were had by all. But maybe, somewhere, somebody was left behind. They didn't get their copy. They haven't yet experienced the fun because the postal system (or maybe us, we are not infallible, despite our best efforts) GOOFED. If you still don't have your book(s) yet- please email sidnee@microcosmpublishing.com. She'll get all your Hardcore Anxiety based needs sorted and addressed. 
Also if you've got Hardcore Anxiety, you might want a different variety of help that we would love to provide-  (We really want to reach our stretch goal to play pen pal matchmaker so help us, help you, ...and us.)

campaign.story:
Drunken Cat Comics has been creating comics in Central Ohio for 18 years and this Kickstarter will help to put the finishing touches on some of our longer running endeavors. Once successfully funded, we will print the complete 13 issue collection of our original crime series, Ruffians. It will also help publish, Last Call,  a collection of previously unpublished comics from our old website. Finally, we will be using the funds to print the first run of a brand new auto-bio comic by Brian, entitled Devil's Milk. 


Ruffians
Ruffians is a crime comic about a blue bear hitman named Scar seeking revenge on the murderer of his best friend. This book brings together the entire gritty ordeal, from the discovery of Black Jack's body to the bullet-ridden final showdown. 
The comic began life in 2006. Having just graduated from art school in Cincinnati, Brian found himself out west in San Diego. By day he worked at a camera shop, and by night, he wrote and drew the adventures of Scar. Originally conceived as an ongoing series, 10 years later and back in Columbus, Ohio Brian inked the last panel of the 13th and final issue of his crime drama comic. Now we bring all 13 issues together for Ruffians for your bookshelf, so you can read the entire saga of Scar's pursuit for justice. 
What people have said:
"Ruffians is the kind of book that has the potential to appeal to everyone from superhero-obsessed fan folk to jaded indie fans, from “cute critter” enthusiasts to teenagers who shop at Hot Topic." - Popmatters.com
"...you can't for the life of you stop reading it!" - Small Press Newsroom
"To say that Ruffians is a fun read is to demean it and over-simplify the concept of the series." - ThePullBox.com
"I absolutely loved this comic." - TeamHellions.com
"...ambitious, intriguing, smart, and features impressive art, crisp dialogue, solid characterization, and expert story construction." - FourColorApocalyspe.com
"...really entertaining and has a little of everything from violence, witty dialogue and characters that feel unique and relatable." - ComicBastards.com 



Last Call
Originally conceived in 2012 as a means to draw more attention to the site, The Daily Shot was a single panel comic posted every day on the Drunken Cat Comics homepage. Over the years, the format and posting regularity would change until the site eventually relaunched in 2015 with a regular multi-panel comic format. 
Last Call is the sequel to 2014's critically-acclaimed collection, Never Stop Drinking. It will collect the remaining unpublished comics from the site's original posting cycle, as well as some new strips, into one book. 
This book will also include the out-of-print mini comic, The Life and Death of Mr. Burger, a comic that dares to ask the question "what happens when a good burger goes bad?" and caused one reviewer to state, "I didn't like the potty jokes or prison rape jokes or setting cats on fire. But I did like when the burger tied a girl on the train tracks while dressed as an old-timey villain."


Devil's Milk
Finally, Devil's Milk continues Brian's series about adulthood and all the fun and frustration that comes with it. 
We last left our hero with the birth of his newborn daughter, Izzy, and this book will pick up where The Big Year (our last successful Kickstarter) left off.  Brian's first two award winning auto-bio comics received rave reviews and this book will continue the story of his life as a parent, father and comic creator in Ohio.

Comics in this book will include tales about:
birth
living with a newborn
crying
the joys of sleep deprivation
raising children
coffee 
pooping and dirty diapers  
living with cats
the joys of communication
gardening
Mother’s Day
the discovery of hands
rolling over
tacos
first steps
and all the other things that make life worth living

What people have said about Fear of Flying and The Big Year:
"Fear of Flying needs to be put next to Blankets on the graphic novel shelf.  Its a beautiful open examination of what we all feel and a much needed positive note at the end to help other believers carry on." - TeamHellions.com
"I laughed, I cried, I felt the feels... The beautiful life experiences he illustrates, from the mundane to the miraculous made me a little more hopeful about the future and my place in it." - EvetteMakesThings.com
"Canini, to his credit, manages to pinpoint and accentuate the joys and quiet triumphs of everyday life in a manner that feels unforced and maybe even a bit charming." - FourColorApocalyse.com

updates.update_userinfo: We'd love to hear your thoughts on the books
updates.update_content:
Hi there, Kickstarter Backers!
At this point, everyone should have received their backer rewards. If you haven't yet, please let us know.
We hope you enjoyed which ever book (or books) to chose and we'd like to take this opportunity to thank you again for your support, we couldn't have done it without you. We'd love it if you could help us spread the word. We're also pleased to announce that Devil's Milk and we're currently in the process of getting available through Amazon too.

Hello again Kickstarter Backers!
At this point, everyone's rewards should be in the mail. The only exceptions are those of you who ordered custom art, as we are still working on that, and the few of you who have yet to fill out the Backer survey. If you haven't filled out a backer survey yet, please do so now:)
If you have digital rewards coming your way, you should have already received a download link from WeTranfers.com. If you haven't, please check your Spam folder.
Other than that, if you've received your books and enjoyed them, please let the world know and consider writing a review on Amazon.

Hello all you wonderful backers!
Great news! This week all the books will be arriving from their various printers. We just received Devil's Milk and Last Call yesterday and are expecting Ruffians later on this week.
Which means that we'll be sending out everyone's rewards next week! So if you haven't completed a rewards survey yet, please do so now.

Hello all you wonderful backers! 
Never fear! We haven’t forgotten about you. We’ve actually been hard at work trying to get you the best product we can. This has involved several test prints of a few of our books. We didn’t feel comfortable sending out the first few versions of some of the books that came back from the printer. But we are getting closer to a final product that we will be so excited to get out to you.

Hello again Kickstarter Backers! Just wanted to give a quick update on where we're at.
We sent out reward surveys at the beginning of the June, at this point most of you have responded. If you haven't, please do as soon as you can. If you selected a reward tier that gets you a character pinup, please let us know who you'd like us to draw for you.
Outside of that, the process of getting the books setup for the printer has been slower than we've liked but, the books are moving along. Two of them (Ruffians and Last Call) are at the printer now and we should be receiving proofs at some point this week. should be going to the printer next week. That being said, assuming things continue the way they are now without any further hiccups, it's looking like the books will be sent out at the beginning of August.

Hello again Kickstarter Backers!
We did it! Thanks to your generosity, we will be able to publish and widely distribute our three new books! We cannot thank you enough! Without you, we wouldn’t be able to realize our dreams of bringing these books to our friends and followers. Our readers are the reason we continue to do what we do.
So what now? Well, Derek and I will continue diligently putting these three books together and we'll be posting updates here to keep you all in the loop. As for you, all you have to do is sit back and watch your email box. We’ll be in contact with you about the best way for us to get you your goods and, for those of you who have pinups coming your way, what character you want us to draw.

campaign.story:
About the Project
Aeonian is an ongoing series. This campaign is for the first issue, which follows a family who has had a taste of living an extended life, but are looking to solidify their grasp on living forever. Issue one follows the family as they struggle with outside sources, and each other, to reach their goal. 
Who is their "guest", and what secrets does he hold? 
Blending mythology, horror, and sci-fi, this arc will leave you asking yourself, how far would you go to obtain eternal life? 
Cover for Aeonian #1
Why Kickstarter?
I have been working in comics for over three years, and this is my first Kickstarter.  I made the decision to bring the series to this platform for two reasons: to allow readers to pre-order the book before it goes to conventions, and to make it easy for me to reach my readers across the country, as I can't travel as far as I'd like to for conventions. Plain and simple. All funds from this campaign will go towards production of the second issue, and printing the first issue. 
Artwork from Issue #1
Page 1, art by Stan Yak
Page 1, colors by Robert Nugent
Page 2, art by Stan Yak
Page 2, colors by Robert Nugent
Page 3, art by Stan Yak
Page 4, art by Stan Yak
About the Team
Writer and creator, Stefani Manard
I am a writer. I love animals. I wear onsie PJs and binge-watch Black Books. Follow me on Instagram @stefani_manard for pics of my Rotties, conventions, project updates, and other random happenings. Previous projects include Secrets Best Kept, Psycho Path: The Collected Series, and The Last Heist, all of which are available in reward tiers for the campaign! 
www.stefanimanard.com
Stan Yak, Artist
Robert Nugent, Colorist
Hello everyone, I am Robert Nugent, the crazy colorist of this intense book. I’ve been working in comics for 8 years and I hope to do this for many more years to come. I’ve worked with many independent publishers including Alterna, Source Point Press, Vulture Comics, Broken Icon Comics, Forge Creation, Advent Comics, among many others. In 2016 I won The Best Colorist award at Alternate Showcase of Animation and Comics poll awards. 
Robin Jones, Letterer
 Rob Jones is a Letterer and writer of comics. He has worked for Image, DC Thomson, BHP Comics,  Humanoids, and multiple small press and indie comics. He is a member of Madius Comics, a UK comic collective and can often be found shouting madness into the digital void at @RobJonesWrites on twitter. He is often mistaken for a Yeti, wandering the Yorkshire dales and enjoys various flavors of crisps.

campaign.story:
Vagabond Comics is an all-ages, independently published comics anthology based out of Cleveland, Ohio. Vagabond was created in 2015 with the intention of providing a welcoming platform for comics creators of a variety of backgrounds and skill levels to share their work, and since then we have grown into lively community of contributors, collaborators, and supporters both locally and internationally.
Kindred cover by Stephanie Haught
Since Vagabond's inception, we have released 9 issues featuring over 40 artists and writers, with the number of contributors growing with each issue. With "Kindred", our 10th issue, we wanted to celebrate the sense of community and family that has come to define us. We asked contributors to reflect on what family means to them, and the result is 17 comics from both new and returning contributors spanning a diverse range of both styles and subject matter. 
The contributors for this issue include: Kate Atherton, Duncan Barton, Sequoia Bostick, Brienne Broyles, Vanessa Cardinali, Julia Coffin, Allison Gajewski, Brian Gleine, Cassandra Harner, Clare Kolat, Thomas Masaveg, Kristin Ousley, Ashley Ribblett, Mike Rickaby, Alyssa Alarcon Santo, Rachel Smith, Dan Rafter, Lucy Rose Till-Campbell, David Waldman, 
cover by Stephanie Haught
Below are examples from some of the comics that will be included in this issue:
Excerpt from December by Lucy Rose Till-Campbell
Excerpt from Super Wrestle Battle by Duncan Barton
Excerpt from The Minotaur Makes a Friend by Dan Rafter, Vanessa Cardinali, & Mike Rickaby
Excerpt from Looking Forward to It by Sequoia Bostick
Excerpt from Blood by Cassandra Harner
Excerpt from Weekend with Dad by Ashley Ribblett
We typically fund everything out of our own pockets and with earnings from shows, but with the higher costs that come with color printing, we need your help. We are asking for $3,500, most of which will go directly towards printing the books, and the remainder being set aside to cover shipping, Kickstarter fees, and the creation of rewards. 
All backers that pledge $5 or more will receive a PDF version of Kindred.
$12 will get you a physical copy of the book, along with the PDF version.
For $20 we have a merch package that includes a digital and physical copy of the book, along with an enamel pin, button pack, and a Trashcan Fire sticker. All backers who pledge $20 or more will also have their names featured in a thank-you section in the back of the book.
Merch Package
Exclusively for this campaign, we will be offering a variant cover version of Kindred featuring art by our pal and guest artist, Heather Mahler. There will be a limited number of these available in a $20 tier that also includes an enamel pin, button pack, and Trashcan Fire sticker.
Variant cover feat. art by Heather Mahler
We have two $30 options available, both including rewards specifically created for this campaign.
The first includes a screen-printed tote bag with art by longtime Vagabond contributor Clare Kolat, featuring characters from her comic "Let's Go!" created for Kindred.
Tote bag feat. illustration by Clare Kolat
The second includes an embroidered "Vagabuds" beanie, designed by Vagabond co-creator Amalia DeGirolamo.
Vagabuds Kickstarter exclusive beanie
For $80 you can get the Editors' Choice Package, which along with the book includes three of our favorite previous issues of Vagabond, everything included in the merch package, and a surprise merch item.
Editors' Choice Rewards
$100 gets you both physical and digital copies of a subscription to all books released in 2019, the vagabuds hat, the tote bag, the merch package, and a honorary Trashlord plaque.
Trashlord Rewards
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All art and comics from contributors is created and in hand, meaning that content for the book is already guaranteed. And with nine previously published issues and one successful Kickstarter campaign under our belt, we've proven ourselves capable of following through with completing a project.

The production of the books and some of the merch is being carried out by local companies with whom we have already established relationships with, and much of the merch has already been produced. 

If there is any risk that delivery of rewards will be delayed, clear communication with backers is a priority for us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Ah, Inktober, the artist challenge where you make a new ink drawing everyday during the month of October. This year, I did it!
Usually, someone on social media makes a prompt list of suggestions. And I'm sure they put a lot of thought into that list...
I ignored them. Because I wanted to draw gods and spirits.
Hi, I'm Kelci Crawford, and this is a relaunch of Gods & Spirits: A Sketchbook on KickStarter!
Why a relaunch? Because the first time around, the goal was a bit too high and the timeline too short. The demand for the book was there – there just needed to be some adjustments.
What's this campaign for? Well I'm looking to put these Gods and Spirits into a sketchbook to sell to backers and convention goers alike.
Now don't worry - these gods and spirits already agreed to get drawn, so I don't have to wrestle them into a book.
Here's the breakdown of what's needed:
$150 for an ISBN and Barcode
$95 for printing 20 books
$130 for shipping to backers
$140 for miscellaneous or emergency (this goes to KickStarter’s use fee, international shipping, ink cartridges, and/or art supplies used to make commissions)
Rewards include early-bird specials, commissions, and even copies of the previous Inktober book, Witches: A Sketchbook.
There are also prints available:
(Left: "The Forest Spirit." Right: "Buffalo God" limited edition. Both 11x17 inches)
Plus there's a new reward that wasn't in the last campaign: an original 11x17 inch piece of art that comes framed. It's called, "The Horned God," and was the basis for some convention merchandise that's now out of print:
STRETCH GOALS:
In the initial run of this campaign, stickers were part of the reward structure. This has been changed so stickers are now a stretch goal.
If we make it to our initial goal, extra funding will go towards printing THESE stickers through StickerMule:
In the previous launch, I mentioned that if you were a U.S. citizen and you voted in the midterm elections, you would get a bonus reward in your backer package. I still plan to honor this commitment, so if you voted, send your "I voted" selfie to kelci@kelcidcrawford.com.
As always, Patrons who support me on Patreon will get extras in their packages when they also back this campaign.
This campaign is going to be short, so if you have the means to give, please do so!
If you’re broke, please share this campaign with your friends! Every share helps more than you know.
Thank you very much for checking out this campaign!
You. Are. Awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a relaunch of a campaign that ran last week - if the goal is not met this second time, I'll consider the project dead and move on to the next one.

That said, if we do meet our goal, awesome!

I've had six successful campaigns before this one, so by now I know what to expect and how quickly to deliver things. But as long as backers reply to their surveys ASAP, their rewards will be sent out sooner - the goal is to get 99% of all rewards sent out before the holidays.

If we reach our goal and then hit our stretch goal, stickers will happen. I have never printed stickers before with StickerMule, but hopefully it won't be too challenging.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A portion of Our Proceeds raised through Kickstarter will be donated to WWF and their Anti-Poaching/Conservation programs across the globe. But more of that later, let's get to the meat and potatoes of this thing!
Issue 1 Cover
 The Bells of Hell aims to tell a tight story inspired by the Christian Apocalypse through a horror perspective grounded with intimate characters and brutal imagery. 
What would our world look like when millions of people vanish overnight?
In the most literal sense, millions of people have vanished overnight without a trace. Mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, school teachers, pastors, policemen, mailmen, firefighters, judges, lawyers, etc... Without any rhyme or reason the ones we love most, have vanished into thin air. To make matters worse, political tensions are on the rise as the leaders of the world struggle to make sense of what has happened and to find answers for those of us left behind. 
Alongside a confused populace and rising political tensions, a new population has begun to rise from the very soil beneath our feet to replace the millions of people that have disappeared. 
Enter... The RAVAGER demon
As the political leaders of the world grasp at straws for answers, thousands are brutally killed and pursued by the plethora of demonic forces that have crawled their way up from the pits of Hell. Finally released from their confinements in the darkest corners of the abyss. 
And for those who are lucky enough to evade the initial wave of lesser demons released from the pit... we are only safe for a small window of time. After all, four legs are faster than two...
Enter the Bloodhounds of Hell
 HELL HOUNDS are brutal creatures that never stray from the pursuit of their prey. Once a Hell Hound catches your sent, she holds it for life and you will always be on the run. They will never stop or give up chase. 
Hell Hound
 In this grizzly landscape, we will follow the story of Lucas Callahan. A former U.S. Marshall who finds part time work in New Mexico as a private investigator. When the world is turned upside down, he will struggle to make it back home to his family in this new world where every new sunrise brings with it a new set of challenges and malicious threats to confront. 
You can never really know... Who's who?
 With demons possessing and wearing our bodies like human meat suits one can never really be too sure who they are dealing with...
Human Meat suit
 The Bells of Hell has a host of characters to introduce right off the bat with Issue 1 of 3. A personal favorite of the creative team is known simply as... The Butcher. 
You friendly neighborhood Butcher
 Formerly known as Bobby Mclair to the locals of Pinewood California, Bobby was the last one on the local Police radar when folks began to disappear from their small cozy town tucked away inside a quaint fishing village on the coast. 
Bobby served on the neighborhood watch, was a retired veteran, and a member of the local youth church programs. On the surface he was an upright and outstanding citizen. 
He often donated truckloads of meat to the local homeless shelters...
Free of charge.
Long Pig on the Menu...
 Bobby was eventually apprehended but released after serving five short years due to a technicality on the prosecuting attorneys behalf. Once released from Prison, it was more of the same. 
Marshall Callahan's five year old son would pay the price this time.
Lucas would be blamed by his wife for his lack of oversight and the disappearance of their child. After Marshall Callahan takes matters into his own hands the rampage of Bobby Mclair is finally brought to an absolute end...
Marshall Callahan is forced to resign from the force after 7 years of loyal service and faces a divorce from his wife of ten plus years. 
The only upshot? At least the butcher is dead and gone. 
But in a world were evil is rising from the pits of Hell is it rational to believe that the life of Bobby Mclair has truly been ended? 
Time to play
VARIANT COVERS: 
Variant #1 featuring our Arch Angel Michael
Variant #2 featuring our Hell Hound
Variant #3 featuring our REVENANT demon
 And our final variant is of course.... THE BUTCHER
Final Variant
 In conclusion, if your into dark horror stories, we may be the fit for you. Issue one is a part of a 3 story arc involving our retired U.S. Marshall Luke Callahan as he struggles to grasp a foothold on reality in a world that has been turned upside down, and infested with demonic forces of malicious intent... all the while wondering if their is a higher power at work or have we all just been forgotten and left behind to die? 
Early concept art
 The first Issue is black & white inks completed by one artist. The story was conceived by a group of individuals more than a decade ago and is finally being brought to fruition through a concentrated effort and support through crowdfunding programs such as Kickstarter and the wonderful community that exists within it. 
We are truly exited to bring this story to life all the while supporting our local ecosystems and wildlife across the globe. We will be working in conjunction with Print Ninja to publish this comic and the proceeds (after publication fees, mailing, and team fees) will go towards WWF and their wildlife conservation/anti-poaching efforts across this wonderful planet. Our wildlife is not unlimited and they need our help to ensure their future for many years to come. 
For over 50 years WWF's mission has been to save and preserve our wildlife. It should be noted that between the years of 1970 and 2012 our wildlife has seen a decline of almost 60% due to numerous factors including illegal poaching, deforestation, climate change, and a host of other issues. If you have don't have the time to support our venture here on kickstarter, we still encourage you to visit the link below and give back to our local wildlife. Any little bit helps!
https://www.worldwildlife.org/initiatives/wildlife-conservation?_ga=2.43927458.646815929.1530898297-982485145.1530898297&_gac=1.162452942.1530898297.Cj0KCQjwpvzZBRCbARIsACe8vyIA-Tx60lHmOecfIL0KxNWTDRnoEOS_bd-Or26wwp7x5lt9D_R5pMMaAnsdEALw_wcB
 With that being said, thank you for your time and considering our project as your next crowdfunded comic! On behalf of Subpar Comics enjoy some of our early concept art and original pencils!
Adios!

Risks and challenges
The only risk is not taking it from our point of view. You risk living a life where you never really tried. As previously stated, this story has been clogged in our drain for over ten years now. It's high time we get it out and share it with the public! Through the continuous questioning and pondering from our friends and families we were eventually prompted to quit talking about the "one day" project and to try and get this thing funded. 
And we found a great reason to do it by donating part of the funding acquired here to support and save our wildlife!

We hope you will join us on the journey!

Best,

campaign.story:
Sunrise parts the night-heavy clouds like a fresh razor, and I say to you, "Good morning."
Let me introduce you to twelve tales crafted to frighten you in bright spaces. Don’t bother leaving the lights on, for oftentimes the worst of what the world has to offer comes cloaked within the brightest shaft of sunlight. 
Though the terrors of formless darkness are infinite, there’s a special horror out there held within each day. From the peculiar stranger behind you on a morning run, to your family beach vacation that refuses to end, these twelve tales will have you fleeing the light for the numbing embrace of night.
Image from "The Account Of Gavin McNabb"
In between painting and creating graphic novels I often find myself drawn to writing short works of horror fiction. The twelve terrifying stories in Darker In The Sun are not your typical "bump in the night" type tales, oh no, their horror goes far beyond simple fears in the dark. They've been hidden away for far too long, they're hungry now, and it's time to let them out to play.
The Book!
A selection of stories included in Darker In The Sun: Stories Of Daytime Horror: 
“Beyond The Verge” - A Marshal in 19th century Texas is charged with the territory’s first census. Too bad the job isn’t as easy as it seems. 
“Repast” - Two estranged men reunite after decades apart to remember a friend that died. So what if their memories of that fateful night don’t quite match up? 
“The Account Of Gavin McNabb” – The crew of the Polyphylax is restless and eager to leave the secluded atoll where they’re moored. Tensions threaten to boil over while a Naturalist makes a terrifying discovery. 
“Come Away, O Human Child!” – A pacifistic father hunts an inhuman creature through the forest, convinced it kidnapped his beloved daughter. To what ends he does not know. 
“Matchmaker” – Tara just wanted a meditative bike ride on those beautiful old country roads. A simple question from a stranger sets her on a path toward pure evil. 
Image from "Repast"
I have illustrated this book in a style I think you'll find befitting the sometimes rough, often brutal, and always dark nature of the stories. The twelve main illustrations in the book will also be printed in a small postcard set available in the "Whispers In The Evening Heat" tier and above. Send one a month to your mom and creep her out for a whole year.
Image from "Come Away, O Human Child!"
I'm asking for $2500 to cover the printing costs of a luscious limited edition, softcover run of Darker In The Sun, BUT I have all sorts of frills planned if we can hit funding early and push through my fantastic stretch goals. Namely converting all editions to hardcover, larger print run, a book of additional artworks, and even...drumroll... the possibility of a SECOND collection of short horror stories reaching publication SIMULTANEOUSLY! 
*Notes about commissioning artwork, or buying artwork used in the book*
The best place to see current artwork used in this book and other future horror projects is to visit: instagram.com/maxdowdle/
Commissioned drawings can be in pencil or pen and ink.
If you have any questions at all about any specific pieces please contact me and we can sort out prices/payment. If you'd like to take a look at more of the work in the book specifically, or a better picture of anything on Instagram contact me. There are also a number of small pen and ink drawings available on Instagram that sell for $25 individually. If you have any interest in them we can feed the sale through the Kickstarter. I'm willing to work with you! I love for all of my art to find good homes.
As far as painting goes, check out the work at: maxdowdle.com, and in the lower portion of the Instagram feed.
I have no doubt I can bring any idea you have to life with paint, so if the final painting tier (Full Fiery Immolation) appeals to you then please contact me and we can discuss your commission.
Click here to be taken to Artagem.com to download an advance copy of one of the stories in the collection: Beyond The Verge by Max Dowdle
Thanks!

***UPDATE***
1] The first 100 backers will get a very special treat: a thirteenth story and illustration! This applies to digital as well as physical copies.
2] STRETCH GOAL # 1 reached: All books will be printed with premium quality materials. A bonus postcard image will be included in all tier # 2 and above reward packages!

updates.update_content:
Hello, Everyone! 
I believe all the printed editions have reached their destinations. For the international backers, I apologize for any delays, it's always dicey working with international shippers. If by some chance you have not received your print copy, either because I did not yet get your survey information, or because there was some shipping hiccup, please let me know.
Now, everyone who purchased a PDF version should have received an email from me. Check the email address you requested it be sent to, and check your spam. Please let me know if you have any troubles.

They're here, everyone! They look and smell (ahhhh fresh ink) great! Thanks again for the backing and patience it took to bring this project to light. I've already started packing them up and the first ones should hit the mail tomorrow or next week. It will take me a bit of time to get through them all, so just look out for a little darkening of your mailbox over the next few weeks.

Hello Everyone,
Been a long time. I had to change horses midstream and figure out a new printer when the old one I'd chosen went belly-up (oops!). Anyway, love the new guys, who are right here in-state. I have the proof in hand right now, and it looks/feels fantastic! Here's a pic of the unbound baby:

With a great sigh of relief I can say that the editing is finally, finally, finally finished. Who knew editing a book while renovating a house could be so time consuming? At any rate, the final format is nearly complete and I will be delivering the files to the printer likely within the next few weeks. If all goes according to plan we could have the books in hand by the end of September. Wouldn't that be sweet?
Surveys just went out as well, so make sure you fill those out with the juicy info I need to get your books to. ESPECIALLY you friends who will have acknowledgement in the book. I cannot send the files to the printer until I have all your surveys back. I'm giving this a two week window before I go to print. ;)

We did it!

Wow, what a great turnout! I can't believe the energy around this project. So cool, so amazing, so fantastic: I'm talking about all of you. Thanks again for being a part of my bid to get these creepy/nasty/fun stories out there *ahem* into the light.
So, what now? Well I have a handful of stories going through their last editing stages and then it will be off to the printers with the whole batch. I am NOT printing in China this time, so there won't be a five month wait for the books. I expect, if everything goes accordingly, I'll have the whole shipment back here by the end of August, which means I can start sending everything out by early September. 

Look out for the backer survey at the beginning of August. Right now, I'm going to take a much needed break and clear my mind before jumping right back in. Thanks, Everyone, you're the best!

Wow, we just broke through $4k today which means we're getting really close to our next stretch goal. This is going really fantastic, and I just want to thank everyone again for all the awesome work you've done sharing this project and making it so successful so far. 

As an added bonus I'm having an art sale right now on dark pen and ink drawings. These measure about 4" square, and are drawn on a really fantastic antique rag paper. They're only $20 apiece, but that deal runs out when the Kickstarter campaign ends. These are all one of a kind, not prints. If anyone is interested in a bonus original piece of art just bump up your pledge by $20, let me know which you want, and I'll drop it in your package along with all your other goodies.

PDF Level backers, if you're interested in any of these drawings, shipping is free in the continental US. If you're international message me and we can work something out.

Onward to next Tuesday. The finish line is in sight. Thanks, everyone!

updates.update_userinfo: One Week Left and First Stretch Goal Reached
updates.update_content:
Good morning, everyone!
There is one week left, and I couldn't be happier with all the fantastic support and attention this project has garnered so far. Thank you all so very much. This has all been possible only because of all of you awesome backers showing up and sharing it around!

SO, since we reached the first stretch goal all tiers above tier # 2 will be getting a bonus postcard image included for free! ALSO, I'll be using the VERY BEST selection of materials for . I cannot wait to get this book in everyone's hands. It's going to be gorgeous!

updates.update_userinfo: The March Toward 100 Backers and A Thirteenth Story!
updates.update_content:
The Kickstarter is chugging along steadily, there's two weeks left and I couldn't be happier, BUT I want to crack the 100 backer mark.

So, here is incentive : FOR THE FIRST 100 BACKERS I will be including an exclusive 13th story, entitled "The Weeping Gods," along with my book of short horror stories. That's right a 13th story and a 13th illustration. This applies to digital and physical copies of the book. Thank you all for the massive amount of sharing of this project so far, and if you know anyone else that wants to get into the fun for as little as $5 for a digital copy, or $10 for a real, live book then let 'em know what's what!

ALSO: I have adjusted the final tier to a smaller painting. is now only a $250 buy-in for a 12" by 18" painting of . Something more affordable and still really, really special!

The Kickstarter for Darker In The Sun is fully funded and there's still 20 days left! Thank you all for hopping on and ordering copies early. You've all been the very best backers with support, sharing the project, and getting the word out. You don't know what this means to me!
Oh, and who wants stretch goals? I have stretch goals. Let's see how high we can get this thing to go!
