campaign.story:
The Night Dad Came Home!
     Welcome to Night Of The Living Dad's, the comic where khaki's and combovers get a deadly makeover! I'm Jeffrey Scott, creator of NOTLD, and who just happens to be deathly afraid of scarecrows. Allow me to introduce you to my latest terrifying tale;
                                       What the Comic's About!
        Old Farmer Dan is gentle soul, content to tending his land, sipping on his moonshine, and living his last days in peace. But between the local hard partying teenagers and crazed, gun toting rednecks, poor Dan can't even get a good night's sleep, let alone the life of leisure he desires.
     Fed up and pissed off, Dan decides to put the fear of god in these kids the way he knows best (besides toting his shotgun). Scarecrows dressed up as any teenager's greatest fear; an angry Father! 
      But when an actual group of angry father's die in a nearby fiery explosion, things begin to take a terrifying turn. For you see, those dead dad's ashes hold a strange and awesome power.....and led by the fearsome Pumpkin Face, Dan's Scarecrows begin to take on a life of their own.
            Where Did The Idea Come From?
    Previously me and Yakov Levi, whose comic Tales From The Whorehouse of Horror I've written for, were trying to think of a scarecrow based story for that publication. While we couldn't find a story that fit the tone of that particular series, I still loved the idea of killer scarecrows. 
       Scarecrows always scared me as a kid (and honestly, still a little now). Contorted limbs, beady black eyes, expressionless features; they're the stuff of nightmares. 
        Taking away the talkative types like Freddy Krueger, most of the great slasher villains have one thing in common; a mask that obscures their features, leaving blank terror where a face is not. Scarecrows don't even need a mask. Their face IS the mask!
    We needed a reason for the scarecrows both to come alive, and have a desire to kill teenagers. The old slasher tropes of sex and trespassing felt a little tired, so I wanted to give it a spin. Who hate's teenage boys more than anyone else on Earth?
      Angry Fathers, especially redneck angry fathers! One explosion later and  you've got four furious ghosts to possess four terrifying scarecrows. 
 Finally, since the majority of the story is set on a farm, it made sense to make the protagonist a farmer. I've always loved the elderly nutty character in horror movies (think Crazy Ralph in Friday the 13th) and thought it would be a lot of fun to turn one into the hero. Hence, the creation of Old Farmer Dan. 
   The goal for this comic is tell a classic horror story in a new way. Horror is in a pretty good place right now, but there's still a glut of demonic possession, paranormal haunting, and torture movies crowding market. While I enjoy all these genres, they aren't the kind of stories I wanted to tell. Hopefully Night Of The Living Dads can deliver something different, in all its pumpkin headed, blood soaked burlap awesomeness.
                       WHAT YOU GET
The most important part of any crowdfunding campaign is what you're going to get for you're money. I tried to price fairly here, while still charging enough to get the money to get this book made. 
$5-Digital Copy $5 will get you a digital copy of the book, sent upon completion in the summer of 2018. While the book's still currently being drawn, you can expect 22-25 pages of Scarecrow Slaughtering madness, delivered right to your email upon completion. 
$10- Print Copy Get a Print Copy of Night Of The Living Dads. Right now this is going to be a very small run, and this Kickstarter very well might be the only place you're going to pick up a physical copy of the book, at least for awhile. 
$15- Signed Copy And A Signed Poster For $15 I'll sign your book and toss in a signed poster of the cover. Fair warning-my handwriting's the kind that would kill a man if I were a pharmacist. 
$25- Variant Cover $25 will get you a limited edition signed variant cover edition of the comic, the normal signed comic, and a signed print. For comic completionists.
$50-Cameo Get a cameo scene in the book. Ever wanted to see what inked immortality felt like? Now you can! Includes everything in lower perks as well.
$30-$100-Advertise We're dedicating four pages of the book to advertising. $30 will get you a quarter of a page, $55 half a page and a $100 a full page. Includes everything but the cameo.
                 Meet The Creators
                         Jeffrey Scott-Author
          While Night Of The Living Dad's is my first solo comic, I've been writing comics for about 2 years now. I've co-written 6 stories with the brilliant and twisted Yakov Levi over at whorrorcomix.com (huge nsfw warning). Despite some initial setbacks, we successfully funded and released a printed anthology of those stories last summer, Tales From The Whorehouse of Horror #1.
      In addition, I'm also the founder of Head On A Stick Productions, with which i've produced such comics as The Circus of Reefer Madness and Slashermania, as well as such films as Don't Fuck In The Woods and Betsy. I'm publishing NOTLD! under Head On A Stick Productions as Well.
    I've also been in horror journalism for a number of years, currently writing weekly articles over at horrorfuel.com and being named a 2017 horror journalist to watch by Horror Freak News.
   Other than writing a bunch, I watch a lot of movies (especially 70's and 80's horror), read a lot of books (especially horror comics and true crime), and generally try and live as fun a life as I can. I hope that fun shines through in my comics. 
                                          Rick Hershey
Rick Hershey is an illustrator, graphic designer, writer, and tabletop game publisher. He has worked in the gaming industry for nearly 20 years providing work as a freelancer for a multitude of clients including Wizards of the Coast, Dreamworks Entertainment, Pinnacle Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Steve Jackson Games and many more. Mr. Hershey currently owns and operates Fat Goblin Games.
His art really brings Night Of The Living Dads alive, and I couldn't have asked for a more talented or fitting artist to draw these pages.
                                    Thanks For Checking Us Out!
Even if you don't contribute to the campaign, thanks for taking the time to check us out. If it weren't for readers like yourself, this comic would never have happened.

This isn't my first time publishing a comic, and everything so far has gone smoothly. There's no reason to believe Night Of The Living Dad's won't be a success as well.

campaign.story:
ALL WE EVER WANTED: STORIES OF A BETTER WORLD is a gorgeous, full-color anthology packed with stories told against the backdrop of a brighter future and featuring some of comics' hottest talent of today and tomorrow!  Curated and edited by Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Poser) & Eric Palicki (No Angel, Orphans), and published by A Wave Blue World, the book's loaded with 25+ stories meant to inspire us and restore the belief that a better world is possible.  You won't find any dystopian nightmares here. 

Think more Star Trek, less Mad Max, more Caprica, less Battlestar Galactica.  More "San Junipero" Black Mirror and less every other Black Mirror.  You get it.
cover art by Ariela Kristantina
Sample page from "Everything I Own" by Lela Gwenn, Tony Gregori, and Josh Jensen
Sample page from "It Looked Like Our Dreams" by Maria Fröhlich
Sample page from "Owning up to the Past" by James Maddox, Gavin Smith, and Nick Wentland
Sample page from "The Pilot" by Dean Trippe
Bookplate art by Marie Enger. Limited to 50 green and 25 orange. Signed by many creators (see tiers on right for details)
Everyone who backs the project will have the option to include their names in the "Thank You" section of the book.
The book has a publishing home at A Wave Blue World, who will cover pre-press and printing costs.
Special thanks to Clan of Xymox for letting us use their song "A Day" in the KS video: www.clanofxymox.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between Eric Palicki, Matt Miner, and Tyler & Wendy Chin-Tanner, we have 12 successful Kickstarter projects that were funded and then fulfilled to backers. So while the biggest risk to most projects is flaky Kickstarter creators, that's not us.

We are incredibly comfortable with the Kickstarter platform and what it takes to deliver to our supporters and we have a long track record of success to prove it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Just want to let you know that due to the overwhelming response to ALL WE EVER WANTED, we've launched the campaign for the sequel, MAYBE SOMDAY.

Hey, everyone. Eric here.
I wanted to make one last-minute plea for anyone who’s enjoyed the work Matt and I have done, alone (No Angel, Fake Empire, Liberator, Poser, etc, etc) or together (All We Ever Wanted, This Nightmare Kills Fascists) to check out Matt’s new project, Death Trap.
Matt’s graciously invited me to contribute a backup story featuring the amoral circus performer/fish woman, Aerwyn, and my yarn is going to be just as bananas as what Chris and Matt are building in the central tale of a revenge-seeking woman and her haunted car.

updates.update_userinfo: Just launched on KS: DEATH TRAP! (and it's f'n wild fun!)
updates.update_content:
Hey All We Ever Wanted backers,
Matt Miner here, and I just launched DEATH TRAP on Kickstarter.  It's absolutely wild and fun and a bright spot in an otherwise dreary existence as of late.  I urge you to check it out and help us over goal!  You don't want to miss this!
Earlier today, I realized this book is entirely created by folks who were in All We Ever Wanted.  I'm writing, Chris Peterson (artist/writer of the "Una" story) is on art, Josh Jensen is on colors and Matt Krotzer on letters - it's like an All We Ever Wanted class reunion!

Hi Everyone,
Wanted to spread the good news that ALL WE EVER WANTED was nominated for a Ringo Award for best anthology.  So once again, a huge thanks goes out to all of you for believing in this book and helping make it happen!
If you're an industry pro, you can vote for the Ringo Awards right here.

Hey Gang,
Quick note to highlight a new Kickstarter I (Matt Miner) am contributing a story to.  This is a big one and is gonna be SO cool - a metric ton of talented people sharing 9-panel stories to help you nail a new skill.  Learn how to do all kinds of rad stuff from folks who have it down pat.

updates.update_content:
Hey y'all,
When we started making this book we all knew it was turning into something incredibly special.  Creators were connecting with the concept and giving us their best work, wanting to put out a positive and shining example of the kind of hope that comics could give, and when we got it all together and looked at the final book we knew it was something magical, something really unique and exciting in a landscape of otherwise dreary post-apocalyptic comics.  ALL WE EVER WANTED shines bright with dreams of a better world.

Hello Backers,
Just a quick update to let you know that our latest anthology project is now live!
DEAD BEATS KICKSTARTER PAGE
"Dead Beats" is a music themed horror anthology with a ton of talented creators involved. Just check out the cover:

Hello Backers,
Thank you all for your patience. At this point, pretty much everyone should have received their books. It took us a while to get through all the international shipping (those customs forms are only getting more complicated and I had to fill out most of them by hand).
The only shipments left are a couple of the book packs and a few of the sketch rewards. Sorry if that's you, we promise to get them out as soon as we can. If you didn't back for one of those reward tiers and you still don't have your book, please contact me or double-check that you're filled out your survey.

Reason for kickstarter 
The reason for this kickstarter is to help with the funding of the team, variant covers, printing and shipping cost. The guys are putting out some great work and I really want to make sure they are properly compensated for it. 
Story 
It's been a rough Winter and Spring. You have bills due and families to feed and the cold is not leaving fast enough. You are wishing for a change. WELL SUMMER HAS ARRIVED!!
 No school, no homework !! Just fun in the sun and delicious cold Ice cream from the friendly neighborhood ice-cream man.
 We all have heard the sounds of the ice-cream truck coming down the streets of our neighborhood as children. We dashing out to be the first to enjoy the sweet taste of the orange Sherbert pop.
 AHHHH ! GOOD TIMES....
 THIS UNFORTUNATELY IS NOT ONE OF THOSE TIMES!!
What if the local ice-cream man was a serial killer who killed innocent men ,women and children. Using their body parts as new and delicious ice-cream toppings.
Oscar Pinto alternative cover
TEAM!
Bradley golden, creator and writer
Andrey Lunatik, pencils
Mickey Clausen, inks and colors
Hector Negrete, letters and logo design
Oscar Pinto, original cover artist
Carlos Tron, alternative cover

updates.update_content:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1513753746/these-damn-kids

In a small town in Vicksburg, Mississippi the children have been exhibiting strange behavior. There have been reports of parents being attacked by the very children they raised. Some have even gone to school to try and kill the teachers and faculty. The town sheriff has brought in a young rookie cop, Gary Marshall, to help with what's going on and hopefully get to the bottom of why it's happening.
The kickstarter for THESE. DAMN. KIDS is live. It's a prequel to LEAVE ON THE LIGHT.
Digital pdf have gone out to backers email. Print copies are on their way.
Rewards for this will begin going out February. Backers will receive an extra gift for being so patient with me. Thank you. Life has hit me hard.

Hello everyone, thanks for backing this project. THANK YOU. I wanted to let you all know I'm feeling a bit better and I have a new kickstarter campaign launched. If you like my work and horror chrck it out. It's called LEAVE ON THE LIGHT. The proceeds will go towards the team and to help me with my surgery. If you pledge you will get extra incentives since you backed both my kickstarters. I'm a man of my word guys. Please help this kickstarter out to help me out. Oh, your ice cream man rewards will ship first part of February through Kablam printing with extra stuff in it.

Hello everyone, I want to. Thank you all for being so patient with me while I get through this little illness and I hope you are all doing well. This is a very important announcement. The ice cream man comic will be published through Antarctic Press in thier horror Anthology, it will have a new name called Cold Blooded. You all will still get your rewards from the kickstarter with a copy of Antarctic Press anthology release as well. This is because you all been so patient with me.

Hello everyone, I want tok give an update on what's been going on with me and the story. First off I changed the name from Timmy LaLa Ice Cream to Blood Pop. Legal reasons. Also, I been in and out of the  Hospital for my heart and lungs. That is what out things on hold for a little while until I get back on my feet. Good news is the book is complete and edited. I'm asking for everyone to be a bit more patient with me please. Thanks for yiur time. Stay Demented!! !
Great news I just got the black and white proof pdf of the comic to read through make sure things flow well. I'm doing my edits as we speak. So this should be completely done by Sunday.
We have one more colored page to go then off to the letterer. Moving along for that Halloween release.

Hello fans, thank you for being patient with me and the team at getting this project out to you. The book will be inked and colored fully by next Monday. After that is only the lettering and editing to get done. So the middle of September the book should be complete. I'm looking at mid October and halloween it will be sent out to backers. Thank you again.

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS:
$1000 - *UNLOCKED!!* 10 more Validation updates + $400 stipend for Christian
$1500 - *UNLOCKED!!* 5 New Roxie comics + $600 stipend for Christian
$2000 - *UNLOCKED!!* 10 Roxie comics + an even higher stipend for Christian!
$2500 - PDF of Mr. Dino & Friends' children's book
Validation has been an ongoing comic for the last 5 years, chronicling the adventures of Ally, a transgender girl and an enormous nerd. She is doing her best to live a fulfilling life. She plays tabletop RPGs like Tiny Unicorn, attends comic conventions, and of course, has her Mesozoic life companion by her side, Mr. Dino, the dinosaur plushie.
Christian and Kelci love to make this comic, but we need your help to wrap up the story.
 “Wait a second!” you might be saying. “Don’t you have a Patreon page to help you fund making this comic?” 
Yes, we have a Patreon page, but it doesn’t make enough to pay both Christian AND Kelci for producing this comic. Keep in mind that Christian has been paying Kelci out of her own pocket to produce the art for this story every week for the last five years. Patreon has been helpful to reimburse Christian for some of the cost, but it’s not enough to continue this series at its current level of funding. That’s why we’re running this super-short KickStarter campaign.
We need your help to wrap up Validation with a bang!
You might ask “Is this end of stories featuring characters from the Validation universe?” No, Christian and Kelci still want to explore this world. It is the conclusion of Ally’s adventures. There will be other stories told in comic form, and now also in prose.
By pledging to this KickStarter, you’ll not only help Christian and Kelci make these final pages, but you can also get prints and books as a reward. Or commissions. Or get drawn into the final strips!
Here's a look at some of the rewards available:
And here's how the funding is going to be divided:
$300 for producing the art ($30/page x 10 pages)
$100 to Christian for writing stipend
$100 for shipping costs and miscellaneous fees.
If you can pledge, that's amazing! If you're broke, please share this campaign with your nerdy friends. Every share helps.
Thank you for checking us out.
You. Are. Awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not the first campaign that Kelci or Christian have run. They are fully prepared for shipping, delays, and other beasts that appear on the KickStarter horizon.

Fulfillment of orders will fall 99% on Kelci (as Christian gets the script ready for the end of Validation, and handles whatever responsibilities are demanded from her day job).

Kelci is also in the process of two comics-based commissions outside of Validation. At least one of these commissions should be done by the time the campaign ends its funding period (the 1-week campaign and the 2 weeks KickStarter takes to finalize charges). But Kelci has been freelancing for 5 years now, so they know how to juggle multiple things at once. Still, these outside commissions may cause some reward delivery delays. 

This is also why one of the higher rewards include being drawn into Validation itself. Usually Kelci offers to do individual character sketch commissions, but they felt it would be better (on the time frame and on the comic) to offer being drawn into Validation instead.

Updates on fulfillment (or delays) will be posted a minimum of once a week on this campaign page, to keep backers in the loop.

New to Staunch Ambition? No problem! You can pick up all the books here, including the KickStarter Exclusive Limited Numbered Variants! (while supplies last). Already own the previous books? Then just pick up Issue #3 in both the Standard and/or KickStarter Exclusive Limited Numbered Variant.
The Synopsis:
As mankind continues to advance in scientific knowledge, breakthroughs compound, exponentially. What happens when mankind is able to transcend their physical limitations? The natural becomes supernatural. Welcome...to the new enlightenment!
Staunch Industries is the leader of technological advancements in energy, teleportation, and space travel, thereby becoming the prominent provider of Earth’s consumer energy. The "Ambition” is their preeminent space station that resides in the most hostile environment known to man, the Sun’s corona. Staunch Industries is also in the business of creating genetically engineered worker clones who possess a low-capacity for sentience. In an curious turn of events, Staunch Industries has inadvertently revealed themselves to be the subject of an outside force that has been, presumably, steering them towards a greater purpose.
Azarus, a prototype of genetic engineering, is a splice between human and animal DNA. Per the organization's protocol, Azarus and other worker clones are created without sexual organs in order to keep them isolated from other clones and to ensure they stay focused on their work.
Commander Rielle, one of the lead officers on the Ambition, was conceived naturally and destined to not receive the same social opportunities as her genetically engineered counterparts. Navigating between the true identity of her birth and adoptive parents, Rielle finds herself in the darker underbelly and larger social implications fostered by an enterprise like Staunch Industries.
Page 16 Issue #3
Who are the talented people that came together to make this epic Issue #3? For starters, we signed Clayton Crain (A dream come true)to do our cover art. Clayton is especially known for his epic Marvel covers featuring Spider-Man, Venom, and Carnage! I was first introduced to his magnificent work when I picked up his book RAI for which he also does all the interior art.
Clayton & I at Monroe Comic Con! Clayton's Cover to Superior Carnage #4
By backing this KickStarter you become part of our Creative Team;part of the crew to help us continue this EPIC JOURNEY!
Clayton Crain Cover Issue #3
Our cover to Issue #1 was created by Freddie Williams II who has worked for Marvel, DC, IDW and more. Freddie is mostly known for his brilliant work on the renowned series "Batman/Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles."
Our cover for the Preview Issue was created by Khoi Pham who has worked for Marvel, DC, Disney and more. Khoi is currently working his magic on the "Teen Titans."
Our pencils and layouts are masterfully crafted by Erwin J. Arroza. Erwin is also the artist for the fantasy graphic novel "Grinidon."
Our colors are skillfully applied by Neal Anderson bring supernatural life to our pages. Neal is also the artist for the beautiful comic book "The Chasing Arrows."
Leah Lederman, our editor, is such an important part of our team that I decided that she should also co-write the book with me. Leah is also the editor for many successful writers like Dirk Manning, Howie Noel, and Russell Nohelty.
Staunch Ambition has been a labor of love. A lot of blood, sweat and beers have been shed in an effort to create a vision that will inspire and bring together the imaginations of many. Now YOU have an opportunity to actively participate in making this dream a reality! By making a contribution, you are actively taking part in the collective imagination of creative minds; a collaboration of a select group of people, paving the way for many exciting adventures to come!
Page 15 Issue #3
A quick video of my daughter and I going over some of the rewards and our dog Mia doing an AMAZING trick!

updates.update_userinfo: Inferno City Firehouse - The Motor City Edition
updates.update_content:
Inferno City Firehouse - The Motor City Edition
OFFICIALLY LAUNCHED AND IS NOW AVAILABLE! Get the book, exclusive book, posters, music, original art, and much more at the Kickstarter link below!
A Graphic Novel that takes you inside the lives of real Detroit firefighters! True stories fused together into a breathtaking narrative! 
Click here for Inferno City Firehouse

This Friday is the big day for us, and our new project, Inferno City Firehouse. The Kickstarter kicks off this Friday, March 22 and we really need to have one solid start right out of the gate. 
Inferno City Firehouse is a graphic novel that focuses on the REAL superheroes of the world- the brave men and women who serve as firefighters. Inferno City Firehouse presents real stories about real firefighters.

While working on issue 4 of Staunch Ambition, a truly unique idea was presented to me from a fan of my book. Jim, being a firefighter, told me he wished he could find comic books about firefighters. I was extremely surprised to only find a few comics featuring firefighters.
I quickly realized this is a sorely neglected genre, to say the least!
Having a firefighter in the family, being friends with several, and working with the Detroit firefighters in the past, I believed I was not only meant to write a graphic novel about firefighters, but write one based on true Detroit firefighters. Stories that will punch you in the gut, in the right way.

The idea to do something different, new, and unique came from Jim, a fan of Staunch Ambition. Jim was buying the 3rd Issue of Staunch and he noticed a Detroit firefighter poster I was selling. Being a firefighter he said that I should do a book about firefighters. "No one is doing a firefighter book" I thought to myself, RIIIIIGHT, there are a million things I could work on and I'm already crazy busy but Jim's suggestion did get me thinking.
Out of curiosity I did some searching online to see what I could find and I found one graphic novel about firefighters. I have also seen some books for kids like Spider-man teaming up with firefighters but these are for kids. They don't touch the real powerful true life stories.
Firefighters are real life superheroes!

Thanks to all of you and hard work Issue 3 was completed and a success!
A Complete Success!
There are still a few backers that have not filled out their surveys and as a result have not received the rewards. If you fall into this category then drop me a note and I will make sure you get your well-deserved rewards.

THIS BOOK IS PRODUCED AND READY TO PRINT!
Strange things are said to occur two miles below the surface of the Archuleta Mesa in Dulce, New Mexico at the mysterious Dulce Base. Is it everything they say, or is it worse?
Marcus begins his first day at the mysterious base. With reptilians, fear deities, chimera, monsters, and a variety of races of aliens as friends; who needs enemies? Well, of course there’s one of those too!
INSTANT REWARD! We're giving away the 16-page Dulce Visitor's Guide to our backers within 24 hours of backing the project.  So you can get the inside scoop and learn about the world of Dulce prior to the release!
FAST REWARD DELIVERY! Digital rewards will be sent within 48 hours of fund delivery, and products will ship in May/June!
THE BOOK IS AMAZING! We put together an amazing cast of characters with real genuine interactions, an intriguing mysterious base, and some incredible hi-jinx.  The 20-page comic is full color!
PRETTY AWESOME DIGITAL REWARDS! Not only do you get the Visitor's Guide and the comic itself, but you also get two audio tracks of songs based on the comic.
EXPERIENCE THE FUTURE OF DULCE AS IT HAPPENS! Backers will be invited to take part in the future of Dulce by joining our secret "Dulce Basecamp" Facebook group.  Interact with creators, talk behind-the-scenes or about the actual stories that inspired this book, enjoy extra specials and perks.
WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?  BACK IT AND GET YOUR INSTANT AWARD NOW!
Eric J. Cockrell - Co-creator/Co-writer
Eric is first and foremost a storyteller. He's been publishing work since 2005, and has run three successful comic book Kickstarters that have launched 10 comics in the past three years.   
Previous Work: Blister, Defective Comics, Adhesive Man
 Gene Hoyle - Co-creator/Co-writer 
Gene finds writing to be his purpose in life. Character and world building are his ideas of a fun time. Science fiction is a personal favorite, with Gateway Runners being his first published work (2015)

Previous Work: Gateway Runners, Labyrinth of Bones
Greg Woronchak - Pencils/Inks  
Greg started of in storyboards, but decided to focus on his first love: indie comics. He's produced art for countless series over the last decade, although most haven't been published. He hopes to become famous enough to get one or two pieces of outraged fan mail.
Previous Work: Bless the Children, Hellcraft, Ravage (Primal Archetype), Mosquito-Man (CSW Comics)
Avery Ferdinand - Colors
Avery is a talented  graphic designer, illustrator, and colorist located in the Philippines.
Previous Work: Harland Buck
Michael Waggoner - Letterer
Michael is a jack-of-all-trades in the comic’s field. He has illustrated, written, colored, lettered, edited, and produced comics for many publishers. 
Previous Work: The Adventures of El Diablo Azul, Labyrinth of Bones, & World’s Edge…just to name a few.
Chuck Pineau - Editor
Chuck has always enjoyed telling stories and bringing new worlds to life. He has only recently leapt full force into the indie comics world, making a name first as an editor, and hopefully soon as a writer. 
Upcoming Work: Welcome to the Void, Belial, No Road Home

campaign.story:
Cover image
 An old man and the alien that crash-lands into his barn try to save Dubuque, Iowa...and each other. Art & music by J.R. Mounts
For every cloud...
Getting old sucks. 
Angus Hort is an elderly, retired widower. He's just received word his brother has died, and he has never felt more alone. When an alien crash-lands into his barn, Angus befriends and nurses this wounded creature, finding a reason to live. However, monsters are coming, and it'll take all his experience and wisdom to save Dubuque, the world, and each other.
J.R. Mounts, weirdo
A new kind of old story
I'm J.R. Mounts, a storyteller. I've been an independent musician and comics creator for years. I'm best known for my parody comics series, Fried Pickle Noir which is best described as "Sin City meets Veggie Tales."  I do others, of course, but that one is my meal ticket so to speak, as I'm often called "The Pickle Guy," rather than by name. It's a living, lol. Since 2010, I have traveled around the U.S. at various conventions, promoting my creator-owned indie comics. What I draw, write, and create is all-original content. My stuff may harken back to things that sound familiar, but I'm hoping to put a fun spin on everything I do.
As a storyteller, I like to mess with convention, creating things people might not expect. Rather than writing & drawing about superheroes and beautiful people, I choose misfits and characters people can relate to and care about. I've done this before in both my "Fried Pickle Noir" and "Scairy Tales" comics. One of my best works was also a successful Kickstarter-funded project called STUCK IN MY HEAD, about a happily married man with such a crappy job that all he does is daydream about killing his co-workers. Funny, profane and profound.  It was a finalist for Best Graphic Novel at the Dragon Con Awards. Find out more about those works at my website: (www.scairytalesnoir.com)
Silver Linings logo
With Silver Linings, my main characters are the elderly. I choose to emphasize the importance of respecting the elderly, who are often left to watching "Matlock" reruns and getting senior discounts. The elderly are rarely the subject of Hollywood movies or best-selling novels. In Silver Linings, we see that every old person has a story to tell and frequently have no one to tell it to.  My hope is to entertain, yet shed light on all the treasures of experience these old folks have to offer us. I guarantee, every one of them has a story or four that will amaze you. 
This will be a matte cover paperback, approximately 75-80 page graphic novel, 8x10 in size, full color.
UPDATE 1-31-18 STRETCH GOALS!
Stretch goal
The campaign has met it's goal minimum which guarantess every reward in the Kickstarter, which is the only shot right now to get a book. If the campaign reaches $3000 by February 16th, I'll create a collection of all the black & white sketch rewards in a printbook for every level that supported the book/cd set and higher. This 8.5x11 paperback can also be used as a coloring book if desired. The book will have however many pages I'm doing for all the black/white original sketch reward supporters so if I get 30 sketch supporters, it'll have 30 images, etc... Stretch goals are always tricky but since we have some time, anyone can spread the word or even upgrade if they wish to get their own original art sketch.
UPDATE 1-29-18
Here's some awesome interviews all about this new project:
 http://rsrgentertainment.com/random-sht-random-guy-episode-184-silver-linings-with-j-r-mounts/
 https://youtu.be/SI_8xfwWVAc
(Back book cover) A game...alone
The Story
In Silver Linings, the main character, Angus Hort, is a lonely old man. Years ago he was a farmer, married to his wife Katie. Since her death, and now the recent news of his brother's passing, he feels that all life around him is slowly dying and whittling away into nothing. He and the few remaining old men live in single-room condos they call Widower's Row. Angus chooses to constantly visit the porch of his abandoned house on the dead farm land he refuses to sell. Just as Angus thinks he's done with life, something crashes into his barn: an alien.
But this is no oridnary alien like he's seen in the movies. This wounded and timid being communicates to Angus telepathically. Through mental telepathy, they can convey intentions, feelings and images, creating an instantaneous understanding of one another and a way to help each other survive. Soon, Angus and his new friend, whom he'll name "Skip," for the way it walks, bond in a way Angus has never known before. This odd little being from the stars gives Angus what he's needed: a reason to live.
However, space monsters with a deadly hunger threaten to destroy the world. Soon, it'll take the ingenuity of those old coots and all their experience to defend our very existence.
It's along the classic lines of storyteling in E.T. from Spielberg or Super 8 by Abrams, only with old people. I've had the honor of knowing some of the best "geezers" around in my life. I've had them as family members, friends, clients, and acquaintances, even pets. This story is my way of honoring them all.
As I get older, I feel I can relate to this story and wanted to express how alone we could feel without someone to grow old with. Even an alien.
Angus Hort and his best alien pal, Skip (concept sketch)
 Sketches & Concepts
Angus Hort and some of the geezers he knows
  Hort Farm...the abandoned land where Angus's equally abandoned home sits. Empty since the day his wife died.
  The geezer pals of ol' Angus Hort. Pictured are Duane, Claude, Silas and Bill.
  The Broots, as in "bad roots," as Skip explains. To Angus, they're brutes of the worst kind. Hence, the play on words.
 COLOR!
That's right, COLOR. Not only will this book be my first completely sequential art epic, this also marks the first time I've ever attempted to do an all-color project. Color scares me. Black and white is much easier for me to manipulate, since it leaves much to the imagination, whereas color is one-and-done as to explaining what you see. However, I really think Silver Linings calls for color to convey the emotion and weight of the story in a way I've never done. I've always said that if I wasn't scared, I wasn't trying my best. So, to stay true, I'm pushing my boundaries once again for what I think may be my best story yet. This one should have me scared outta my wits.
I was inspired to try out watercolor specifically when I had the fortune to appear at Dragon Con and saw my neighbors, Carla Wyzgala, on one side, and Caleb King behind me. Not only were these two simply amazing talents at watercolor, they were just awesome people whom I'm honored to call my friends. Add my Copic markers and my fascination with the watercolors of Mike Mignola (Hellboy) and Bill Watterson (Calvin & Hobbes), and it was only a matter of time before I'd try to find my own color "voice." Time will tell.
Skip and the Broots, the species he's come from.
  Watercolor test for possible interior page.
   Crayon test for coloring Skip
 MUSIC!
Cd art for front/cover
But wait...there's MORE! This project comes with a full score of music, written by me, with orchestrations and performances by two of my best pals, Mike McQuade (piano) and Tom Mathes (percussion). All original music. Acoustic instrumentals that are the score to this poignant story. I love music and the way it affects film. No Spielberg movie would be the same without the melodies of John WIlliams. Here, I'm attempting to convey emotions and actions for each page without a single lyric. 
My best music mates Mike McQuade (left) & Tom Mathes (right)
Here's ROUGH basic garage guitar/drums demos of what to expect melodically. The actual tracks will have acoustic guitars, piano, fiddle and drums. 
"Silver Linings"--This is Angus Hort's theme and title theme of the story. It's a play on words from the classic expression that there's always a positive way to look at everything, such as "every cloud has a silver lining."  This whole story is about the importance of appreciating the elderly. Grouchy Angus Hort learns this for himself as well, when an alien from space gives him a reason to live life to the fullest.
  "Pulling Yellow"--This is Skip the alien's theme. This song captures Angus bonding with the alien he calls Skip, who communicates with him telepathically through feelings rather than words. These emotions create  back-and-forth mental images between Angus and Skip which convey what they want to say to one another in an instant. During this song, Angus teaches Skip how to weed the dying yellow leaves from the green, called "pulling yellow." It's a metaphor of their friendship.
   "Eds the Feds"--As in any coming-of-age alien story, there's a military faction out to capture Skip and to annihilate his species. They stand for Earth Defenders, nicknamed "Eds the Feds." Funny names or not, these guys are not to be messed with.
 "Sowing Seeds"--This is a reprise and orchestral change of the "Pulling Yellow" theme. In this melody, I want readers to picture the simple joys and quaint lovliness of life in a small town. 
There's a total of 14 songs planned. The soundtrack score will be constructed as if we were all playing in a barn or small bar area, and the only instruments lying around are guitar, piano, and drums. They'll convey a range of emotions without the use of anything electric...a real challenge for me!  
Rewards
As in any campaign, your support will not go unnoticed! Here, I've cooked up all kinds of ways you can support Silver Linings. Refer to the "Rewards" section to the right, but below are samples of some of the rewards I'm offering for each level.  You can find samples of my older work on my website at www.scairytalesnoir.com.

MAIN GOAL UNLOCKED!
**STRETCH GOALS**
UNLOCKED! $650 - More copies of The Case of the Wendigo printed PLUS KickStarter-exclusive Angelic Clow mini-print and 5 pages of the follow-up story Dance Around the Maypole produced.
UNLOCKED! $950 - More copies of The Case of the Wendigo printed PLUS 10 pages of Dance Around the Maypole produced.
$1250 - More copies of The Case of the Wendigo printed PLUS 15 pages of Dance Around the Maypole Produced
On Halloween night, Charlie & Clow protect their city from a roaming wendigo. This story ran as a webcomic from October 2016 until January 2018, with 65 pages of full-color urban fantasy action, as Charlie & Clow team up with a demon and his witch lover on their butt-kicking romp.
And now, The Case of the Wendigo is coming to print… if we meet our fundraising goal!
“Hold it!” You might be saying. “Who the frick are you to ask for money for a book like this?”
I’m Kelci Crawford, the creator of the Charlie & Clow adventures, including The Case of the Wendigo. I also created other projects and got them funded on KickStarter (here’s the KickStarter pages for Seeing Him, Johnson & Sir, Thoughtful Dinosaur, Validation Buttons, and the latest project, Witches: The Sketchbook). So this isn’t my first KickStarter rodeo, y’all.
What this campaign is aiming to do is raise funding for getting The Case of the Wendigo to print. This 70-page book will include fancy additions like:
retouched and remastered comic pages 
a showcase of how a page gets made, from script to final design 
behind-the-scenes sketches 
character biographies
and other goodies!
Here’s what we’re looking to get funding for. Brace yourself for numbers:
at least 30 copies of the book 
$35 for set-up fee with the comic book printer 
$30 for shipping the books to me 
$150 for shipping the books to backers 
$50 for miscellaneous fees, expenses, and other things that might pop up.
(You may have noticed that an ISBN and barcode were not included. That’s because Witches: The Sketchbook raised enough money on its campaign to cover the cost of the ISBN/barcode for this campaign.)
Now here's the stretch goal(s): My friend Chloe and I want to make a one-shot comic starring Claudia and Acrudon, the resident witch/demon couple of The Case of the Wendigo, and extra money raised in this campaign can help towards fairly compensating Chloe for her work during production of this short. (Here's a KickStarter update on our agreement)
If you can give, that’s fantastic! If you’re broke, please share this campaign with your urban fantasy-loving friends. Every share and every little bit helps.
Thank you for your support!
You. Are. Awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As mentioned, this isn't my first KickStarter case. I know to expect the demons of Printing Errors, Shipping Costs, and Delayed Reward Fulfillment.

The first two demons can be easily slain. The third will take dedication on my part, especially since a good portion of these rewards are commission-based.

There is also the issue of remastering the comics pages. They won't be redrawn from top-to-bottom, but there are some that will require heavy doctoring. This will be worked on as the campaign is running, and if pages are still not finished, that will be announced when the campaign ends.

At any rate, any snag in operations will be posted in update form here on the KickStarter page, to keep backers in the know.

updates.update_content:
Previously, I announced that the extra funding raised for The Case of the Wendigo would be used for a project called Dance Around the Maypole. However, that project has been cancelled, elaborated on in more detail in this post.
So where will the extra funding go?
Well, after a public poll and receiving feedback from you, we agreed that half of the $325 or so leftover would be split in two. Half would go to a charitable cause related to Native American and/or Black Lives, and the other half would go towards production of a new story.

updates.update_userinfo: Dance Around the Maypole is Cancelled. Here's What's Next
updates.update_content:
The short story Dance Around the Maypole, about Acrudon and Claudia in the events after The Case of the Wendigo - has been cancelled.
Chloe and I came to this decision because of a few things:
First, neither of us have worked on this story for nearly 3 years. If a story has sat on the sidelines for that long without any progress, even small progress, that says to me that the story has moved on. Second, we've both been working on other projects. Chloe herself has a full-time job, while I've been working on comics AND with the crew over at NeverEnding. And third, at least for me, I feel that the characters of The Case of the Wendigo have finished their stories for the time being. Maybe they'll be revisited, but that time for revisiting hasn't arrived. For now, these characters need to rest.

updates.update_userinfo: Build Your Character - And Animate Them - in NeverEnding!
An Update on Dance Around the Maypole - the Follow-Up Story
updates.update_content:
Hey-o! I wanted to post an update on the development of Dance Around the Maypole, the follow-up story to The Case of the Wendigo.
Dance Around the Maypole is a short story focused on Acrudon & Claudia, the demon and witch of The Case of the Wendigo. Dance Around the Maypole follows their story after the events of Wendigo, as the duo attend a spring festival.
The idea came when my friend Chloe and I talked about what would happen after the events of Wendigo. And since then, we've been working on development of the story.

campaign.story:
You’ve tried all the latest and greatest fusion food combinations and they’re just not painting your palette with zing! 
The perfect Taco or The Burger to Beat Them all still eludes you. Some would say they both only exist in your dreams?! Well at least on that front I can help you with that! Hey friends, fiends, and forlorn Unicorn People, my name is J.M. Hunter and I’m an artist.
More importantly, I’m the creator of Odd Tacos and Bizarre Burgers Art and Illustrations.
Odd Tacos and Bizarre Burgers got Its start with me wanting to draw some funky, funny images and tap into the pop-surrealistic parts of my creativity. So, I asked a few friends on my Facebook and at art jams to give me around three objects, items, and/or subjects, and I’d draw them as a theme represented in a taco or burger. 
Can you imagine what they came up with?! Tony Danza, Servo, Pirates, and even a Chevy were soon combined into various Odd Tacos and Bizarre Burgers.
   Now I’d like to share this collaborative fun project with you! This is a chance to get original artwork in your hands at a great discounted price! Some of the rewards offer YOU, the chance to customize your own commission. If you’re looking for a great, novel gift for the friend or family person that has everything, hit them with an Odd Taco!
 Got someone in your life that could use a good laugh or likes weird and quirky gifts? I think our Bizarre Burger option with a side of ink and color could satisfy that rumble! 
On the chance that playful, quirky food art isn’t your thing there’s also a lower-cost reward option that comes in the form of a fully-rich colored pastel character of your choice! Almost any character is on the table as I’ll work to render your favorite cartoon or character with beautiful Prisma color nu-pastels. 
 These are premium quality regular chalk like pastels that deliver creamy colors and bold blends! Utilizing my take on characters and cartoons, I’ve drawn more of these than I can count, (don’t ask me to count please!)! The pastel character commission comes at the size of 11x14 and fit most frames of the same size w/o an issue. 
  They’re a chance for you to have an original piece with some life and texture to it and makes for the great gift or conversational piece.
If you pledge early, there are a few limited spots where I’ll contact you earlier to collaborate on the concept of your choice so that way we’ll work to get you your commission by Egg Nog and Epic Return line day! 
Hurry as there are only a few limited spots for each of these early bird specials! 
We also have a few digital rewards for those that want to just pledge a few bucks to help. If you’re also curious to see all the weird, wacky concepts that come out of a project like this then the Best of Odd Tacos and Bizarre Burgers is the digital wholesome goodness for you!

One more tier after that and there is also a collection of characters, cartoons, and creatures rendered by my left hand wielding a furious range of pastels! Two digital pdf’ hi-res and ready to pop off your screens!
 So... let’s break this down meatloaf style eh? 
Digital Reward Levels

campaign.story:
WE DID IT!
Thank you to all our amazing backers! Final Hours Stretch Goal Surpassed!
Once the campaign is over, you can continue to support this project by clicking here. Thanks! 
You got us to goal with time to spare and then zoomed right past it. If we make it to our stretch goal, I will make you a supercut of all the #CatsOfSelfishLife. A SuperCat, if you will. Need I say more?
We are in SALON!! Thrilled to be interviewed in Salon about not having children,  pronatalism, and why a woman is never too old to be criticized for her choices. 
Lots of great press! Thanks to Salon, Kveller, EcoSalon, Ravishly, Nylon, Bust Magazine, Real Simple, Grok Nation, Out of the Box Podcast, We're {Not} Having A Baby, New York Women In Film and Television, Laura Carroll, Flight and Scarlet, The Rinky-Dink Life, The Lux Letter. 
Hi there! That's me by the Old Stroller Corral in my hyper-family-friendly neighborhood
Why is our society so terrified by women who want to control their bodies and their lives?
My name is Therese Shechter and I'm making a documentary about choosing not to have children in a culture where motherhood feels mandatory.  
There is so much judgment and stigma towards people without children!! We've been called selfish, immature, immoral, unnatural. Yes, people can be rude, but why are they so rude? My So-Called Selfish Life will shine a light on the powerful cultural and historical forces behind the message that every woman’s most important (and perhaps only) role is to reproduce.
Having children is still the most admired thing a woman can ever accomplish, the thing that gives women their value. Who profits from that, and what we can do to shift that conversation?
Along the way, we'll introduce you to the funny, moving, and sometimes incredible stories of a diverse group of people including: 
a Red State couple under pressure to procreate from unexpected sources
the childfree founders of a LGBT seniors' community 
a college student on a 5-year quest to get her tubes tied 
an artist and rapper searching for her Golden Girls family
and a woman whose unsuccessful fertility treatments led to a life transformation  
You’ll also take an irreverent trip though the worlds of history, politics, pop culture, pregnant Barbies with removable bellies, Bonobo aunties, social media MommyJackers, and "ubermother" Ivanka. 
As a woman who made the decision to remain childfree, I am also walking this road–and I want to bring you along for this pivotal journey. This is the third documentary in my trilogy about women and identity, which includes I Was a Teenage Feminist and How To Lose Your Virginity. 
Read more about our very talented human and feline team here, including gifted cinematographer Iris Ng (who would make this film all about cats if we let her).
BUT, HERE'S THE THING: If we don't reach our goal, we don't get the money. If we don't get the money, we can't make the film. We're counting on you!
***
That feeling when...you want to tell the Stork to take a hike.
Did you know that having children is the only way for women to reach their full feminine potential? No? Me neither.  
In 2014, almost half of all American women between the ages of 15 and 44 had never had children, an all-time high. So, why is choosing not to have children seen by so many as a threat, a decision made by the immature, the unfeminine, the selfish? 
We live in a world where femininity is tied to childbearing, where reproductive rights are under constant attack, and where society demands women have children–but only if they are the “right" kind of women. 
This is a conversation about gender, class, and race, and how that defines women's identities and places value on female lives. Want to know more?
First we have to reach our Kickstarter goal to get the money we are raising. Please help us reach our goal and make this film!
***
Shanthony models her Golden Girls rings in a scene from our film. Get your own ring by backing this project (check out Rewards to your right)!
We're listening to you. All 3,748 of you! 
My So-Called Selfish Life bubbled up out of the hopes, frustrations and energy of the 3.748 of you who responded to a survey we created to learn about your experiences. YOU inspired us, contributed ideas, shared love for the Golden Girls, and became subjects. YOU have helped us tap into a hidden and powerful reality of life for people who don't want children, and into the shame and silence of going against the mainstream. This film belongs to YOU. 
My first documentary I Was a Teenage Feminist ignited a movement to redefine feminism for the 21st century, and How To Lose Your Virginity sparked conversations about sex in communities all over the world. Our new project is no less than incendiary! 
Calling all cat ladies, favorite uncles, crones-in-training, and the people who love you! We can't make this film without your support. Back this film to make it a reality!
***
Poet and Memoirist Molly Peacock in a scene from the film. Get a signed copy of her childfree memoir by backing this film!
You have the power to change the conversation!
There is little if any funding for independent media that focuses on the lives of women, especially a film that asks the questions about motherhood that you’re not supposed to ask. You have the power to challenge the way we think about women’s roles in society, by making a generous donation to fund the creation of this film.  
Most of our money so far has come out of my pocket–but now I'm out of resources. Your backing will help us raise the $42,000 that will take us to the next level.  
You can donate as little as $1 or help by spreading the word to everyone you know using the SHARE button! Every dollar, post, email and tweet gets us closer to our goal. This is not just a film, it's a movement. 
What your support will provide:
We will finish filming with our far-flung subjects this winter, and create a rough cut in spring and summer of next year. Having a rough cut in hand will be the crucial next step to getting significant finishing funds support and international distribution deals so we can complete the film in 2019. Through this process, we will continue to build a platform to tell your stories, amplify your issues, and grow this movement. 
We are thrilled to be at this point in production. Thank you for helping us get to our goal and get this film into the world. 
–Therese, Iris, Marin, Eryn, Chanel, Jason, Melissa, Patricia, Marj and the whole Selfish cast and crew!
***
Some of our fabulous rewards:  
      ***
What people have said about my previous documentary, How To Lose Your Virginity:
“Shechter’s movie, with a breezy, watchable, funny delivery, walks us through the simple argument baked into the very term virginity — one that we still use freely — the idea of a woman’s body as an object for transaction.” — Salon

"A breath of fresh, comedic air." — Tribeca Film Institute Blog
“Smart!"— Elle Magazine“
I learned so much and felt validated in many of my private feelings. What a gift that is!" — Karen, Audience member
“We were so thrilled to partner with Therese to host a screening of her amazing documentary" – Planned Parenthood of New York City
Learn more about How To Lose Your Virginity here
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been a documentary filmmaker for 17 years and this is my third feature-length documentary. I ran two successful Kickstarter campaigns for my previous film that raised a total of $50,000. We have a talented and experienced crew, and an enthusiastic and fascinating group of subjects. 
Creating independent documentaries can be challenging because they are expensive to make and can take years to produce. This successful campaign will get us to rough cut stage in Fall/Winter 2018, the crucial step in attracting significant finishing funds support and international distribution deals. A work-in-progress sometimes experiences unforeseen delays in the schedule, so we'll keep you updated every step of the way! We love making documentaries that are both entertaining and conversation-changing, and we're excited to do it again!

*All physical pledges now come with a free sticker and print.  Look below for new add-ons including a t-shirt and 3 art prints for just £15*
Kid Monkey: Unarmed and Dangerous #1 is a superhero action horror comedy tale set deep in the heart of the 80s. By deep in the heart of the 80s I don't mean I'm tugging on your nostalgia heartstrings by wedging Pac-man in there every 5 panels, I mean that it's set in the same world as every 80's action and horror film.
Half man, half monkey, all hero, Kid Monkey is the bioengineered weapon your parents warned you about.
Following in the vain of heroes such as Spiderman, Deadpool, Daredevil and Nightwing. Kid Monkey comes right at you like Robin grew up and did the nasty with Howard the duck. Which somehow resulted in a half man half monkey superhero type thing.
Huzzah!
My name is Kiiiiiiiiiiiiiid!!!
Created by scientists, Kid Monkey just found out the brother he thought had been dead for the last decade was very much alive, but it wasn't the family reunion he was hoping for. 
Thinking he had been abandoned by the Genesis Project and left for dead, Kids brother brought the project to an end. By end I mean he killed all the scientists and beat the hell out of Kid.
Now Kid Monkey finds himself sad and alone in the big city. The world he knows has gone but what new crazyness awaits? Time to find out in UNARMED AND DANGEROUS #1.
Below are the first four pages of this new tale.

What is Frankenstein For Mayor?
 Frankenstein For Mayor is 76-page comic book about partisan politics.
Transylvania is not the territory you know. Situated around a castle, this Transylvania has endured for centuries under one man's rule, Count Dracula. The city has grown divided over time by three factions. The vampires have become the upper class and rule in their own favor. The witches have stopped voting since the leader of the coven was taken by the Nazis during World War II. The werewolves live in the outskirts of the city and are continually oppressed by the vampire police force. 
Myron, son of the Wolfric who is head of the werewolf clan, has demonstrated and stirred the city to unrest. To peacefully quell any rebellion, Dracula has decided to hold the first election in Transylvania's history for mayor of the city. Unfortunately,  Myron has been charged with killing another vampire while in werewolf form. With few other options, Wolfric has asked Indigo, head of the witch's coven, to resurrect Frankenstein in hopes of convincing him to run in the election.
Here are pages 7 through 17 to give you a feel for the book:
                  Where is the Money Going?
The majority of the money will go to the creators of this book to help pay for Pencils, Inks, Colors, and Lettering.
As a writer, I've committed to paying for more than half of the book up front. Reinaldo and Chris have completed almost two thirds of the book to reduce any risk to you as a consumer. However, I'm just a guy with a full time job and I need your help to bring this project to fruition.  
A portion of the proceeds will also go to the initial print run. The printer we will be using is Ingram Spark located in the United States. 
The Creative Team
Jack Wallace is a writer from Columbus, OH. He’s 30-something, happily married, and finds himself inexplicably working in finance. Through the production of his first book, he created Disposable Fiction Comics, LLC. Disposable Fiction started as a group of short stories which turned in to a book which turned in to a website which turned in to a company. He can be reached at jack@disposablefictioncomics.com   
Rei Lay has a Degree in Architecture from the University of the Americas. From Chile, Rei has been drawing comics professionally since 2012 for Chile and abroad. His first job was the Genocide Omicron, a co created fanzine, designed by himself, containing two issues, both 24 pages each. This fanzine was sold out in ComicCon Chile. He has contributed with his work in Chile for Anfibia publishers and Accion Comics Editorial. He has worked mainly for publishers in United States and other clients, showing their projects to the big American publishers. http://reinaldolay.deviantart.com/
Chris Allen is a comic/pinup artist, writer, colorist, & letterer now based in Scotland. He is a huge comic book fan across all styles of artwork and genres of stories and a collector of comic books and memorabilia. Now Associate Editor and co creator of Disposable Fiction Comics, Chris is looking forward to working on exciting new projects. Chris has also worked on several kickstarter projects with Kim Roberts under the company name, Swampline Comics.
Rewards
There are several things we've created to get you interested in our campaign including the PDF of this book and much, much more. 
These Election Pins are three inches wide and perfect for showing off your complex political views at you're next gathering.
  Election Pin
These bumper stickers are 6" x 2". Perfect for covering up old political bumper stickers from lost elections or covering your laptop so the people at the coffee shop will wonder where you're from.
Frankenstein for Mayor bumper sticker
The Transylvania Times has been the only newspaper of Transylvania for years. For the first time ever, you can read the front page about big events happening in Transylvania without the danger of setting foot in city.
Transylvania Times by Steve Steiner & Jack Wallace
 We have political posters from artists that Disposable Fiction Comics has worked with before such as Horacio Boriotti and, of course, Reinaldo Lay.
Frank is Good for Our Future by Reinaldo and Chris
  Frank and Transylvania Flag by Horacio Boriotti and Chris
  Frank = Hope by Reinaldo and Chris
The last thing we have to offer is your chance to be immortalized with our cast of characters.  Send us your picture and Reinaldo will draw your likeness into the picture. We'll print it and send it back to you. Be quick, because this reward is limited to the first ten people.
It Could Be You! by Reinaldo and Chris

In April of 2018, I posted an update that all books had been shipped out. About a year and half later, I'm very happy and excited to announce that the entire graphic novel of Frankenstein for Mayor has been completed. We'll be launching a follow up kickstarter tomorrow which includes a new pin, new bumper stickers, and new pin-ups. 
Frankenstein for Mayor was always meant to be a complete graphic novel, however, to create a reasonable goal, I decided to break the book in half to make the campaigns manageable.  That being said, we will be offering just volume two for those of you that want to avoid having to repurchase the first volume. We have a lot to offer and hope you'll come check it out to see how the story ends. See you tomorrow!

Hello everyone,
Just wanted to give a big thanks again to all of you who've supported Frankenstein for Mayor. The second half of the series is still in production. That's one of comics great curses is that they take a long time to make, but a short time to read. We will keep you up to date on any new developments. Promise.
In the mean time, I've been working with three comic creators around the Columbus, Ohio area to create a free newspaper called the "Columbus Scribbler".  "The Columbus Scribbler" is a free newspaper distributed throughout the city highlighting local comics and their creators. It will promote local comic events, explore the history of comics, and introduce local comic creators. Did we mention an avalanche of local comic art? We've reached our print goal and are currently trying to fund the second issue. We hope you'll check it out.

Hi Everyone, 
Just wanted to give a quick THANK YOU to everyone who helped supported us. From everyone I do know (family, friends, fellow comic creators) to everyone I don't, we thank you. We'll get to work and keep in touch.

Editors Matt Miner and Eric Palicki envisioned a collection of stories giving contributors a chance to interpret the unease surrounding the current state of the world through the dark lens of horror.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The greatest challenge when assembling an anthology is collecting work on time from the creators, especially when many of them are contributing their work to this project at a significantly reduced page rate and have to juggle this alongside their better paying jobs in order to keep the lights on. In order to mitigate the risk of late or missing stories, we've given the contributors ample lead time to deliver their work. We hope to deliver the book ahead of schedule, but our campaign is designed with a long lead to keep from shipping the books late.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,Quick note to let you know that TNKF co-editor Matt Miner has a new Kickstarter up for a book the Westboro Baptist Church said would "split Hell wide open" (really)! 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/623055532/return-of-the-toe-tag-riot

Thanks to a very successful Emerald City Comic Con, I was able to (finally) get most of the rewards promised by contributors, and aside from a handful of sketch rewards, I've sent everything to backers. Keep an eye on your mailboxes, if you haven't received your rewards already.
Thanks again for your support and Olympic-levels of patience while I sorted out these last rewards.

First of all, thanks to all of you for your continued patience and support!
The good news is, out of over 500 backers, we're down to fewer than 20 of you who have outstanding rewards.
To those of you remaining, I can provide an update. We're still waiting on a handful of rewards to come in from those third party creators who've graciously pledged to provide books to use as rewards. They've all been (somewhat forcefully) nudged to provide those rewards. Artists have been given their commission assignments and will be providing the original art in the near future. Finally, Adrianne (recently engaged! Yay!) has decided to come TO SEATTLE to sign copies of NO ANGEL. This means all remaining rewards should be in the mail soon.

Hello, Fascist-fighters!
All orders of basic TNKF volumes, bookplate editions, and bumper stickers have been shipped. (The photo below represents the last of the international packages.)
I am still waiting on reward bundles from some of the contributors to arrive, but I’ve been in contact with everyone and they assure me your rewards are in the mail. I will, in turn, be shipping them off to you as soon as I have them.

Hello all, 
Announcing the next thing from me (Matt Miner), Eric Palicki, A Wave Blue World, and 25 teams of super talented comics creators!

project_data.project_name: This Nightmare Kills Fascists - A Comics Anthology

campaign.story:
Arnar Heiðmar and Phineas
It's 2017--well after the "trans tipping point," or whatever--and yet to our knowledge, there hasn't been an anthology of comics written, drawn, and edited entirely by transgender creators.   
We want to change that—and that’s why we’re asking for your help. 
WE’RE STILL HERE, edited by Tara Avery and Jeanne Thornton, contains fifty-five stories by fifty-five different creators (or creative teams), all of us trans, and all of us telling stories that range from fiction to nonfiction, escapist fantasy to slice-of-life memoir and back again. Here you'll find all the hit trans content you crave: the weird stuff, the stuff that goes to uncomfortable places, the stuff that highlights little-known kinks and contradictions in the trans experience, and most importantly, the stories about trans people having a good, maybe sad time. 
Big talk! But what does it mean in practice? Here's a sampling of the stories in We're Still Here:
An evening discussing the terrors of Donald Trump at a Japanese bar for trans men
A trans woman uses MDMA (with complex results)
A trans woman visits her grandmother for Christmas (with complex results)
Visual essay on sex work, trans masculinity, and testosterone 
A practical guide to using paganism to navigate workplace terror 
Trans women pilot giant robots with impeccable synch ratios 
Toxic masculinity haunts a friendship between a butch lesbian and trans man 
A devotional essay about angels beyond gender or understanding 
Two trans women named Sweetness and Lightning blow up a car, watch Akira, and live happily ever after
If none of these appeal to you, that's okay: we’ve assembled roughly 300 pages of stories from creators both emerging and established, all of them driven by effective narrative, gorgeous art, and sardonic whimsy. We intend this to be the gateway drug to trans comics: a gathering of creators that represents many of the divergent roads that trans comics in the twenty-first century might take. 
We would like this anthology to be swiftly made obsolete by many, many others like it! But the first step is to get this one done, and for that, we need your help!

We have several reasons for you!
Here's one: by backing this project, you’re helping us spread the word that the title promises: we've been here in comics for a long time, and we're not going anywhere soon. In the mainstream comics world, one of us in an anthology can too easily stand in for all of us--assuming that there's an effort to include us at all. Our hope is that this book will showcase just how diverse the body of work trans creators are doing actually is (and that it'll make it easier for future books that propose alternate, maybe better takes on what's interesting in trans comics work to exist.) 
Your pledges also help to forward the conversations between artists and their work that we need. I mean really, you guys: being trans can get lonely! And we mine some of those lonely experiences in our work, sometimes in isolation from the cis creators and friends who're working right beside us. This is why having trans friends, for a trans person, is vital. Being connected to the work of fellow creators who're hacking away at the same problems is no less vital: makes life better and proposes new possibilities and solutions all at once.
Let us get less high-minded, though! If you back this project, we can pay each of the creators involved in this book. This is not negligible! Additionally, for those emerging trans artists we feature here, you're helping to provide needed publication credits and credentials that make it easier to build careers in the editorial gatekeeper-rich comics world. 
Additionally: once the book is successfully financed and we've made back our production and editorial costs, we intend to donate some of the proceeds from each copy of the book sold to Trans Assistance Project (https://www.transassistance.org/) and Sylvia Rivera Law Project (https://srlp.org/). By helping to finance this book, you make it easier for us to do that effectively. 
We've got you covered! :D Most of the money we're raising will go to cover the costs of printing the book, and to pay the artists. 
Our base page rate for finished art from contributors, at the present moment, is $25/page. At roughly 300 pages of artwork, that's going to be around $7,500 in artist payments. Obviously this is not nothing! (But it’s short of what we’d like to be able to pay--see the section on stretch goals below.)
Beyond that, the money will go to covering the costs of printing the book itself, as well as shipping copies of the book to contributors everywhere. Additionally, we’re raising money to pay some of the incidental costs of production (including ISBNs, printers’ proofs, and a book cover.)
Here’s a full breakdown:
$7500: Artist fees
$6000: Printing & drop shipping (~1000 copies, 6" x 9" and estimated 304 pages, full-color PB)
$2000: Shipping + Miscellaneous fees
$1500: Kickstarter + payment processing fees
Total: $17000.
We will have more information about this once we've launched--the first priority is to get to $17,000! But at present, the rough expectation is that stretch goals will happen roughly every $2,500 to $3,000 above the initial goal, and each stretch goal will result in the artists' pay rate being increased by about $5/page across the board. This means that most of the stretch goal money will, to the extent that it's possible, go directly to the artists. We'll have more information on this as soon as possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We began working on this anthology way back in summer of 2016. We spent most of that year and the early months of 2017 carefully assembling our list of contributors (both from solicitations and from an open call for submissions, to try to get as many creators as possible on board.) As we prepare this Kickstarter text, the bulk of the work on the anthology is underway, with several of the finished pieces already received and others in process, with delivery expected through July and August 2017 and a projected pub date of either very late 2017 or very early 2018. 

Both editors have published professionally for some time, and it's a given--especially with fifty-six artists!--that delays will be inevitable! But we've built expected delays into our editorial and production timelines, and at present we’re on track to meet all of our deadlines for finishing the editorial and production work by early Fall 2017.

In terms of the risks of the Kickstarter itself: both the editors of We're Still Here have previously published successfully Kickstarted anthologies (ALPHABET from Stacked Deck Press and Nerve Endings: The New Trans Erotic from Instar Books.) Believe me that we are both *very, very aware* of the potential challenges involved with running a successful Kickstarter and fulfilling rewards to all backers! We’ve learned from our experiences, and we intend to keep a clear line of communication going with backers in order to ensure a smooth delivery of rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

SDP and Prism Comics team up again for an all-new anthology!
Stacked Deck Press and Prism Comics conducted a talent search for up and coming queer comics creators to bring you Crush: First Love, New Talent! This anthology features 24 stories by 24 cartoonists and creative teams on the topic of young love! Co-editor Viktor Kerney and I made a special effort to front load representation from creators of emerging identities. campaign.story:
City of Lost Souls is a critically acclaimed horror comic from writer, James McCulloch and artist, Janine Van Moosel set deep within the heart of Edinburgh, Scotland.
Serial killer Matt Jordan kills his final victim before killing himself... but death is not the end. He wakes up to find himself in his own personal hell surrounded by the people he killed. Freed by Soul Collector, Soku, he discovers the only way he can live in an afterlife free from his victims is to find the mythical City of Lost Souls.  
As if that wasn't hard enough he also finds himself being hunted by creatures from the other side, determined to bring his soul back to be tormented. With nowhere to hide and no idea where to run he must begin his hunt for the city of lost souls.
As we reach issue 5, things have taken a turn for the worse. With Matt in a horrendous position which will forever change things for him and his victims.
Below are the first 5 pages of issue 5. There are no spoilers if you have never read City of Lost Souls before but enough to get you excited if you have.
           A4 PRINT
 T-SHIRT
  "It’s horror at its purest, but it excels beyond packing a visceral punch as the story is steeped in original, engaging mythology and characters you’ll actually enjoy spending time with, even just to see what dastardly deeds they get up to next. There’s a lot going on here, and even though it’s not for the faint of heart, it’s most definitely rich in imagination. It’s a story where the violence has a warped sense of purpose, and you’ll want to read it over and over again."
5/5 DREAD CENTRAL
"Although City of Lost Souls unflinchingly showcases the utter nadir of human nature in bursts of brutal fury, the dialogue manages to mine a vein of dark humour that prevents it becoming too disheartening, while the artwork continues to delight in the gleeful depravity of onomatopoeic viscera."
9/10 STARBURST MAGAZINE ISSUE 418  
"Scary stuff. Very dark and genuinely dark. both in story and art."
PAT MILLS, 2000ad, ACCIDENT MAN, MARSHAL LAW 
"Dark, intense and disturbing. McCulloch puts the "sin" in sinister."
JOHN FERGUSON, SALTIRE 
" I can't recommend this book enough... It's dark, gritty and disturbing."
TORATHENA
"Some fairly extreme ideas are starting to roll out across the pages of COLS but there is an underlying point to it all where the worst aspects of life, death and everything in-between are laid bare for us to experience & ultimately learn from. The dialogue from James maintains the same brutal, honest and sharp edge to it while Janine’s artwork has become more highly detailed and visceral since the previous issue…..adding another unsettling dimension to Matt’s story. Grim, gruesome and great is how this all combines and this twisted tale continues to twist."
8/10 COMICS ANONYMOUS 
"A dark twist on the age-old hero’s quest but without a hero; a Dante’s Inferno without Dante and a final page that only ramps up the promise of further bloodshed in future issues... Dark in tone and in humour." BLEEDING COOL 
"What we have here in prospect is a meditation on redemption, on morality and mortality. A story that’s taking on some big, serious ideas with a punky haircut, a flick of the V’s and a whole lot of spit. It’s a book packed with ideas and quirks and charm, laced through with a wicked sense of humour and an irreverence in which it glories."
GEEK RETREAT 
"Very cool, I felt dirty reading it in a good way. A dark comic series with so much potential."
BROKEN UNIVERSE
When we reach £1700 you will get a whole other comic.  
I am part of the editorial team of Comichaus. Within that anthology series I write, Karyn Shade. A story about a female private eye from Glasgow, which is also a City of Lost Souls spin off set in the same universe.  
So for your stretch goal, I will be doing a special 19 page collected edition of the first story, Karyn Shade: Beyond Forth. If you have pledged for a print comic you will receive a print copy, digital pledgers will get a digital version.  
This collected edition will only be available to the people who have pledged for the Kickstarter. So this will be exclusive to you, it is a full story and will never be reprinted in this format.  
Written by me, art by Jessica Byrne and cover by legendary comic artist Glenn Fabry.
      James McCulloch - Writer  
James McCulloch is a film blogger, musician, and comic book writer from central Scotland who spends far too much of his time watching bad films and eating Doritos… When he’s not doing those he writes horror comics and plays bass in She Burns Red.
www.grandmasterwook.co.uk
 Janine Van Moosel - Artist
Janine Van Moosel a Freelance is Artist and Illustrator from Scotland specialising in portrait art and storybook illustrations. Working on varied projects from Ed Wicke's Wicked Tales, logos for beers, bands and has also had her artwork appear in the TV series Lewis. She has 2 cats and lives in a hoarders paradise in Dundee.
www.janinevanmoosel.co.uk
